``Potter trusted Black beyond all his (Potter) other friends. Nothing changed when they left school. Black was best man when James married Lily. Then they named him (Black) godfather to Harry. Harry has no idea, of course. You can imagine how the idea would torment him (Harry).'' (unknown)

``Because Black turned out to be in league with You-Know-Who?'' (Madam Rosmerta/Rosmerta)
whispered Madam Rosmerta.

``Worse even than that, rn`dear...'' (Fudge)
Fudge dropped his (Professor) voice and proceeded in a sort of low rumble.
``Not many people are aware that the Potters knew You-Know-Who was after them. Dumbledore, who was of course working tirelessly against You-Know-Who, had a number of useful spies. One of them tipped him (Dumbledore) off, and he (Dumbledore) alerted James and Lily at once. He (Dumbledore) advised them to go into hiding. Well, of course, You-Know-Who wasn't an easy person to hide from. Dumbledore told them that their best chance was the Fidelius Charm.'' (unknown)

``How does that work?'' (Madam Rosmerta/Rosmerta)
said Madam Rosmerta, breathless with interest. Professor Flitwick cleared his (Professor) throat.

``An immensely complex spell,'' (he)
he (Professor) said squeakily,
``involving the magical concealment of a secret inside a single, living soul. The information is hidden inside the chosen person, or Secret-Keeper, and is henceforth impossible to find -- unless, of course, the Secret-Keeper chooses to divulge it. As long as the Secret-Keeper refused to speak, You-Know-Who could search the village where Lily and James were staying for years and never find them, not even if he (James) had his (James) nose pressed against their sitting room window!'' (he)

``So Black was the Potters' Secret-Keeper?'' (Madam Rosmerta/Rosmerta)
whispered Madam Rosmerta.

``Naturally,'' (Professor)
said Professor McGonagall.
``James Potter told Dumbledore that Black would die rather than tell where they were, that Black was planning to go into hiding himself... and yet, Dumbledore remained worried. I remember him (Dumbledore) offering to be the Potters' Secret-Keeper himself.'' (unknown)

``He (Dumbledore) suspected Black?'' (Madam Rosmerta/Rosmerta)
gasped Madam Rosmerta.

``He (Black) was sure that somebody close to the Potters had been keeping You-Know-Who informed of their movements,'' (Professor)
said Professor McGonagall darkly.
``Indeed, he (Black) had suspected for some time that someone on our side had turned traitor and was passing a lot of information to You-Know-Who.'' (unknown)

``But James Potter insisted on using Black?'' (unknown)

``He (Black) did,'' (Fudge)
said Fudge heavily.
``And then, barely a week after the Fidelius Charm had been performed --'' (unknown)
``Black betrayed them?'' (Madam Rosmerta/Rosmerta)
breathed Madam Rosmerta.

``He (Black) did indeed. Black was tired of his (Black) double-agent role, he (Black) was ready to declare his (Black) support openly for You-Know-Who, and he (Black) seems to have planned this for the moment of the Potters' death. But, as we all know, You-Know-Who met his (Black) downfall in little Harry Potter. Powers gone, horribly weakened, he (Potter) fled. And this left Black in a very nasty position indeed. His (Black) master had fallen at the very moment when he (Black), Black, had shown his (Black) true colors as a traitor. He (Black) had no choice but to run for it --'' (Hagrid)

``Filthy, stinkin' turncoat!'' (Hagrid)
Hagrid said, so loudly that half the bar went quiet.

``Shh!'' (Professor)
said Professor McGonagall.

``I met him (Black)!'' (Hagrid)
growled Hagrid.
``I musta bin the last ter see him (Black) before he (Black) killed all them people! It was me what rescued Harry from Lily an' James's house after they was killed! jus' got him (James) outta the ruins, poor little thing, with a great slash across his (James) forehead, an' his (James) parents dead... an' Sirius Black turns up, on that flyin' motorbike he (Black) used ter ride. Never occurred ter me what he (Black) was doin' there. I didn' know he (Black)'d bin Lily an' James's Secret-Keeper. Thought he (James)'d jus' heard the news o' You-Know-Who's attack an' come ter see what he (James) could do. White an' shakin', he (White) was. An' yeh know what I did? I COMFORTED THE MURDERIN' TRAITOR!'' (Hagrid)
Hagrid roared.

``Hagrid, please!'' (Professor)
said Professor McGonagall.
``Keep your voice down!'' (unknown)

``How was I ter know he (White) wasn' upset abou' Lily an' James? It was You-Know-Who he (James) cared abou'! An' then he (James) says, ``Give Harry ter me, Hagrid, I'm his (Harry) godfather, I'll look after him (Harry) --' Ha! But I'd had me orders from Dumbledore, an' I told Black no, Dumbledore said Harry was ter go ter his (Harry) aunt an' uncle's. Black argued, but in the end he (Black) gave in. Told me ter take his (Black) motorbike ter get Harry there.

``I won't need it anymore,'' (he)
he (Professor) says.

``I shoulda known there was somethin' fishy goin' on then. He (Harry) loved that motorbike, what was he (Harry) givin' it ter me for? Why wouldn' he (Harry) need it anymore? Fact was, it was too easy ter trace. Dumbledore knew he (Dumbledore)'d bin the Potters' Secret-Keeper. Black knew he (Black) was goin' ter have ter run fer it that night, knew it was a matter o' hours before the Ministry was after him (Black).

``But what if I'd given Harry to him (Harry), eh? I bet he (Harry)'d 've pitched him (Harry) off the bike halfway out ter sea. His (Harry) bes' friends' son! But when a wizard goes over ter the Dark Side, there's nothin' and no one that matters to em anymore...'' (Hagrid)

A long silence followed Hagrid's story. Then Madam Rosmerta said with some satisfaction,

``But he (wizard) didn't manage to disappear, did he (wizard)? The Ministry of Magic caught up with him (wizard) next day!'' (Madam Rosmerta/Rosmerta)

``Alas, if only we had,'' (Fudge)
said Fudge bitterly.
``It was not we who found him (wizard). It was little Peter Pettigrew -- another of the Potters' friends. Maddened by grief, no doubt, and knowing that Black had been the Potters' Secret-Keeper, he (Black) went after Black himself.'' (unknown)

``Pettigrew... that fat little boy who was always tagging around after them at Hogwarts?'' (Madam Rosmerta/Rosmerta)
said Madam Rosmerta.

``Hero-worshipped Black and Potter,'' (Professor)
said Professor McGonagall.
``Never quite in their league, talent-wise. I was often rather ,harp with him (Potter). You can imagine how I -how I regret that now...'' (She)
She (Rosmerta) sounded as though she (Rosmerta) had a sudden head cold.

``There, now, Minerva,'' (Fudge)
said Fudge kindly, ``Pettigrew died a hero's death. Eyewitnesses -- Muggles, of course, we wiped their, memories later -- told us how Pettigrew cornered Black. They say he (Pettigrew) was sobbing, ``Lily and James, Sirius! How could you?
'' And then he (Professor) went for his (Professor) wand. Well, of course, Black was quicker. Blew Pettigrew to smithereens...'' (Professor)

Professor McGonagall blew her (Rosmerta) nose and said thickly,

``Stupid boy ... foolish boy... he (boy) was always hopeless at dueling... should have left it to the Ministry...'' (McGonagall)

``I tell yeh, if I'd got ter Black before little Pettigrew did, I wouldn't 've messed around with wands -- I'd 've ripped him (Pettigrew) limb -- from -- limb,'' (McGonagall)
Hagrid growled.

``You don't know what you're talking about, Hagrid,'' (Fudge)
said Fudge sharply.
``Nobody but trained Hit Wizards from the Magical Law Enforcement Squad would have stood a chance against Black once he (Black) was cornered. I was Junior Minister in the Department of Magical Catastrophes at the time, and I was one of the first on the scene after Black murdered all those people. I -- I will never forget it. I still dream about it sometimes. A crater in the middle of the street, so deep it had cracked the sewer below. Bodies everywhere. Muggles screaming. And Black standing there laughing, with what was left of Pettigrew in front of him (Pettigrew)... a heap of bloodstained robes and a few -- a few fragments --'' (Fudge)

Fudge's voice stopped abruptly. There was the sound of five noses being blown.

``Well, there you have it, Rosmerta,'' (Fudge)
said Fudge thickly. ``Black was taken away by twenty members of the Magical Law Enforcement
``Squad and Pettigrew received the Order of Merlin, First Class, which I think was some comfort to his (Merlin) poor mother. Blades been in Azkaban ever since.'' (Madam Rosmerta/Rosmerta)

Madam Rosmerta let out a long sigh.

``Is it true he (Merlin)'s mad, Minister?'' (unknown)

``I wish I could say that he (Merlin) was,'' (Fudge)
said Fudge slowly.
``I certainly believe his (Merlin) master's defeat unhinged him (Merlin) for a while. The murder of Pettigrew and all those Muggles was the action of a cornered and desperate man -- cruel... pointless. Yet I met Black on my last inspection of Azkaban. You know, most of the prisoners in there sit muttering to themselves in the dark; there's no sense in them... but I was shocked at how normal Black seemed. He (Pettigrew) spoke quite rationally to me. It was unnerving. You'd have thought he (Pettigrew) was merely bored -- asked if I'd finished with my newspaper, cool as you please, said he (Pettigrew) missed doing the crossword. Yes, I was astounded at how little effect the dementors seemed to be having on him (Pettigrew) -- and he (Pettigrew) was one of the most heavily guarded in the place, you know. Dementors outside his (Pettigrew) door day and night.'' (unknown)

``But what do you think he (Pettigrew)'s broken out to do?'' (Madam Rosmerta/Rosmerta)
said Madam Rosmerta.
``Good gracious, Minister, he (Minister) isn't trying to rejoin You-Know-Who, is he (Minister)?'' (I)

I daresay that is his (Pettigrew) -- er -- eventual plan,'' said Fudge evasively.

``But we hope to catch Black long before that. I must say, You-Know-Who alone and friendless is one thing... but give him (Minister) back his (Minister) most devoted servant, and I shudder to think how quickly he (Minister)'ll rise again...'' (Someone)

There was a small chink of glass on wood. Someone had set down their glass.

``You know, Cornelius, if you're dining with the headmaster, he (Cornelius)'d better head back up to the castle,'' (Professor)
said Professor McGonagall.

One by one, the pairs of feet in front of Harry took the weight of their owners once more; hems of cloaks swung into sight, and Madam Rosemerta's glittering heels disappeared behind the bar. The door of the Three Broomsticks opened again, there was another flurry of snow, and the teachers had disappeared.

``Harry?'' (Ron)

Ron's and Hermione's faces appeared under the table. They were both staring at him (Ron), lost for words.

CHAPTER ELEVEN

THE FIREBOLT

Harry didn't have a very clear idea of how he (Harry) had managed to get back into the Honeydukes cellar, through the tunnel, and into the castle once more. All he (Harry) knew was that the return trip seemed to take no time at all, and that he (Harry) hardly noticed what he (Harry) was doing, because his (Harry) head was still pounding with the conversation he (Harry) had just heard.

Why had nobody ever told him (Harry)? Dumbledore, Hagrid, Mr. Weasley, Cornelius Fudge... why hadn't anyone ever mentioned the fact that Harry's parents had died because their best friend had betrayed them?

Ron and Herinione watched Harry nervously all through dintier, not daring to talk about what they'd overheard, because Percy was sitting close by them. When they went upstairs to the crowded common room, it was to find Fred and George had set off half a dozen Dungbombs in a fit of end- of-term high spirits. Harry, who didn't want Fred and George asking him (Fred) whether he (Fred)'d reached Hogsmeade or not, sneaked quietly up to the empty dormitory and headed straight for his (Fred) bedside cabinet. He (Fred) pushed his (Fred) books aside and quickly found what he (Fred) was looking for -- the leather-bound photo album Hagrid had given him (Fred) two years ago, which was full of wizard pictures of his (wizard) mother and father. He (wizard) sat down on his (wizard) bed, drew the hangings around him (wizard), and started turning the pages, searching, until...

He (wizard) stopped on a picture of his (wizard) parents' wedding day. There was his (wizard) father waving up at him (wizard), beaming, the untidy black hair Harry had inherited standing up in all directions. There was his (Harry) mother, alight with happiness, arm in arm with his (Harry) dad. And there ... that must be him (Harry). Their best man... Harry had never given him (Harry) a thought before.

If he (Harry) hadn't known it was the same person, he (Harry) would never have guessed it was Black in this old photograph. His (Harry) face wasn't sunken and waxy, but handsome, full of laughter. Had he (Harry) already been working for Voldemort when this picture had been taken? Was he (Harry) already planning the deaths of the two people next to him (Harry)? Did he (Harry) realize he (Harry) was facing twelve years in Azkaban, twelve years that would make him (Harry) unrecognizable?

But the dementors don't affect him (Harry), Harry thought, staring into the handsome, laughing face. He (Harry) doesn't have to hear my Min screaming if they get too close -

Harry slammed the album shut, reached over and stuffed it back into his (Harry) cabinet, took off his (Harry) robe and glasses and got into bed, making sure the hangings were hiding him (Harry) from view.

The dormitory door opened.

``Harry?'' (Ron)
said Ron's voice uncertainly.

But Harry still, pretending to be asleep. He (Harry) heard Ron leave again, and rolled over on his (Ron) back, his (Ron) eyes wide open.

A hatred such as he (Ron) had never known before was coursing through Harry like poison. He (Harry) could see Black laughing at him (Harry) through the darkness, as though somebody had pasted the picture from the album over his (Harry) eyes. He (Harry) watched, as though somebody was playing him (Harry) a piece of film, Sirius Black blasting Peter Pettigrew -LRB-who resembled Neville Longbottom-RRB- into a thousand pieces. He (Longbottom) could hear -LRB-though having no idea what Black's voice might sound like-RRB- a low, excited mutter. ``It has happened, My Lord... the Potters have made me their Secret-Keeper and then came another voice, laughing shrilly, the same laugh that Harry heard inside his (Harry) head whenever the dementors drew near...

``Harry, you -- you look terrible.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry hadn't gotten to sleep until daybreak. He (Harry) had awoken to find the dormitory deserted, dressed, and gone down the spiral staircase to a common room that was completely empty except for Ron, who was eating a Peppermint Toad and massaging his (Ron) stomach, and Hermione, who had spread her (Hermione) homework over three tables.

``Where is everyone?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.

``Gone! It's the first day of the holidays, remember?'' (Ron)
said Ron, watching Harry closely.
``It's nearly lunchtime; I was going to come and wake you up in a minute.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry slumped into a chair next to the fire. Snow was still falling outside the windows. Crookshanks was spread out in front of the fire like a large, ginger rug.

``You really don' look well, you know,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione said, peering anxiously into his (Harry) face.

``I'm fine,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.

``Harry, listen,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione, exchanging a look with Ron, you must be really upset about what we heard yesterday. But the thing is, you mustn't go doing anything stupid.''

``Like what?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.

``Like trying to go after Black,'' (Ron)
said Ron sharply.

Harry could tell they had rehearsed this conversation while he (Harry) had been asleep. He (Harry) didn't say anything.

``You won't, will you, Harry?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione.

``Because Black's not worth dying for,'' (Ron)
said Ron.

Harry looked at them. They didn't seem to understand at all.

``D'you know what I see and hear every time a dementor gets too near me?'' (Ron)
Ron and Hermione shook their heads, looking apprehensive.
``I can hear my mum screaming and pleading with Voldemort. And if you'd heard your mum screaming like that, just about to be killed, you wouldn't forget it in a hurry. And if you found out someone who was supposed to be a friend of hers betrayed her (mum) and sent Voldemort after her (mum) --'' (unknown)

``There's nothing you can do!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione, looking stricken.
``The dementors will catch Black and he (Black)'ll go back to Azkaban and -- and serve him (Black) right!'' (unknown)

``You heard what Fudge said. Black isn't affected by Azkaban like normal people are. It's not a punishment for him (Black) like it is for the others.'' (unknown)

``So what are you saying?'' (Ron)
said Ron, looking very tense.
``You want to -- to kill Black or something?'' (unknown)

``Don't be silly,'' (Herinione)
said Herinione in a panicky voice.
``Harry doesn't want to kill anyone, do you, Harry?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Again, Harry didn't answer. He (Harry) didn't know what he (Harry) wanted to do. All he (Harry) knew was that the idea of doing nothing, while Black was at liberty, was almost more than he (Black) could stand.

Malfoy knows,'' he (Malfoy) said abruptly. ``Remember what he (Harry) said to me in Potions? ``If it was me, I'd hunt him (Harry) down myself... I'd want revenge.

``You're going to take Malfoy's advice instead of ours?'' (Ron)
said Ron furiously.
``Listen... you know what Pettigrew's mother got back after Black had finished with him (Black)? Dad told me -- the Order of Merlin, First Class, and Pettigrew's finger in a box. That was the biggest bit of him (Pettigrew) they could find. Black's a madman, Harry, and he (Harry)'s dangerous --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Malfoy's dad must have told him (Harry),'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, ignoring Ron.

``Say You-Know-Who, will you?'' (Ron)
interjected Ron angrily.

''-- so obviously, the Malfoys knew Black was working for Voldemort --'' (Ron)

''-- and Malfoy'd love to see you blown into about a million pieces, like Pettigrew! Get a grip. Malfoy's just hoping you'll get Yourself killed before he (Malfoy) has to play you at Quidditch.'' (unknown)

said Hermione, her (Hermione) eyes now shining with tears,
``Please be sensible. Black did a terrible, terrible thing, but d-don't Put Yourself in danger, it's what Black wants... Oh, Harry, you'd be Playing right into Black's hands if you went looking for him (Black). Your mum and dad wouldn't want you to get hurt, would they? They'd never want you to go looking for Black!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

``I'll never know what they'd have wanted, because thanks to Black, I've never spoken to them,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry shortly.

There was a silence in which Crookshanks stretched luxuriously flexing his (Harry) claws. Ron's pocket quivered.

``Look,'' (Ron)
said Ron, obviously casting around for a change of subject,
``it's the holidays! It's nearly Christmas! Let's -- let's go down and see Hagrid. We haven't visited him (Black) for ages!'' (Ron)

``No!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione quickly.
``Harry isn't supposed to leave the castle, Ron --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Yeah, let's go,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, sitting up,
``and I can ask him (Harry) how come he (Harry) never mentioned Black when he (Harry) told me all about my parents!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Further discussion of Sirius Black plainly wasn't what Ron had had in mind.

``Or we could have a game of chess, he (Harry) said hastily,

``or Gobstones. Percy left a set --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``No, let's visit Hagrid,'' (Percy/Weasley/Percy Weasley)
said Harry firmly.

So they got their cloaks from their dormitories and set off through the portrait hole -LRB-

``Stand and fight, you yellow-bellied mongrels!'' (unknown)
-RRB-, down through the empty castle and out through the oak front doors.

They made their way slowly down the lawn, making a shallow trench in the glittering, powdery snow, their socks and the hems of their cloaks soaked and freezing. The Forbidden Forest looked as though it had been enchanted, each tree smattered with silver, and Hagrid's cabin looked like an iced cake.

Ron knocked, but there was no answer.

``He (Percy)'s not out, is he (Percy)?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione, who was shivering under her (Hermione) cloak.

Ron had his (Ron) ear to the door.

``There's a weird noise,'' (he)
he (Ron) said.
``Listen -- is that Fang?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry and Hermione put their ears to the door too. From inside the cabin came a series of low, throbbing moans.

``Think we'd better go and get someone?'' (Ron)
said Ron nervously.

``Hagrid!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
called Harry, thumping the door. ``Hagrid, are you in there.

There was a sound of heavy footsteps, then the door creaked open. Hagrid stood there with his (Fang) eyes red and swollen, tears splashing down the front of his (Fang) leather vest.

``YWve heard?'' (he)
he (Harry) bellowed, and he (Harry) flung himself onto Harry's neck.

Hagrid being at least twice the size of a normal man, this was no laughing matter. Harry, about to collapse under Hagrid's weight, was rescued by Ron and Hermione, who each seized Hagrid under an arm and heaved him (Ron) back into the cabin. Hagrid allowed himself to be steered into a chair and slumped over the table, sobbing uncontrollably, his (Ron) face glazed with tears that dripped down into his (Ron) tangled beard.

``Hagrid, what is it?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione, aghast.

Harry spotted an official-looking letter lying open on the table.

``What's this, Hagrid?'' (Hagrid)

Hagrid's sobs redoubled, but he (Harry) shoved the letter toward Harry, who Picked it up and read aloud:

Dear Mr. Hagrid,

Further to our inquiry into the attack by a hippogriff on a student in your class, we have accepted the assurances of Professor Dumbledore that you bear no responsibility for the regrettable incident.

``Well, that's okay then, Hagrid!'' (Ron)
said Ron, clapping Hagrid oil the shoulder. But Hagrid continued to sob, and waved one of his (Ron) gigantic hands, inviting Harry to read on.

However, we must register our concern about the hippogriff in question. We have decided to uphold the official complaint of Mr. Lucius Malfoy, and this matter will therefore be taken to the Committee for the Disposal of Dangerous Creatures. The hearing will take place on April 20th, and we ask you to present yourself and your hippogriff at the Committee's offices in London on that date. In the meantime, the hippogriff should be kept tethered and isolated. Yours in fellowship...

There followed a list of the school governors.

``Oh,'' (Ron)
said Ron. ``But you said Buckbeak isn't a bad hippogriff, Hagrid. I bet he (Fang)'ll get off

``Yeh don' know them gargoyles at the Committee fer the Disposal o' Dangerous Creatures!'' (Hagrid)
choked Hagrid, wiping his (Ron) eyes on his (Ron) sleeve.
``They've got it in fer interestin' creatures!'' (Hagrid)

A sudden sound from the corner of Hagrid's cabin made Harry, Ron, and Hermione whip around. Buckbeak the hippogriff was lying in the corner, chomping on something that was oozing blood all over the floor.

``I couldn' leave him (Fang) tied up out there in the snow!'' (Hagrid)
choked Hagrid.
``All on his (Fang) own! At Christmas.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry, Ron, and Hermione looked at one another. They had never seen eye to eye with Hagrid about what he (Harry) called

``interesting creatures'' (he)
and other people called
``terrifying monsters.'' (people)
Or' the other hand, there didn't seem to be any particular harm in Buckbeak. In fact, by Hagrid's usual standards, he (Harry) was positively cute.

``You'll have to put up a good strong defense, Hagrid,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione, sitting down and laying a hand on Hagrid's massive forearm.
``I'm sure you can prove Buckbeak is safe.'' (unknown)

``Won't make no diff`rence!'' (Hagrid)
sobbed Hagrid.
``Them Disposal devils, they're all in Lucius Malfoy's pocket! Scared o' him (Malfoy)! Ad if I lose the case, Buckbeak --'' (Hagrid)

Hagrid drew his (Harry) finger swiftly across his (Harry) throat, then gave a great wail and lurched forward, his (Harry) face in his (Harry) arms.

``What about Dumbledore, Hagrid?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.

``He (Dumbledore)'s done more'n enough fer me already,'' (Hagrid)
groaned Hagrid.
``Got enough on his (Dumbledore) plate what with keepin' them dementors outta the castle, an' Sirius Black lurkin' around --'' (Ron)

Ron and Hermione looked quickly at Harry, as though expecting him (Harry) to start berating Hagrid for not telling him (Harry) the truth about Black. But Harry couldn't bring himself to do it, not now that he (Harry) saw Hagrid so miserable and scared.

``Listen, Hagrid,'' (he)
he (Harry) said,
``you can't give up. Hermione's right, You just need a good defense. You can call us as witnesses --'' (he)

``I'm sure I've read about a case of hippogriff-baiting,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione thoughtfully,
``where the hippogriff got off I'll look it up for you, Hagrid, and see exactly what happened.'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Hagrid howled still more loudly. Harry and Hermione looked at Ron to help them.

``Er -- shall I make a cup of tea?'' (Ron)
said Ron.

Harry stared at him (Harry).

``It's what my mum does whenever someone's upset,'' (Ron)
Ron muttered, shrugging.

At last, after many more assurances of help, with a steaming mug of tea in front of him (Ron), Hagrid blew his (Ron) nose on a handkerchief the size of a tablecloth and said, ``Yer right. I can' afford to go ter pieces. Gotta pull meself together...

Fang the boarhound came timidly out from under the table and laid his (Fang) head on Hagrid's knee.

``I've not bin meself lately,'' (Hagrid)
said Hagrid, stroking Fang with one hand and mopping his (Fang) face with the other.
``Worried abou' Buckbeak, an' no one likin' me classes --'' (unknown)

``We do like them!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
lied Hermione at once.

``Yeah, they're great!'' (Ron)
said Ron, crossing his (Ron) fingers under the table.
``Er -- how are the flobberworms?'' (unknown)

``Dead,'' (Hagrid)
said Hagrid gloomily.
``Too much lettuce.'' (unknown)

``Oh no!'' (Ron)
said Ron, his (Ron) lip twitching.

``An' them dementors make me feel ruddy terrible an' all,'' (Hagrid)
said Hagrid, with a sudden shudder. ``Gotta walk past 'em ev'ry time I want a drink in the Three Broomsticks.
``S like bein' back in Azkaban --'' (He)

He (Ron) fell silent, gulping his (Ron) tea. Harry, Ron, and Hermione watched him (Harry) breathlessly. They had never heard Hagrid talk about his (Harry) brief spell in Azkaban before. After a pause, Hermione said timidly,

``Is it awful in there, Hagrid?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

``Yeh've no idea,'' (Hagrid)
said Hagrid quietly.
``Never bin anywhere like it. Thought I was goin' mad. Kep' goin' over horrible stuff in me mind... the day I got expelled from Hogwarts... day me dad died... day I had ter let Norbert go...'' (Norbert)

His (Harry) eyes filled with tears. Norbert was the baby dragon Hagrid had once won in a game of cards.

``Yeh can' really remember who yeh are after a while. An' yeh can' really see the point o' livin' at all. I used ter hope I'd jus' die in me sleep. When they let me out, it was like bein' born again, ev'rythin' I came floodin' back, it was the bes' feelin' in the world. Mind, the dementors weren't keen on lettin' me go.'' (unknown)

``But you were innocent!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione.

Hagrid snorted.

``Think that matters to them? They don' care. Long as they've got a couple o' hundred humans stuck there with 'em, so they can leech all the happiness out of 'em, they don' give a damn who's guilty an' who's not.'' (Hagrid)

Hagrid went quiet for a moment, staring into his (Norbert) tea. Then he (Norbert) said quietly,

``Thought o' jus' letting Buckbeak go... tryin' ter make him (Long) fly away... but how d'yeh explain ter a hippogriff it's gotta go inter hidin'? An' -an' I'm scared o' breakin' the law...'' (he)
He (Norbert) looked up at them, tears leaking down his (Norbert) face again.
``I don' ever want ter go back ter Azkaban.'' (Hagrid)

The trip to Hagrid's, though far from fun, had nevertheless had the effect Ron and Hermione had hoped. Though Harry had by no means forgotten about Black, he (Harry) couldn't brood constantly on revenge if he (Harry) wanted to help Hagrid win his (Harry) case against the Committee for the Disposal of Dangerous Creatures. He (Harry), Ron, and Hermione went to the library the next day and returned to the empty common room laden with books that might help prepare a defense for Buckbeak. The three of them sat in front of the roaring fire, slowly turning the pages of dusty volumes about famous cases If marauding beasts, speaking occasionally when they ran across something relevant.

``Here's something... there was a case in 1722... but the hippogriff was convicted -- ugh, look what they did to it, that's disgusting --'' (unknown)

``This might help, look -- a manticore savaged someone in 1296, and they let the manticore off -- oh -- no, that was only because everyone was too scared to go near it.'' (the students)

Meanwhile, in the rest of the castle, the usual magnificent Christmas decorations had been put up, despite the fact that hardly any of the students remained to enjoy them. Thick streamers of holly and mistletoe were strung along the corridors, mysterious lights shone from inside every suit of armor, and the Great Hall was filled with its usual twelve Christmas trees, glittering with golden stars. A powerful and delicious smell of cooking pervaded the corridors, and by Christmas Eve, it had grown so strong that even Scabbers poked his (Great) nose out of the shelter of Ron's pocket to sniff hopefully at the air.

On Christmas morning, Harry was woken by Ron throwing his (Ron) pillow at him (Ron).

``Oy! Presents!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry reached for his (Harry) glasses and put them on, squinting through the semi-darkness to the foot of his (Harry) bed, where a small heap of parcels had appeared. Ron was already ripping the paper off his (Ron) own presents.

``Another sweater from Mum... maroon again... see if you've got one.

Harry had. Mrs. Weasley had sent him (Harry) a scarlet sweater with the Gryffindor lion knitted on the front, also a dozen home-baked mince pies, some Christmas cake, and a box of nut brittle. As he (Harry) moved all these things aside, he (Harry) saw a long, thin package lying underneath.

``What's that?'' (Ron)
said Ron, looking over, a freshly unwrapped pair of maroon socks in his (Ron) hand.

``Dunno...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry ripped the parcel open and gasped as a magnificent, gleaming broomstick rolled out onto his (Harry) bedspread. Ron dropped his (Ron) socks and jumped off his (Ron) bed for a closer look.

``I don't believe it,'' (he)
he (Ron) said hoarsely.

It was a Firebolt, identical to the dream broom Harry had gone to see every day in Diagon Alley. Its handle glittered as he (Harry) picked it up. He (Harry) could feel it vibrating and let go; it hung in midair, unsupported, at exactly the right height for him (Harry) to mount it. His (Harry) eyes moved from the golden registration number at the top of the handle, right down to the perfectly smooth, streamlined birch twigs that made up the tail.

``Who sent it to you?'' (Ron)
said Ron in a hushed voice.

``Look and see if there's a card,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.

Ron ripped apart the Firebolt's wrappings.

``Nothing! Blimey, who'd spend that much on you?'' (unknown)

``Well,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, feeling stunned,
``I'm betting it wasn't the Dursleys.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

I bet it was Dumbledore,'' said Ron, now walking around and around the Firebolt, taking in every glorious inch.

``He (Harry) sent you the Invisibility Cloak anonymously...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``That was my dad's, though,'' (He)
said Harry.
``Dumbledore was just Passing it on to me. He (Dumbledore) wouldn't spend hundreds of Galleons on me. He (Dumbledore) can't go giving students stuff like this --'' (unknown)

``That's why he (Dumbledore) wouldn't say it was from him (Dumbledore)!'' (Ron)
said Ron.
``In case some git like Malfoy said it was favoritism. Hey, Harry'' (Ron)
-- Ron gave a great whoop of laughter --
``Malfoy! Wait till he (Harry) sees you on this! He (Harry)'ll be sick as a pig! This is an international standard broom, this is!'' (Ron)

``I can't believe this,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry muttered, running a hand along the Firebolt, while Ron sank onto Harry's bed, laughing his (Ron) head off at the thought of Malfoy.
``Who -?'' (unknown)

``I know,'' (Ron)
said Ron, controlling himself,
``I know who it could've been -- Lupin!'' (Ron)

``What?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, now starting to laugh himself
``Lupin? Listen, if he (Harry) had this much gold, he (Harry)'d be able to buy himself some new robes.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Yeah, but he (Harry) likes you,'' (Ron)
said Ron.
``And he (Harry) was away when your Nimbus got smashed, and he (Harry) might've heard about it and decided to visit Diagon Alley and get this for you --'' (unknown)

``What d'you mean, he (Harry) was away?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.
``He (Harry) was ill when I was playing in that match.'' (unknown)

``Well, he (Harry) wasn't in the hospital wing,'' (Ron)
said Ron.
``I was there, cleaning out the bedpans on that detention from Snape, remember?'' (Harry)

Harry frowned at Ron.

``I can't see Lupin affording something like this.'' (unknown)

``What're you two laughing about?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Hermione had just come in, wearing her (Hermione) dressing gown and carrying Crookshanks, who was looking very grumpy, with a string of tinsel tied around his (Harry) neck.

``Don't bring him (Snape) in here!'' (Ron)
said Ron, hurriedly snatching Scabbers from the depths of his (Ron) bed and stowing him (Ron) in his (Ron) pajama pocket.

But Hermione wasn't listening. She (Hermione) dropped Crookshanks onto Seamus's empty bed and stared, open-mouthed, at the Firebolt.

``Oh, Harry! Who sent you that?'' (unknown)

``No idea,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.
``There wasn't a card or anything with it.'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

To his (Harry) great surprise, Hermione did not appear either excited or intrigued by the news. On the contrary, her (Hermione) face fell, and she (Hermione) bit her (Hermione) lip.

``What's the matter with you?'' (Ron)
said Ron.

``I don't know,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione slowly,
``but it's a bit odd, isn't it? I mean, this is supposed to be quite a good broom, isn't it?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Ron sighed exasperatedly.

``It's the best broom there is, Hermione,'' (he)
he (Ron) said.

``So it must've been really expensive...'' (Ron)

``Probably cost more than all the Slytherins' brooms put together,'' (Ron)
said Ron happily.

``Well... who'd send Harry something as expensive as that, and not even tell him (Harry) they'd sent it?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione.

``Who cares?'' (Ron)
said Ron impatiently.
``Listen, Harry, can I have a go on it? Can I?'' (unknown)

``I don't think anyone should ride that broom just yet!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione shrilly.

Harry and Ron looked at her (Hermione).

``What d'you think Harry's going to do with it -- sweep the floor?'' (Ron)
said Ron.

But before Hermione could answer, Crookshanks sprang from Seamus's bed, right at Ron's chest.

``GET -- HIM -- OUT -- OF -- HERE!'' (Ron)
Ron bellowed as Crookshanks's claws ripped his (Ron) pajamas and Scabbers attempted a wild escape over his (Ron) shoulder. Ron seized Scabbers by the tail and aimed a misjudged kick at Crookshanks that hit the trunk at the end of Harry's bed, knocking it over and causing Ron to hop up and down, howling with pain.

Crookshanks's fur suddenly stood on end. A shrill, tint,, whistling was filling the room. The Pocket Sneakoscope had become dislodged from Uncle Vernon's old socks and was whirling and gleaming on the floor.

I forgot about that!'' Harry said, bending down and picking up the Sneakoscope. I never wear those socks if I can help it...

The Sneakoscope whirled and whistled in his (Harry) palm. Crookshanks was hissing and spitting at it.

``You'd better take that cat out of here, Hermione,'' (Ron)
said Ron furiously, sitting on Harry's bed nursing his (Ron) toe.
``Can't you shut that thing up?'' (he)
he (Ron) added to Harry as Hermione strode out of the room, Crookshanks's yellow eyes still fixed maliciously on Ron.

Harry stuffed the Sneakoscope back inside the socks and threw it back into his (Harry) trunk. All that could be heard now were Ron's stifled moans of pain and rage. Scabbers was huddled in Ron's hands. It had been a while since Harry had seen him (Harry) out of Ron's pocket, and he (Ron) was unpleasantly surprised to see that Scabbers, once so fat, was now very skinny; patches of fur seemed to have fallen out too

``He (Harry)'s not looking too good, is he (Harry)?'' (he)
Harry said.

``It's stress!'' (Ron)
said Ron.
``He (Harry)'d be fine if that big stupid furball left him (Harry) alone!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

But Harry, remembering what the woman at the Magical Menagerie had said about rats living only three years, couldn't help feeling that unless Scabbers had powers he (Ron) had never revealed, he (Ron) was reaching the end of his (Ron) life. And despite Ron's frequent conplaints that Scabbers was both boring and useless, he (Ron) was sure Ron would be very miserable if Scabbers died.

Christmas spirit was definitely thin on the ground in the Gryffindor common room that morning. Hermione had shut Crookshanks in her (Hermione) dormitory, but was furious with Ron for trying to kick him (Ron); Ron was still fuming about Crookshanks's fresh attempt to eat Scabbers. Harry gave up trying to make them talk to each other and devoted himself to examining the Firebolt, which he (Harry) had brought down to the common room with him (Harry). For some reason this seemed to annoy Hermione as well; she (Hermione) didn't say anything, but she (Hermione) kept looking darkly at the broom as though it too had been criticizing her (Hermione) cat.

At lunchtime they went down to the Great Hall, to find that the House tables had been moved against the walls again, and that a single table, set for twelve, stood in the middle of the room. Professors Dumbledore, McGonagall, Snape, Sprout, and Flitwick were there, along with Filch, the caretaker, who had taken off his (caretaker) usual brown coat and was wearing a very old and rather moldy- looking tailcoat. There were only three other students, two extremely nervous-looking first years and a sullen-faced Slytherin fifth year.

``Merry Christmas!'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore as Harry, Ron, and Hermione approached the table.
``As there are so few of us, it seemed foolish to use the House tables... Sit down, sit down!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry, Ron, and Hermione sat down side by side at the end of the table.

``Crackers!'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore enthusiastically, offering the end of a large silver noisemaker to Snape, who took it reluctantly and tugged. With a bang like a gunshot, the cracker flew apart to reveal a large, pointed witchs hat topped with a stuffed vulture.

Harry, remembering the boggart, caught Ron's eye and they both grinned; Snape's mouth thinned and he (Ron) pushed the hat toward Dumbledore, who swapped it for his (Dumbledore) wizard's hat at once.

``Dig in!'' (he)
he (Dumbledore) advised the table, beaming around.

As Harry was helping himself to roast potatoes, the doors of the Great Hall opened again. It was Professor Trelawney, gliding toward them as though on wheels. She (Ron) had put on a green sequined dress in honor of the occasion, making her (Ron) look more than ever like a glittering, oversized dragonfly.

``Sibyll, this is a pleasant surprise!'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore, standing up.

``I have been crystal gazing, Headmaster,'' (Professor)
said Professor Trelawney in her (Ron) mistiest, most faraway voice,
``and to my astonishment, I saw myself abandoning my solitary luncheon and coming to join you. Who am I to refuse the promptings of fate? I at once hastened from my tower, and I do beg you to forgive my lateness...'' (Trelawney/Sibyll/Sibyll Trelawney)

``Certainly, certainly,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore, his (Dumbledore) eyes twinkling.
``Let me draw you up a chair --'' (he)

And he (Dumbledore) did indeed draw a chair in midair with his (Dumbledore) wand, which revolved for a few seconds before falling with a thud between Professors Snape and McGonagall. Professor Trelawney, however, did not sit down; her (Ron) enormous eyes had been roving around the table, and she (Ron) suddenly uttered a kind of soft scream.

I dare not, Headmaster! If I join the table, we shall be thirteen! Nothing could be more unlucky! Never forget that when thirteen dine together, the first to rise will be the first to die!''

``We'll risk it, Sibyll,'' (Professor)
said Professor McGonagall inpatiendy.
``Do sit down, the turkey's getting stone cold.'' (Professor)

Professor Trelawney hesitated, then lowered herself into the empty chair, eyes shut and mouth clenched tight, as though expecting a thunderbolt to hit the table. Professor McGonagall poked a large spoon into the nearest tureen.

``Tripe, Sibyll?'' (Professor)

Professor Trelawney ignored her (Ron). Eyes open again, she (Ron) looked around once more and said,

``But where is dear Professor Lupin?'' (she)

``I'm afraid the poor fellow is ill again,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore, indicating that everybody should start serving themselves.
``Most unfortunate that it should happen on Christmas Day.'' (unknown)

``But surely you already knew that, Sibyll?'' (Professor)
said Professor McGonagall, her (Ron) eyebrows raised.

Professor Trelawney gave Professor McGonagall a very cold look.

``Certainly I knew, Minerva, 11 she (Minerva) said quietly. ``But one does not parade the fact that one is All- Knowing. I frequently act as though I am not possessed of the Inner Eye, so as not to make others nervous.

``That explains a great deal,'' (Professor)
said Professor McGonagall tartly.

Professor Trelawney's voice suddenly became a good deal less misty.

``If you must know, Minerva, I have seen that poor Professor Lupin will not be with us for very long. He (Professor) seems aware, himself, that his (Professor) time is short. He (Professor) positively fled when I offered to crystal gaze for him (Professor) --'' (Professor)

``Imagine that,'' (Professor)
said Professor McGonagall dryly.

I doubt,'' said Dumbledore, in a cheerful but slightly raised voice, which put an end to Professor McGonagall and Professor Trelawney's conversation,

``that Professor Lupin is in any immediate danger. Severus, you've made the potion for him (Professor) again?'' (I)

``Yes, Headmaster,'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)
said Snape.
``W -- what?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, scrambling to his (Professor) feet.
``Why?'' (unknown)

``It will need to be checked for jinxes,'' (Professor)
said Professor McGonagall.
``Of course, I'm no expert, but I daresay Madam Hooch and Professor Flitwick will strip it down --'' (unknown)

``Strip it down?'' (Ron)
repeated Ron, as though Professor McGonagall was mad.

``It shouldn't take more than a few weeks,'' (Professor)
said Professor McGonagall.
``You will have it back if we are sure it is jinx-free.'' (unknown)

``There's nothing wrong with it!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, his (Professor) voice shaking slightly.
``Honestly, Professor --'' (Professor)

``You can't know that, Potter,'' (Professor)
said Professor McGonagall, quite kindly,
``not until you've flown it, at any rate, and I'm afraid that is out of the question until we are certain that it has not been tampered with. I shall keep you informed.'' (McGonagall)

Professor McGonagall turned on her (Trelawney) heel and carried the Firebolt out of the portrait hole, which closed behind her (Trelawney). Harry stood staring after her (Trelawney), the tin of High-Finish Polish still clutched in his (Harry) hands. Ron, however, rounded on Hermione.

``What did you go running to McGonagall for?

Hermione threw her (Hermione) book aside. She (Hermione) was still pink in the face, but stood up and faced Ron defiantly.

``Because I thought -- and Professor McGonagall agrees with me -- that that broom was probably sent to Harry by Sirius Black!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

CHAPTER TWELVE

THE PATRONUS

Harry knew that Hermione had meant well, but that didn't stop him (Harry) from being angry with her (Hermione). He (Harry) had been the owner of the best broom in the world for a few short hours, and now, because of her (Hermione) interference, he (Harry) didn't know whether he (Harry) would ever see it again. He (Harry) was positive that there was nothing wrong with the Firebolt now, but what sort of state would it be in once it had been subjected to all sorts of anti-jinx tests?

Ron was furious with Hermione too. As far as he (Ron) was concerned, the stripping-down of a brand- new Firebolt was nothing less than criminal damage. Hermione, who remained convinced that she (Hermione) had acted for the best, started avoiding the common room. Harry and Ron supposed she (Hermione) had taken refuge in the library and didn't try to persuade her (Hermione) to come back. All in all, they were glad when the rest of the school returned shortly after New Year, and Gryffindor Tower became crowded and noisy again. Wood sought Harry out on the night before term started.

``Had a good Christmas?'' (he)
he (Harry) said, and then, without waiting for an answer, he (Harry) sat down, lowered his (Harry) voice, and said,
``I've been, doing some thinking over Christmas, Harry. After last match, you know. If the dementors come to the next one... I mean... we can't afford you to -- well --'' (he)

Wood broke off, looking awkward.

``I'm working on it,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry quickly.
``Professor Lupin said he (Professor)'d train me to ward off the dementors. We should be starting this week. He (Professor) said he (Professor)'d have time after Christmas.'' (unknown)

``Ah,'' (Wood/Oliver/Oliver Wood)
said Wood, his (Harry) expression clearing.
``Well, in that case -- I really didn't want to lose you as Seeker, Harry. And have you ordered a new broom yet?'' (unknown)

``No,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.

``What! You'd better get a move on, you know -- you can't ride that Shooting Star against Ravenclaw!'' (unknown)

``He (Harry) got a Firebolt for Christmas,'' (Ron)
said Ron.

``A Firebolt? No! Seriously? A -- a real Firebolt?'' (unknown)

``Don't get excited, Oliver,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry gloomily.
``I haven't got it anymore. It was confiscated.'' (he)
And he (Harry) explained all about how the Firebolt was now being checked for jinxes.

``Jinxed? How could it be jinxed?'' (unknown)

``Sirius Black'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry said wearily.
``He (Black)'s supposed to be after me. So McGonagall reckons he (Black) might have sent it.'' (a murderer)

Waving aside the information that a famous murderer was after his (Harry) Seeker, Wood said,

``But Black couldn't have bought a Firebolt! He (Black)'s on the run! The whole country's on the lookout for him (Black)! How could he (Black) just walk into Quality Quidditch Supplies and buy a broomstick?'' (Wood/Oliver/Oliver Wood)

``I know,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry,
``but McGonagall still wants to strip it down --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Wood went pale.

``I'll go and talk to her (Black), Harry,'' (he)
he (Harry) promised.
``I'll make her (Black) see reason... A Firebolt... a real Firebolt, on our team... She (Black) wants Gryffindor to win as much as we do... I'll make her (Black) see sense. A Firebolt...'' (unknown)

Classes started again the next day. The last thing anyone felt like doing was spending two hours on the grounds on a raw January morning, but Hagrid had provided a bonfire full of salamanders for their enjoyment, and they spent an unusually good lesson collecting dry wood and leaves to keep the fire blazing while the flame-loving lizards scampered up and down the crumbling, white-hot logs. The first Divination lesson of the new term was much less fun; Professor Trelawney was now teaching them palmistry, and she (anyone) lost no time in informing Harry that he (Harry) had the shortest life line she (anyone) had ever seen.

It was Defense Against the Dark Arts that Harry was keen to get to; after his (Harry) conversation with Wood, he (Wood) wanted to get started on his (Wood) anti-dementor lessons as soon as possible.

``Ah yes,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, when Harry reminded him (Harry) of his (Harry) promise at the end of class.
``Let me see... how about eight o'clock on Thursday evening? The History of Magic classroom should be large enough... I'll have to think carefully about how we're going to do this... We can't bring a real dementor into the castle to practice on...'' (unknown)

``Still looks ill, doesn't he (we)?'' (Ron)
said Ron as they walked down the corridor, heading to dinner.
``What d'you reckon's the matter with him (we)?'' (unknown)

There was a loud and impatient

``tuh'' (unknown)
from behind them. It was Hermione, who had been sitting at the feet of a suit of armor, repacking her (Hermione) bag, which was so full of books it wouldn't close.

``And what are you tutting at us for?'' (Ron)
said Ron irritably.

``Nothing,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione in a lofty voice, heaving her (Hermione) bag back over her (Hermione) shoulder.

``Yes, you were,'' (Ron)
said Ron.
``I said I wonder what's wrong with Lupin, and you --'' (unknown)

``Well, isn't it obvious?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione, with a look of maddening superiority.

``If you don't want to tell us, don't,'' (Ron)
snapped Ron.

``Fine,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione haughtily, and she (Hermione) marched off.

``She (you) doesn't know,'' (Ron)
said Ron, staring resentfully after Hermione.
``She (you)'s just trying to get us to talk to her (you) again.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

At eight o'clock on Thursday evening, Harry left Gryffindor Tower for the History of Magic classroom. It was dark and empty when he (Harry) arrived, but he (Harry) lit the lamps with his (Harry) wand and had waited only five minutes when Professor Lupin turned up, carrying a large packing case, which he (Professor) heaved onto Professor Binn's desk.

``What's that?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.

``Another boggart,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, stripping off his (Harry) cloak.
``I've been combing the castle ever since Tuesday, and very luckily, I found this one lurking inside Mr. Filch's filing cabinet. It's the nearest we'll get to a real dementor. The boggart will turn into a dementor when he (Filch) sees you, so we'll be able to practice on him (Filch). I can store him (Filch) in my office when we're not using him (Filch); there's a cupboard under my desk he (Filch)'ll like.'' (unknown)

``Okay,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, trying to sound as though he (Harry) wasn't apprehensive at all and merely glad that Lupin had found such a good substitute for a real dementor.

``So...'' (Professor)
Professor Lupin had taken out his (Professor) own wand, and indicated that Harry should do the same.
``The spell I am going to try and teach you is highly advanced magic, Harry -- well beyond ordinary Wizarding Level. It is called the Patronus Charm.'' (unknown)

``How does it work?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry nervously.

``Well, when it works correctly, It conjures up a Patronus,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin,
``which is a kind of anti- dementor -- a guardian that acts as a shield between you and the dementor.'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

Harry had a sudden vision of himself crouching behind a Hagridsized figure holding a large club. Professor Lupin continued,

``The Patronus is a kind of positive force, a projection of the very things that the dementor feeds upon -- hope, happiness, the desire to survive -- but it cannot feel despair, as real humans can, so the dementors can't hurt it. But I must warn you, Harry, that the charm might be too advanced for you. Many qualified wizards have difficulty with it.'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

``What does a Patronus look like?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry curiously.

``Each one is unique to the wizard who conjures it.'' (unknown)

``And how do you conjure it?'' (unknown)

``With an incantation, which will work only if you are concentrating, with all your might, on a single, very happy memory.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry cast his (Harry) mind about for a happy memory. Certainly, nothing that had happened to him (Harry) at the Dursleys' was going to do. Finally, he (Harry) settled on the moment when he (Harry) had first ridden a broomstick.

``Right,'' (he)
he (Harry) said, trying to recall as exactly as possible the wonderful, soaring sensation of his (Harry) stomach.

``The incantation is this --'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
Lupin cleared his (Harry) throat.
``Expecto patronum!'' (unknown)

``Expecto patronum, '' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry repeated under his (Harry) breath,
``expecto patronum.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Concentrating hard on your happy memory?'' (unknown)

``Oh -- yeah --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, quickly forcing his (Harry) thoughts back to that first broom ride.
``Expecto patrono -- no, patronum -- sorry -- expecto patronum, expecto patronum'' (unknown)

Something whooshed suddenly out of the end of his (Harry) wand; it looked like a wisp of silvery gas.

``Did you see that?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry excitedly.
``Something happened!'' (unknown)

``Very good,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, smiling.
``Right, then -- ready to try it on a dementor?'' (unknown)

``Yes,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry said, gripping his (Harry) wand very tightly, and moving into the middle of the deserted classroom. He (Harry) tried to keep his (Harry) mind on flying, but something else kept intruding... Any second now, he (Harry) might hear his (Harry) mother again... but he (Harry) shouldn't think that, or he (Harry) would hear her (mother) again, and he (Harry) didn't want to... or did he (Harry)?

Lupin grasped the lid of the packing case and pulled.

A dementor rose slowly from the box, its hooded face turned toward Harry, one glistening, scabbed hand gripping its cloak. The lamps around the classroom flickered and went out. The dementor stepped from the box and started to sweep silently toward Harry, drawing a deep, rattling breath. A wave of piercing cold broke over him (Harry) --

``Expecto patronum!'' (him)
Harry yelled.
``Expecto patronum! Expecto --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

But the classroom and the dementor were dissolving... Harry was failing again through thick white fog, and his (Harry) mother's voice was louder than ever, echoing inside his (Harry) head --

``Not Harry! Not Harry! please -- I'll do anything!'' (mother)

``Stand aside. Stand aside, girl!'' (unknown)

``Harry!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry jerked back to life. He (Harry) was lying flat on his (Harry) back on the floor. The classroom lamps were alight again. He (Harry) didn't have to ask what had happened.

``Sorry,'' (he)
he (Harry) muttered, sitting up and feeling cold sweat trickling down behind his (Harry) glasses.

``Are you all right?'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.

``Yes...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry pulled himself up on one of the desks and leaned against it.

``Here --'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
Lupin handed him (Harry) a Chocolate Frog.
``Eat this before we try again. I didn't expect you to do it your first time; in fact, I would have been astounded if you had.'' (unknown)

``It's getting worse,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry muttered, biting off the Frog's head. ``I could hear her (girl) louder that time -- and him (Harry) -- Voldemort

Lupin looked paler than usual. ,

``Harry, if you don't want to continue, I will more than understand --'' (unknown)

``I do!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry fiercely, stuffing the rest of the Chocolate Frog into his (Harry) mouth.
``I've got to! What if the dementors turn up at our match against Ravenclaw? I can't afford to fall off again. If we lose this game we've lost the Quidditch Cup!'' (unknown)

``All right then... '' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``You might want to select `other memory, a happy memory, I mean, to concentrate on... That one doesn't seem to have been strong enough...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry thought hard and decided his (Harry) feelings when Gryffindor had won the House Championship last year had definitely qualified as very happy. He (Harry) gripped his (Harry) wand tightly again and took up his (Harry) position in the middle of the classroom.

``Ready?'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, gripping the box lid.

``Ready,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry; trying hard to fill his (Harry) head with happy thoughts about Gryffindor winning, and not dark thoughts about what was going to happen when the box opened.

``Go!'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, pulling off the lid. The room went icily cold and dark once more. The dementor glided forward, drawing its breath; one rotting hand was extending toward Harry -

``Expecto patronum!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry yelled.
``Expecto patronum! Expecto Pat --'' (White)

White fog obscured his (Harry) senses... big, blurred shapes were moving around him (Harry)... then came a new voice, a man's voice, shouting, panicking --

``Lily, take Harry and go! It's him (Harry)! Go! Run! I'll hold him (Harry) off --'' (a man)

The sounds of someone stumbling ftom a room -- a door bursting open -- a cackle of high- pitched laughter --

``Harry! Harry... wake up...'' (someone)

Lupin was tapping Harry hard on the face. This time it was a minute before Harry understood why he (Harry) was lying on a dusty classroom floor.

``I heard my dad,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry mumbled.
``That's the first time I've ever heard him (Harry) -- he (Harry) tried to take on Voldemort himself, to give my mum time to run for it...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry suddenly realized that there were tears on his (Harry) face mingling with the sweat. He (Harry) bent his (Harry) face as low as possible, wiping them off on his (Harry) robes, pretending to do up his (Harry) shoelace, so that Lupin wouldn't see.

``You heard James?'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin in a strange voice.

``Yeah...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Face dry, Harry looked up.
``Why -- you didn't know my dad, did you?'' (unknown)

``I -- I did, as a matter of fact,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``We were friends at Hogwarts. Listen, Harry -- perhaps we should leave it here for tonight. This charm is ridiculously advanced... I shouln't have suggested putting you through this...'' (unknown)

``No!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry. He (Harry) got up again.
``I'll have one more go! I'm not thinking of happy enough things, that's what it is... Hang on...'' (He)

He (Harry) racked his (Harry) brains. A really, really happy memory... one that he (Harry) could turn into a good, strong Patronus...

The moment when he (Harry)'d first found out he (Harry) was a wizard, and would be leaving the Dursleys for Hogwarts! If that wasn't a happy memory, he (Hogwarts) didn't know what was... Concentrating very hard on how he (Hogwarts) had felt when he (Hogwarts)'d realized he (Hogwarts)'d be leaving Privet Drive, Harry got to his (Harry) feet and faced the packing case once more.

``Ready?'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, who looked as though he (Harry) were doing this against his (Harry) better judgment.
``Concentrating hard? All right -- go!'' (He)

He (Harry) pulled off the lid of the case for the third time, and the dementor rose out of it; the room fell cold and dark

``EXPECTO PATRONUM!'' (He)
Harry bellowed.
``EXPECTO PATRONUM! EXPECTO PATRONUM! '' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

The screaming inside Harry's head had started again -- except this time, it sounded as though it were coming from a badly tuned radio -- softer and louder and softer again -- and he (Harry) could still see the dementor -- it had halted -- and then a huge, silver shadow came bursting out of the end of Harry's wand, to hover between him (Harry) and the dementor, and though Harry's legs felt like water, he (Harry) was still on his (Harry) feet -- though for how much longer, he (Harry) wasn't sure --

``Riddikulus!'' (he)
roared Lupin, springing forward.

There was a loud crack, and Harry's cloudy Patronus vanished along with the dementor; he (Harry) sank into a chair, feeling as exhausted as if he (Harry)'d just run a mile, and felt his (Harry) legs shaking. Out of the corner of his (Harry) eye, he (Harry) saw Professor Lupin forcing the boggart back into the packing case with his (Harry) wand; it had turned into a silvery orb again.

``Excellent!'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
Lupin said, striding over to where Harry sat.
``Excellent, Harry! That was definitely a start!'' (unknown)

``Can we have another go? Just one more go?'' (unknown)

``Not now,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin firmly.
``You've had enough for one night. Here --'' (He)

He (Harry) handed Harry a large bar of Honeydukes' best chocolate.

``Eat the lot, or Madam Pomfrey will be after my blood. Same time next week?'' (unknown)

``Okay,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry. He (Harry) took a bite of the chocolate and watched Lupin extinguishing the lamps that had rekindled with the disappearance of the dementor. A thought had just occurred to him (Harry).

``Professor Lupin?'' (he)
he (Harry) said.
``If you knew my dad, you must've known Sirius Black as well.'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

Lupin turned very quickly.

``What gives you that idea?'' (he)
he (Harry) said sharply.

``Nothing -- I mean, I just knew they were friends at Hogwarts too...'' (Lupin)

Lupin's face relaxed.

``Yes, I knew him (Black),'' (he)
he (Harry) said shortly.
``Or I thought I did. You'd better be off, Harry, it's getting late.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry left the classroom, walking along the corridor and around a corner, then took a detour behind a suit of armor and sank down on its plinth to finish his (Harry) chocolate, wishing he (Harry) hadn't mentioned Black, as Lupin was obviously not keen on the subject. Then Harry's thoughts wandered back to his (Harry) mother and father...

He (Harry) felt drained and strangely empty, even though he (Harry) was so full of chocolate. Terrible though it was to hear his (Harry) parents' last moments replayed inside his (Harry) head, these were the only times Harry had heard their voices since he (Harry) was a very small child. But he (Harry)'d never be able to produce a proper Patronus if he (Harry) half wanted to hear his (Harry) parents again...

``They're dead,'' (parents)
he (Harry) told himself sternly.
``They're dead and listening to echoes of them won't bring them back. You'd better get a grip on yourself if you want that Quidditch Cup.'' (He)

He (Harry) stood up, crammed the last bit of chocolate into his (Harry) mouth, and headed back to Gryffindor Tower.

Ravenclaw played Slytherin a week after the start of term. Slytherin won, though narrowly. According to Wood, this was good news for Gryffindor, who would take second place if they beat Ravenclaw too. He (Wood) therefore increased the number of team practices to five a leek. This meant that with Lupin's anti-dementor classes, which in themselves were more draining than six Quidditch practices, Harry had just one night a week to do all his (Harry) homework. Even so, he (Harry) was showing the strain nearly as much as Hermione, whose immense workload finally seemed to be getting to her (Hermione). Every night, without fail, Hermione was to be seen in a corner of the common room, several tables spread with books, Arithmancy charts, rune dictionaries, diagrams of Muggles lifting heavy objects, and file upon file of extensive notes; she (Hermione) barely spoke to anybody and snapped when she (Hermione) was interrupted.

``How's she (Black) doing it?'' (Ron)
Ron muttered to Harry one evening as Harry sat finishing a nasty essay on Undetectable Poisons for Snape. Harry looked up. Hermione was barely visible behind a tottering pile of books.

``Doing what?'' (unknown)

``Getting to all her (Black) classes!'' (Ron)
Ron said.
``I heard her (Black) talking to Professor Vector, that Arithmancy witch, this morning. They were going on about yesterday's lesson, but Hermione can't 've been there, because she (Hermione) was with us in Care of Magical Creatures! And Ernie McMillan told me she (Hermione)'s never missed a Muggle Studies class, but half of them are at the same time as Divination, and she (Hermione)'s never missed one of them either!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry didn't have time to fathom the mystery of Hermione's impossible schedule at the moment; he (Harry) really needed to get on with Snape's essay. Two seconds later, however, he (Snape) was interrupted again, this time by Wood.

``Bad news, Harry. I've just been to see Professor McGonagall about the Firebolt. She (Hermione) -- er -- got a bit shirty with me. Told m' I'd got my priorities wrong. Seemed to think I cared more about winning the Cup than I do about you staying alive. Just because I told her (Hermione) I didn't care if it threw you off, as long as you caught the Snitch first.'' (Wood/Oliver/Oliver Wood)
Wood shook his (Wood) head in disbelief. ``Honestly, the way she (Hermione) was yelling at me... you'd think I'd said something terrible... then I asked her (Hermione) how much longer she (Hermione) was going to keep it. He (Hermione) screwed up his (Hermione) face and imitated Professor McGonagall's severe voice.
``As long as necessary, Wood'... I reckon it's time you ordered a new broom, Harry. There's an order form at the back of Which Broomstick... you could get a Nimbus Two Thousand and One, like Malfoy's got.'' (unknown)

``I'm not buying anything Malfoy thinks is good,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry flatly.

January faded imperceptibly into February, with no change in the bitterly cold weather. The match against Ravenclaw was drawing nearer and nearer, but Harry still hadn't ordered a new broom. He (Harry) was now asking Professor McGonagall for news of the Firebolt after every Transfiguration lesson, Ron standing hopefully at his (Ron) shoulder, Hermione rushing past with her (Hermione) face averted.

``No, Potter, you can't have it back yet,'' (Professor)
Professor McGonagall told him (Professor) the twelfth time this happened, before he (Professor)'d even opened his (Professor) mouth.
``We've checked for most of the usual curses, but Professor Flitwick believes the broom might be carrying a Hurling Hex. I shall tell you once we've finished checking it. Now, please stop badgering me.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

To make matters even worse, Harry's anti-dementor lessons were not going nearly as well as he (Harry) had hoped. Several sessions on, he (Harry) was able to produce an indistinct, silvery shadow every time the boggart-dementor approached him (Harry), but his (Harry) Patronus was too feeble to drive the dementor away. All it did was hover, like a semitransparent cloud, draining Harry of energy as he (Harry) fought to keep it there. Harry felt angry with himself, guilty about his (Harry) secret desire to hear his (Harry) parents' voices again.

``You're expecting too much of yourself,'' (Professor)
said Professor Lupin, sternly in their fourth week of practice.
``For a thirteen-year-old wizard, even an indistinct Patronus is a huge achievement. You aren't passing out anymore, are you?'' (I)

I thought a Patronus would -- charge the dementors down or something,'' said Harry dispiritedly.

``Make them disappear --'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

``The true Patronus does do that,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``But you've achieved a great deal in a very short space of time. If the dementors put in an appearance at your next Quidditch match, You will be able to keep them at bay long enough to get back to the ground.'' (unknown)

``You said it's harder if there are loads of them,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.

``I have complete confidence in you,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, smiling.
``Here -- you've earned a drink - something from the Three Broomsticks. You won't have tried it before --'' (He)

He (Harry) pulled two bottles out of his (Harry) briefcase.

``Butterbeer!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, without thinking.
``Yeah, I like that stuff!'' (Lupin)

Lupin raised an eyebrow.

``Oh -Ron and Hermione brought me some back from Hogsmeade,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry lied quickly.

I see,'' said Lupin, though he (Harry) still looked slightly suspicious.

``Well -- let's drink to a Gryffindor victory against Ravenclaw! Not that I'm supposed to take sides, as a teacher... '' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
he (Harry) added hastily

They drank the butterbeer in silence, until Harry voiced something he (Harry)'d been wondering for a while.

``What's under a dementor's hood?'' (Professor)

Professor Lupin lowered his (Professor) bottle thoughtfully.

``Hmmm... well, the only people who really know are in no condition to tell us. You see, the dementor lowers its hood only to use its last and worst weapon.'' (unknown)

``What's that?'' (unknown)

``They call it the Dementor's Kiss,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, with a slightly twisted smile.
``It's what dementors do to those they wish to destroy utterly. I suppose there must be some kind of mouth under there, because they clamp their jaws upon the mouth of the victim and -- and suck out his (victim) soul.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry accidentally spat out a bit of butterbeer.

``What -- they kill --?'' (unknown)

``Oh no,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``Much worse than that. You can exist without your soul, you know, as long as your brain and heart are still working. But you'll have no sense of self anymore, no memory, no. .. anything. There's no chance at all of recovery. You'll just exist. As an empty shell. And your soul is gone forever... lost.'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

Lupin drank a little more butterbeer, then said,

``It's the fate that awaits Sirius Black. It was in the Daily Prophet this morning. The Ministry have given the dementors permission to perform it if they find him (Prophet).'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

Harry sat stunned for a moment at the idea of someone having their soul sucked out through their mouth. But then he (Harry) thought of Black.

``He (Prophet) deserves it,'' (he)
he (Harry) said suddenly.

``You think so?'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin lightly.
``Do you really think anyone deserves that?'' (unknown)

``Yes,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry defiantly.
``For... for some things...'' (He)

He (Harry) would have liked to have told Lupin about the conversation he (Harry)'d overheard about Black in the Three Broomsticks, about Black betraying his (Black) mother and father, but it would have involved revealing that he (Black)'d gone to Hogsmeade without permission, and he (Black) knew Lupin wouldn't be very impressed by that. So he (Black) finished his (Black) butterbeer, thanked Lupin, and left the History of Magic classroom.

Harry half wished that he (Harry) hadn't asked what was under a dementor's hood, the answer had been so horrible, and he (Harry) was so lost in unpleasant thoughts of what it would feel like to have your soul sucked out of you that he (Harry) walked headlong into Professor McGonagall halfway up the stairs.

``Do watch where you're going, Potter!'' (unknown)

``Sorry, Professor --'' (unknown)

``I've just been looking for you in the Gryffindor common room, Well, here it is, we've done everything we could think of, and there doesn't seem to be anything wrong with it at all. You've got a very good friend somewhere, Potter...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry's jaw dropped. She (Harry) was holding out his (Harry) Firebolt, and it looked as magnificent as ever.

``I can have it back?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry said weakly.
``Seriously?'' (unknown)

``Seriously,'' (Professor)
said Professor McGonagall, and she (Harry) was actually smiling.
``I daresay you'll need to get the feel of it before Saturday's match, won't you? And Potter -- do try and win, won't you? Or we'll be out of the running for the eighth year. in a row, as Professor Snape was kind enough to remind me only last night...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Speechless, Harry carried the Firebolt back upstairs toward Gryffindor Tower. As he (Harry) turned a corner, he (Harry) saw Ron dashing toward him (Ron), grinning from ear to ear.

``She (You) gave it to You? Excellent! Listen, can I still have a go on it? Tomorrow?'' (unknown)

``Yeah... anything,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, his (Harry) heart lighter than it had been in a month.
``You know what -- we should make up with Hermione... She (Hermione) was only trying to help...'' (Ron)

``Yeah, all right,'' (Ron)
said Ron.
``She (Hermione)'s in the common room how working, for a change --'' (Gryffindor)

They turned into the corridor to Gryffindor Tower and saw Neville Longbottom, pleading with Sir Cadogan, who seemed to be refusing him (Longbottom) entrance.

``I wrote them down!'' (Neville/Neville Longbottom/Longbottom)
Neville was saying tearfully.
``But I must've dropped them somewhere!'' (unknown)

``A likely tale!'' (Cadogan)
roared Sir Cadogan. Then, spotting Harry and Ron:
``Good even, my fine young yeomen! Come clap this loon in irons. He (loon) is trying to force entry to the chambers within!'' (Ron)

``Oh, shut up,'' (Ron)
said Ron as he (Ron) and Harry drew level with Neville.

``I've lost the passwords!'' (Neville/Neville Longbottom/Longbottom)
Neville told them miserably.
``I made him (loon) tell me what passwords he (loon) was going to use this week, because he (loon) keeps changing them, and now I don't know what I've done with them!'' (unknown)

``Oddsbodikins,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry to Sir Cadogan, who looked extremely disappointed and reluctantly swung forward to let them into the common room. There was a sudden, excited murmur as every head turned and the next moment, Harry was surrounded by people exclaiming over his (Harry) Firebolt.

``Where'd you get it, Harry?'' (unknown)

``Will you let me have a go?'' (unknown)
``Have you ridden it yet, Harry?'' (unknown)

``Ravenclaw'll have no chance, they're all on Cleansweep Sevens!'' (unknown)

After ten minutes or so, during which the Firebolt was Passed around and admired from every angle, the crowd dispersed and Harry and Ron had a clear view of Hermione, the only person who hadn't rushed over to them, bent over her (Hermione) work and carefully avoiding their eyes. Harry and Ron approached her (Hermione) table and at last, she (Hermione) looked up.

``I got it back,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, grinning at her (Hermione) and holding up the Firebolt.

``See, Hermione? There wasn't anything wrong with it!'' (Ron)
said Ron.

said Hermione.
