Flint and Wood approached each other and grasped each other's hand very tightly; it looked as though each was trying to break the other's fingers.

``Mount your brooms!'' (Madam Hooch)
said Madam Hooch.
``Three... two... one...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

The sound of her (Hooch) whistle was lost in the roar from the crowd as fourteen brooms rose into the air. Harry felt his (Harry) hair fly back off his (Harry) forehead; his (Harry) nerves left him (Harry) in the thrill of the flight; he (Harry) glanced around, saw Malfoy on his (Harry) tail, and sped off in search of the Snitch.

``And it's Gryffindor in possession, Alicia Spinner of Gryffindor with the Quaffle, heading straight for the Slytherin goal posts, looking good, Alicia! Argh, no -- Quaffle intercepted by Warrington, Warrington of Slytherin tearing UP the field -- WHAM! -- nice Bludger work there by George Weasley, Warrington drops the Quaffle, it's caught by -- Johnson, Gryffindor back in possession, come on, Angelina -- nice swerve around Montague -- duck, Angelina, that's a Bludger!- SHE SCORES! TEN-ZERO TO GRYFFINDOR!'' (Angelina)

Angelina punched the air as she (Angelina) soared around the end of the field; the sea of scarlet below was screaming its delight

``OUCH!'' (she)

Angelina was nearly thrown from her (Angelina) broom as Marcus Flint went smashing into her (Angelina).

``Sorry!'' (Flint)
said Flint as the crowd below booed.
``Sorry, didn't see her (Angelina)!'' (Fred/Fred Weasley)

A moment later, Fred Weasley chucked his (Weasley) Beater's club at the back of Flint's head. Flint's nose smashed into the handle of his (Flint) broom and began to bleed.

``That will do!'' (unknown)
shrieked Madam Hooch, zooming between then.
``Penalty shot to Gryffindor for an unprovoked attack on their Chaser! Penalty shot to Slytherin for deliberate damage to their Chaser!'' (unknown)

``Come off it, Miss!'' (Fred/Fred Weasley)
howled Fred, but Madam Hooch blew her (Hooch) whistle and Alicia flew forward to take the penalty.

``Come on, Alicia!'' (Lee/Lee Jordan/Jordan)
yelled Lee into the silence that had descended on the crowd. ``YES! SHE
``S BEATEN THE KEEPER! TWENTY-ZERO TO GRYFFINDOR!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry turned the Firebolt sharply to watch Flint, still bleeding freely, fly forward to take the Slytherin penalty. Wood was hovering in front of the Gryffindor goal posts, his (Wood) jaw clenched.

''`Course, Wood's a superb Keeper!'' (Gryffindor)
Lee Jordan told the crowd as Flint waited for Madam Hooch's whistle. ``Superb! Very difficult to pass -- very difficult indeed -- YES! I DON``T BELIEVE IT! HE (their)
``S SAVED IT!'' (HE)

Relieved, Harry zoomed away, gazing around for the Snitch, but still making sure he (Harry) caught every word of Lee's commentary. It was essential that he (Lee) hold Malfoy off the Snitch until Gryffindor was more than fifty points up --

``Gryffindor in possession, no, Slytherin in possession -- no!

Gryffindor back in possession and it's Katie Bell, Katie Bell for Gryffindor with the Quaffle, she (Bell)'s streaking up the field -- THAT WAS DELIBERATE!'' (Gryffindor)

Montague, a Slytherin Chaser, had swerved in front of Katie, and instead of seizing the Quaffle had grabbed her (Katie) head. Katie cart wheeled in the air, managed to stay on her (Katie) broom, but dropped the Quaffle.

Madam Hooch's whistle rang out again as she (Hooch) soared over to Montague and began shouting at him (Lee). A minute later, Katie had put another penalty past the Slytherin Seeker.

``THIRTY-ZERO! TAKE THAT, YOU DIRTY, CHEATING --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Jordan, if you can't commentate in an unbiased way --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``I'm telling it like it is, Professor!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry felt a huge jolt of excitement. He (Harry) had seen the Snitch it was shimmering at the foot of one of the Gryffindor goal posts -- but he (Harry) mustn't catch it yet -- and if Malfoy saw it -

Faking a look of sudden concentration, Harry pulled his (Harry) Firebolt around and sped off toward the Slytherin end -- it worked. Malfoy went haring after him (Malfoy), clearly thinking Harry had seen the Snitch there...

WHOOSH.

One of the Bludgers came streaking past Harry's right ear, hit by the gigantic Slytherin Beater, Derrick. Then again

WHOOSH.

The second Bludger grazed Harry's elbow. The other Beater, Bole, was closing in.

Harry had a fleeting glimpse of Bole and Derrick zooming toward him (Harry), clubs raised --

He (Harry) turned the Firebolt upward at the last second, and Bole and Derrick collided with a sickening crunch.

``Ha haaa!'' (Lee/Lee Jordan/Jordan)
yelled Lee Jordan as the Slytherin Beaters lurched away from each other, clutching their heads.
``Too bad, boys! You'll need to get up earlier than that to beat a Firebold And it's Gryffindor in possession again, as Johnson takes the Quaffle -- Flint alongside her (Bell) -- poke him (Flint) in the eye, Angelina! -- it was a joke, Professor, it was a joke -- oh no -- Flint in possession, Flint flying toward the Gryffindor goal posts, come on now, Wood, save --!'' (Flint)

But Flint had scored; there was an eruption of cheers from the Slytherin end, and Lee swore so badly that Professor McGonagall tried to tug the magical megaphone away from him (Lee).

``Sorry, Professor, sorry! WoiA happen again! So, Gryffindor in the lead, thirty points to ten, and Gryffindor in possession --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

it was turning into the dirtiest game Harry had ever played in. Enraged that Gryffindor had taken such an early lead, the Slytherins were rapidly resorting to any means to take the Quaffle. Bole hit Alicia with his (Harry) club and tried to say he (Harry)'d thought she (Alicia) was a Bludger. George Weasley elbowed Bole in the face in retaliation. Madam Hooch awarded both teams penalties, and Wood pulled off another spectacular save, making the score forty-ten to Gryffindor.

The Snitch had disappeared again. Malfoy was still keeping close to Harry as he (Harry) soared over the match, looking around for it once Gryffindor was fifty points ahead -

Katie scored. Fifty-ten. Fred and George Weasley were swooping around her (Katie), clubs raised, in case any of the Slytherins were thinking of revenge. Bole and Derrick took advantage of Fred's and George's absence to aim both Bludgers at Wood; they caught him (Wood) in the stomach, one after the other, and he (Wood) rolled over in the air, clutching his (Wood) broom, completely winded.

Madam Hooch was beside herself

``YOU DO NOT ATTACK THE KEEPER UNLESS THE QUAFFLE IS WITHIN THE SCORING AREA!'' (Madam Hooch)
she (Hooch) shrieked at Bole and Derrick.
``Gryffindor penalty!'' (Angelina)

And Angelina scored. Sixty-ten. Moments later, Fred Weasley pelted a Bludger at Warrington, knocking the Quaffle Out of his (Weasley) hands; Alicia seized it and put it through the Slytherin goal -- seventy-ten.

The Gryffindor crowd below was screaming itself hoarse -- Gryffindor was sixty points in the lead, and if Harry caught the Snitch now, the Cup was theirs. Harry could almost feel hundreds of eyes following him (Harry) as he (Harry) soared around the field, high above the rest of the game, with Malfoy speeding along behind him (Malfoy).

And then he (Malfoy) saw it. The Snitch was sparkling twenty feet above him (Malfoy).

Harry put on a huge burst of speed; the wind was roaring in his (Harry) ears; he (Harry) stretched out his (Harry) hand, but suddenly, the Firebolt was slowing down --

Horrified, he (Harry) looked around. Malfoy had thrown himself forward, grabbed hold of the Firebolt's tail, and was pulling it back.

``You --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry was angry enough to hit Malfoy, but couldn't reach -- Malfoy was panting with the effort of holding onto the Firebolt, but his (Malfoy) eyes were sparkling maliciously. He (Malfoy) had achieved what he (Malfoy)'d wanted to do -- the Snitch had disappeared again.

``Penalty! Penalty to Gryffindor! I've never seen such tactics.'' (Madam Hooch)
Madam Hooch screeched, shooting up to where Malfoy was sliding back onto his (Malfoy) Nimbus Two Thousand and One.

``YOU CHEATING SCUM!'' (Lee/Lee Jordan/Jordan)
Lee Jordan was howling into the megaphone, dancing out of Professor McGonagall's reach.
``YOU FILTHY, CHEATING B --'' (Pprofessor McGonagall)

Pprofessor McGonagall didn't even bother to tell him (Professor) off She (Hooch) was actually shaking her (Hooch) finger in Malfoys direction, her (Hooch) hat had fallen off, and she (Hooch) too was shouting furiously.

Alicia took Gryffindor's penalty, but she (Alicia) was so angry she (Alicia) missed by several feet. The Gryffindor team was losing concentration and the Slytherins, delighted by Malfoy's foul on Harry, were being spurred on to greater heights.

``Slytherin in possession, Slytherin heading for goal -- Montague scores --'' (Lee/Lee Jordan/Jordan)
Lee groaned.
``Seventy- twenty to Gryffindor...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry was now marking Malfoy so closely their knees kept hitting each other. Harry wasn't going to let Malfoy anywhere near the Snitch...

``Get out of it, Potter!'' (Malfoy)
Malfoy yelled in frustration as he (Malfoy) tried to turn and found Harry blocking him (Harry).

``Angelina Johnson gets the Quaffle for Gryffindor, come on, Angelina, COME ON!'' (Harry)

Harry looked around. Every single Slytherin player apart from Malfoy was streaking up the pitch toward Angelina, including the Slytherin Keeper -- they were all going to block her (Angelina) --

Harry wheeled the Firebolt around, bent so low he (Harry) was lying flat along the handle, and kicked it forward. Like a bullet, he (Harry) shot toward the Slytherins.

``AAAAAAARRRGH!'' (unknown)

They scattered as the Firebolt zoomed toward them; Angelina's Way was clear.

``SHE SCORES! SHE SCORES! Gryffindor leads by eighty Points to twenty!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry, who had almost pelted headlong into the stands, skidded to a halt in midair, reversed, and zoomed back into the middle of the field.

And then he (Harry) saw something to make his (Harry) heart stand still. Malfoy was diving, a look of triumph on his (Malfoy) face -- there, a few feet above the grass below, was a tiny, golden glimmer -

Harry urged the Firebolt downward, but Malfoy was miles ahead -

``Go! Go! Go!'' (Malfoy/Draco Malfoy/Draco)
Harry urged his (Harry) broom. He (Harry) was gaining on Malfay -- Harry flattened himself to the broom handle as Bole sent a Bludger at him (Harry) -- he (Harry) was at Malfoy's ankles -- he (Malfoy) was level --

Harry threw himself forward, took both hands off his (Harry) broom. He (Harry) knocked Malfoy's arm out of the way and --

``YES!'' (Malfoy/Draco Malfoy/Draco)

He (Malfoy) pulled out of his (Malfoy) dive, his (Malfoy) hand in the air, and the stadium exploded. Harry soared above the crowd, an odd ringing in his (Harry) ears. The tiny golden ball was held tight in his (Harry) fist, beating its wings hopelessly against his (Harry) fingers.

Then Wood was speeding toward him (Wood), half-blinded by tears; he (Wood) seized Harry around the neck and sobbed unrestrainedly into his (Harry) shoulder. Harry felt two large thumps as Fred and George hit them; then Angelina's, Alicia's, and Katie's voices,

``We've won the Cup! We've won the Cup!'' (Katie/Katie Bell/Bell)
Tangled together in a many-armed hug, the Gryffindor team sank, yelling hoarsely, back to earth.

Wave upon wave of crimson supporters was pouring over the barriers onto the field. Hands were raining down on their backs. Harry had a confused impression of noise and bodies pressing in on him (Harry). Then he (Harry), and the rest of the team, were hoisted onto the shoulders of the crowd. Thrust into the light, he (Harry) saw Hagrid, Plastered with crimson rosettes --

``Yeh beat 'em, Harry, yeh beat 'em!

Wait till I tell Buckbeak!'' (Hagrid)

There was Percy, jumping up and down like a maniac, all dignity forgotten. Professor McGonagall was sobbing harder even than Wood, wiping her (Harry) eyes with an enormous Gryffindor flag; and there, fighting their way toward Harry, were Ron and Hermione. Words failed them. They simply beamed as Harry was borne toward the stands, where Dumbledore stood waiting with the enormous Quidditch Cup.

If only there had been a dementor around... As a sobbing Wood passed Harry the Cup, as he (Harry) lifted it into the air, Harry felt he (Harry) could have produced the world's best Patronus.

CHAPTER SIXTEEN

PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY``S PREDICTION

Harry's euphoria at finally winning the Quidditch Cup lasted at least a week. Even the weather seemed to be celebrating; as June approached, the days became cloudless and sultry, and all anybody felt like doing was strolling onto the grounds and flopping down on the grass with several pints of iced pumpkin juice, perhaps playing a casual game of Gobstones or watching the giant squid propel itself dreamily across the surface of the lake.

But they couldn't. Exams were nearly upon them, and instead of lazing around outside, the students were forced to remain inside the castle, trying to bully their brains into concentrating while enticing wafts of summer air drifted in through the windows. Even Fred and George Weasley had been spotted working; they were about to take their O.W.L.s -LRB-Ordinary Wizarding Levels-RRB-. Percy was getting ready to take his (Percy) N.E.W.T.s -LRB-Nastily Exhausting Wizarding Tests-RRB-, the highest qualification Hogwarts offered. As Percy hoped to enter the Ministry of Magic, he (Percy) needed top grades. He (Percy) was becoming increasingly edgy, and gave very severe punishments to anybody who disturbed the quiet of the common room in the evenings. In fact, the only person who seemed more anxious than Percy was Hermione.

Harry and Ron had given up asking her (Hermione) how she (Hermione) was managing to attend several classes at once, but they couldn't restrain themselves when they saw the exam schedule she (Hermione) had drawn up for herself. The first column read:

Monday

9 o'clock, Arithmancy

9 o'clock, Transfiguration

Lunch

1 o'clock, Charms

1 o'clock, Ancient Runes

``Hermione?'' (Ron)
Ron said cautiously, because she (Hermione) was liable to explode when interrupted these days.
``Er -- are you sure you've copied down these times right?'' (unknown)

``What?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
snapped Hermione, picking up the exam schedule and examining it.
``Yes, of course I have.'' (unknown)

``Is there any point asking how you're going to sit for two exams at once?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.

``No,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione shortly.
``Have either of you seen my copy of Numerology and Gramatica?'' (unknown)

``Oh, yeah, I borrowed it for a bit of bedtime reading,'' (Ron)
said Ron, but very quietly. Hermione started shifting heaps of parchment Harry, Ron, and Hermione plenty of opportunity to speak to Hagrid.

``Beaky's gettin' a bit depressed,'' (Hagrid)
Hagrid told them, bending low on the pretense of checking that Harry's flobberworm was still alive.
``Bin cooped up too long. But still... we'll know day after tomorrow -- one way or the other --'' (unknown)

They had Potions that afternoon, which was an unqualified disaster. Try as Harry might, he (Harry) couldn't get his (Harry) Confusing Concoction to thicken, and Snape, standing watch with an air of vindictive pleasure, scribbled something that looked suspiciously like a zero onto his (Snape) notes before moving away.

Then came Astronomy at midnight, up on the tallest tower; History of Magic on Wednesday morning, in which Harry scribbled everything Florean Fortescue had ever told him (Harry) about medieval witch-hunts, while wishing he (Harry) could have had one of Fortescue's choco-nut sundaes with him (Harry) in the stifling classroom. Wednesday afternoon meant Herbology, in the greenhouses under a baking-hot sun; then back to the common room once more, with sunburnt necks, thinking longingly of this time next day, when it would all be over.

Their second to last exam, on Thursday morning, was Defense Against the Dark Arts. Professor Lupin had compiled the most unusual exam any of them had ever taken; a sort of obstacle course outside in the sun, where they had to wade across a deep paddling pool containing a grindylow, cross a series of potholes full of Red Caps, squish their way across a patch of marsh while ignoring misleading directions from a hinkypunk, then climb into an old trunk and battle with a new boggart.

``Excellent, Harry,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
Lupin muttered as Harry climbed out of the trunk, grinning.
``Full marks.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Flushed with his (Harry) success, Harry hung around to watch Ron and Hermione. Ron did very well until he (Ron) reached the hinkypunk, which successfully confused him (Ron) into sinking waist-high into the quagmire. Hermione did everything perfectly until she (Hermione) reached the trunk with the boggart in it. After about a minute inside it, she (Hermione) burst out again, screaming.

``Hermione!'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, startled.
``What's the matter?'' (unknown)

``P -- P -- Professor McGonagall!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione gasped, pointing into the trunk.
``Sh -- she (Hermione) said I'd failed everything!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

It took a little while to calm Hermione down. When at last she (Hermione) had regained a grip on herself, she (Hermione), Harry, and Ron went back to the castle. Ron was still slightly inclined to laugh at Hermione's boggart, but an argument was averted by the sight that met them on the top of the steps.

Cornelius Fudge, sweating slightly in his (Fudge) pinstriped cloak, was standing there staring out at the grounds. He (Fudge) started at the sight of Harry.

``Hello there, Harry!'' (he)
he (Harry) said.
``Just had an exam, I expect? Nearly finished?'' (unknown)

``Yes,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry. Hermione and Ron, not being on speaking terms with the Minister of Magic, hovered awkwardly in the background.

``Lovely day,'' (Fudge)
said Fudge, casting an eye over the lake.

``Pity... pity...'' (He)

He (Harry) sighed deeply and looked down at Harry.

``I'm here on an unpleasant mission, Harry. The Committee for the Disposal of Dangerous Creatures required a witness to the execution of a mad hippogriff. As I needed to visit Hogwarts to check on the Black situation, I was asked to step in.'' (unknown)

``Does that mean the appeal's already happened?'' (Ron)
Ron interrupted, stepping forward.

``No, no, it's scheduled for this afternoon,'' (Fudge)
said Fudge, looking curiously at Ron.

``Then you might not have to witness an execution at A!'' (unknown)
said Eon stoutly.
``The hippogriff might get off!'' (Fudge)

Before Fudge could answer, two wizards came through the castle doors behind him (Ron). One was so ancient he (Ron) appeared to be withering before their very eyes; the other was tall and strapping, with a thin back mustache. Harry gathered that they were representatives of the Committee for the Disposal of Dangerous Creatures, because tie very old wizard squinted toward Hagrid's cabin and said in a feeble voice,

``Dear, dear, I'm getting too old for this... Two o'clock, isn't it, Fudge?'' (Hagrid)

The black-mustached man was fingering something in his (man) belt; Harry looked and saw that he (Harry) was running one broad thumb along the blade of a shining axe. Ron opened his (Ron) mouth to say something, but Hermione nudged him (Ron) hard in the ribs and jerked her (Hermione) head toward the entrance hall.

``Why'd you stop me?'' (Ron)
said Ron angrily as they entered the Great Hall for lunch.
``Did you see them? They've even got the axe ready! This isn't justice!'' (unknown)

``Ron, your dad works for the Ministry, you can't go saying things like that to his (Ron) boss!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione, but she (Hermione) too looked very upset.
``As long as Hagrid keeps his (Ron) head this time, and argue, hi case properly, they can't possibly execute Buckbeak...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

But Harry could tell Hermione didn't really believe what she (Hermione) was saying. All around them, people were talking excitedly as they ate their lunch, happily anticipating the end of the exams that afternoon, but Harry, Ron, and Hermione, lost in worry about Hagrid and Buckbeak, didn't join in.

Harry's and Ron's last exam was Divination; Hermione's, Muggle Studies. They walked up the marble staircase together; Hermione left them on the first floor and Harry and Ron proceeded all the way up to the seventh, where many of their class were sitting on the spiral staircase to Professor Trelawney's classroom, trying to cram in a bit of last-minute studying.

``She (it)'s seeing us all separately,'' (Neville/Neville Longbottom/Longbottom)
Neville informed them as they went to sit down next to him (Neville). He (Neville) had his (Neville) copy of Unfogging the Future open on his (Neville) lap at the pages devoted to crystal gazing.
``Have either of you ever seen anything in a crystal ball?'' (he)
he (Neville) asked them unhappily.

``Nope,'' (Ron)
said Ron in an offhand voice. He (Ron) kept checking his (Ron) watch; Harry. knew that he (Harry) was counting down the time until Buckbeak's appeal started.

The line of people outside the classroom shortened very slowly. As each person climbed back down the silver ladder, the rest of the class hissed,

``What did she (it) ask? Was it okay?'' (each person)

But they all refused to say.

``She (it) says the crystal ball's told her (it) that if I tell you, I'll have a horrible accident!'' (Neville/Neville Longbottom/Longbottom)
squeaked Neville as he (Neville) clambered back down the ladder toward Harry and Ron, who had now reached the landing.

``That's convenient,'' (Ron)
snorted Ron.
``You know, I'm starting to think Hermione was right about her (Hermione)'' (he)
-- he (Ron) jabbed his (Ron) thumb toward the trapdoor overhead --
``she (Hermione)'s a right old fraud.'' (he)

``Yeah,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, looking at his (Harry) own watch. It-was now two o'clock.
``Wish she (Hermione)'d hurry up...'' (Parvati)

Parvati came back down the ladder glowing with pride.

``She (Hermione) says I've got all the makings of a true Seer,'' (she)
she (Parvati) informed Harry and Ron.
``I saw loads of stuff... Well, good luck!'' (She)

She (Parvati) hurried off down the spiral staircase toward Lavender.

``Ronald Weasley,'' (Ron)
said the familiar, misty voice from over their heads. Ron grimaced at Harry and climbed the silver ladder out of sight. Harry was now the only person left to be tested. He (Harry) settled himself on the floor with his (Harry) back against the wall, listening to a fly buzzing in the sunny window, his (Harry) mind across the grounds with Hagrid.

Finally, after about twenty minutes, Ron's large feet reappeared on the ladder.

``How'd it go?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry asked him (Harry), standing up.

``Rubbish,'' (Ron)
said Ron.
``Couldn't see a thing, so I made some stuff up. Don't think she (Hermione) was convinced, though...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Meet you in the common room,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry muttered as Professor Trelawney's voice called,
``Harry Potter!'' (Trelawney/Sibyll/Sibyll Trelawney)

The tower room was hotter than ever before; the curtains were closed, the fire was alight, and the usual sickly scent made Harry cough as he (Harry) stumbled through the clutter of chairs and table to where Professor Trelawney sat waiting for him (Professor) before a large crystal ball.

``Good day, my dear,'' (she)
she (Harry) said softly.
``If you would kindly gaze into the Orb... Take your time, now... then tell me what you see within it...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry bent over the crystal ball and stared, stared as hard as he (Harry) could, willing it to show him (Harry) something other than swirling white fog, but nothing happened.

``Well?'' (Professor)
Professor Trelawney prompted delicately.
``What do you see?'' (unknown)

The heat was overpowering and his (Professor) nostrils were stinging with the perfumed smoke wafting from the fire beside them. He (Professor) thought of what Ron had just said, and decided to pretend.

``Er --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry,
``a dark shape... um...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``What does it resemble?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
whispered Professor Trelawney.
``Think, now...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry cast his (Harry) mind around and it landed on Buckbeak.

``A hippogriff,'' (he)
he (Harry) said firmly.

``Indeed!'' (Professor)
whispered Professor Trelawney, scribbling keenly on the parchment perched upon her (Professor) knees.
``My boy, you may well be seeing the outcome of poor Hagrid's trouble with the Ministry of Magic! Look closer... Does the hippogriff appear to... have its head?'' (unknown)

``Yes,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry firmly.

``Are you sure?'' (Professor)
Professor Trelawney urged him (Harry).
``Are you quite sure, dear? You don't see it writhing on the ground, perhaps, and a shadowy figure raising an axe behind it?'' (unknown)

``No!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, starting to feel slightly sick.

``No blood? No weeping Hagrid?'' (unknown)

``No!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry again, wanting more than ever to leave the room and the heat.
``It looks fine, it's - - flying away...'' (Professor)

Professor Trelawney sighed.

``Well, dear, I think we'll leave it there... A little disappointing... but I'm sure you did your best.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Relieved, Harry got up, picked up his (Harry) bag and turned to go, but then a loud, harsh voice spoke behind him (Harry).

``IT WILL HAPPEN TONIGHT.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry wheeled around. Professor Trelawney had gone rigid in her (Professor) armchair; her (Professor) eyes were unfocused and her (Professor) mouth sagging.

``S -- sorry?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.

But Professor Trelawney didn't seem to hear him (Harry). Her (Professor) eyes started to roll. Harry sat there in a panic. She (Professor) looked as though she (Professor) was about to have some sort of seizure. He (Harry) hesitated, thinking of running to the hospital wing -- and then Professor Trelawney spoke again, in the same harsh voice, quite unlike her (Professor) own:

``THE DARK LORD LIES ALONE AND FRIENDLESS, ABANDONED BY HIS (I) FOLLOWERS. HIS (I) SERVANT HAS BEEN CHAINED THESE TWELVE YEARS. TONIGHT, BEFORE MIDNIGHT... THE SERVANT WILL BREAK FREE AND SET OUT TO REJOIN HIS (I) MASTER. THE DARK LORD WILL RISE AGAIN WITH HIS (I) SERVANTS AID, GREATER AND MORE TERRIBLE THAN EVER HE (I) WAS. TONIGHT... BEFORE MIDNIGHT... THE SERVANT... WILL SET OU... TO REJOIN... HIS (I) MASTER...

Professor Trelawney's head fell forward onto her (I) chest. She (I) made a grunting sort of noise. Harry sat there, staring at her (I). Then, quite suddenly, Professor Trelawney's head snapped up again.

``I'm so sorry, dear boy,'' (she)
she (Professor) said dreamily,
``the heat of the day, you know... I drifted off for a moment...'' (she)

Harry sat there, staring at her (Professor).

``Is there anything wrong, my dear?'' (unknown)

``You -- you just told me that the -- the Dark Lord's going to rise again... that his (Lord) servant's going to go back to him (Lord).

Professor Trelawney looked thoroughly startled.

``The Dark Lord? He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named? My dear boy, that's hardly something to joke about... Rise again, indeed --'' (unknown)

,

``But you just said it! You. said the Dark Lord --'' (unknown)

``I think you must have dozed off too, dear!'' (Professor)
said Professor Trelawney.
``I would certainly not presume to predict anything quite as far-fetched as that!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry climbed back down the ladder and the spiral staircase, wondering... had he (Harry) just heard Professor Trelawney make a real prediction? Or had that been her (Professor) idea of an impressive end to the test?

Five minutes later he (Professor) was dashing past the security trolls outside the entrance to Gryffindor Tower, Professor Trelawney's words still resounding in his (Professor) head. People were striding past him (Professor) in the opposite direction, laughing and joking, heading for the grounds and a bit of long-awaited freedom; by the time he (Professor) had reached the portrait hole and entered the common room, it was almost deserted. Over in the corner, however, sat Ron and Hermione.

``Professor Trelawney,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry panted,
``just told me --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

But he (Harry) stopped abruptly at the sight of their faces.

``Buckbeak lost,'' (Ron)
said Ron weakly.
``Hagrid's just sent this.'' (Hagrid)

Hagrid's note was dry this time, no tears had splattered it, yet his (Ron) hand seemed to have shaken so much as he (Ron) wrote that it was hardly legible.

Lost appeal. They're going to execute at sunset. Nothing you can do. Don't come down. I don't want you to see it.

Hagrid

``We've got to go,'' (Hagrid)
said Harry at once.
``He (Professor) can't just sit there on his (Professor) own, waiting for the executioner!'' (unknown)

``Sunset, though,'' (Ron)
said Ron, who was staring out the window ill a glazed sort of way.
``We'd never be allowed... `specially you, Harry...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry sank his (Harry) head into his (Harry) hands, thinking.

``If we only had the Invisibility Cloak...'' (unknown)

``Where is it?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione.

Harry told her (Hermione) about leaving it in the passageway under the one-eyed witch.

''... if Snape sees me anywhere near there again, I'm in serious trouble,'' (the witch)
he (Snape) finished.

``That's true,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione, getting to her (Hermione) feet.
``If he (Harry) sees you... How do you open the witch's hump again?'' (unknown)

``You -- you tap it and say, `Dissendium,''' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.
``But --'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Hermione didn't wait for the rest of his (Harry) sentence; she (Hermione) strode across the room, pushed open the Fat Lady's portrait and vanished from sight.

``She (witch) hasn't gone to get it?'' (Ron)
Ron said, staring after her (Lady).

She (Lady) had. Hermione returned a quarter of an hour later with the silvery cloak folded carefully under her (Hermione) robes.

``Hermione, I don't know what's gotten, into you lately!'' (Ron)
said Ron, astounded.
``First you hit Malfoy, then you walk out on Professor Trelawney --'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Hermione looked rather flattered.

They went down to dinner with everybody else, but did not return to Gryffindor Tower afterward. Harry had the cloak hidden down tie front of his (Harry) robes; he (Harry) had to keep his (Harry) arms folded to hide the lump. They skulked in an empty chamber off the entrance hall, listening, until they were sure it was deserted. They heard a last pair of people hurrying across the hall and a door slamming. Hermione poked her (Hermione) head around the door.

``Okay,'' (she)
she (Hermione) whispered,
``no one there -- cloak on --'' (she)

Walking very close together so that nobody would see them, they crossed the hall on tiptoe beneath the cloak, then walked down the stone front steps into the grounds. The sun was already sinking behind the Forbidden Forest, gilding the top branches of the trees.

They reached Hagrid's cabin and knocked. He (They) was a minute in answering, and when he (They) did, he (They) looked all around for his (They) visitor, pale-faced and trembling.

``It's us,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry hissed.
``We're wearing the Invisibility Cloak. Let us in and we can take it off.'' (unknown)

``Yeh shouldn've come!'' (Hagrid)
Hagrid whispered, but he (Harry) stood back, and they stepped inside. Hagrid shut the door quickly and Harry pulled off the cloak.

Hagrid was not crying, nor did he (Harry) throw himself upon their necks. He (Harry) looked like a man who did not know where he (Harry) was or what to do. This helplessness was worse to watch than tears.

``Wan' some tea?'' (he)
he (Harry) said. His (Harry) great hands were shaking as he (Harry) reached for the kettle.

``Where's Buckbeak, Hagrid?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione hesitantly.

I -- I took him (Harry) outside,'' said Hagrid, spilling milk all over the table as he (Harry) filled up the jug. ``He (Professor)'s tethered in me pumpkin patch. Thought he (Professor) oughta see the trees an' -- an' smell fresh air -- before

Hagrid's hand trembled so violently that the milk jug slipped from his (Professor) grasp and shattered all over the floor.

``I'll do it, Hagrid,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione quickly, hurrying over and starting to clean up the mess.

``There's another one in the cupboard,'' (Hagrid)
Hagrid said, sitting down and wiping his (Harry) forehead on his (Harry) sleeve. Harry glanced at Ron, who looked back hopelessly.

``Isn't there anything anyone can do, Hagrid?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry asked fiercely, sitting down next to him (Harry).
``Dumbledore --'' (Hagrid)

``He (Dumbledore)'s tried,'' (Hagrid)
said Hagrid.
``He (Dumbledore)'s got no power ter overrule the Committee. He (Dumbledore) told 'em Buckbeak's all right, but they're scared... Yeh know what Lucius Malfoy's like... threatened 'em, I expect... an' the executioner, Macnair, he (executioner)'s an old pal o' Malfoy's... but it'll be quick an' clean... an' I'll be beside him (Malfoy)... '' (Hagrid)

Hagrid swallowed. His (Harry) eyes were darting all over the cabin as though looking for some shred of hope or comfort.

``Dumbledore's gonna come down while it -- while it happens. Wrote me this mornin'. Said he (Said) wants ter -- ter be with me. Great man, Dumbledore...'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Hermione, who had been rummaging in Hagrid's cupboard for another milk jug, let out a small, quickly stifled sob. She (Hermione) straightened up with the new jug in her (Hermione) hands, fighting back tears.

``We'll stay with you too, Hagrid,'' (she)
she (Hermione) began, but Hagrid shook his (Harry) shaggy head.

``Yeh're ter go back up ter the castle. I told yeh, I don' wan' yeh watchin'. An' yeh shouldn' be down here anyway... If Fudge an' Dumbledore catch yeh out without permission, Harry, yeh'll be in big trouble.'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Silent tears were now streaming down Hermione's face, but she (Hermione) hid them from Hagrid, bustling around making tea. Then, as she (Hermione) picked up the milk bottle to pour some into the jug, she (Hermione) let out a shriek.

``Ron, I don't believe it -- it's Scabbers!'' (Ron)

Ron gaped at her (Hermione).

``What are you talking about?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Hermione carried the milk jug over to the table and turned it upside down. With a frantic squeak, and much scrambling to get back inside, Scabbers the rat came sliding out onto the table.

``Scabbers!'' (Ron)
said Ron blankly.
``Scabbers, what are you doing here?'' (He)

He (Ron) grabbed the struggling rat and held him (Ron) up to the light. Scabbers looked dreadful. He (Ron) was thinner than ever, large tufts of hair had fallen out leaving wide bald patches, and he (Ron) writhed in Ron's hands as though desperate to free himself

``It's okay, Scabbers!'' (Ron)
said Ron.
``No cats! There's nothing here to hurt you!'' (Hagrid)

Hagrid suddenly stood up, his (Ron) eyes fixed on the window. His (Ron) normally ruddy face had gone the color of parchment.

``They're comin'...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry, Ron, and Hermione whipped around. A group of men was walking down the distant castle steps. In front was Albus Dumbledore, his (Dumbledore) silver beard gleaming in the dying sun. Next to him (Dumbledore) trotted Cornelius Fudge. Behind them came the feeble old Committee member and the executioner, Macnair.

``Yeh gotta go,'' (Hagrid)
said Hagrid. Every inch of him (member) was trembling.
``They mustn' find yeh here... Go now...'' (Ron)

Ron stuffed Scabbers into his (Ron) pocket and Hermione picked up the cloak.

``I'll let yeh out the back way,'' (Hagrid)
said Hagrid.

They followed him (Ron) to the door into his (Ron) back garden. Harry felt strangely unreal, and even more so when he (Harry) saw Buckbeak a few yards away, tethered to a tree behind Hagrid's Pumpkin patch. Buckbeak seemed to know something was happening. He (Harry) turned his (Harry) sharp head from side to side and pawed the ground nervously.

``It's okay, Beaky,'' (Hagrid)
said Hagrid softly.
``It's okay...'' (He)
He (Harry) turned to Harry, Ron, and Hermione.
``Go on,'' (he)
he (Ron) said.
``Get goin'.'' (unknown)

But they didn't move.

``Hagrid, we can't --'' (unknown)

``We'll tell them what really happened --'' (unknown)

``They can't kill him (We) --'' (unknown)

``Go!'' (Hagrid)
said Hagrid fiercely.
``It's bad enough without you lot in trouble an' all!'' (unknown)

They had no choice. As Hermione threw the cloak over Harry and Ron, they heard voices at the front of the cabin. Hagrid looked at the place where they had just vanished from sight.

``Go quick,'' (he)
he (Ron) said hoarsely.
``Don' listen...'' (he)

And he (Ron) strode back into his (Ron) cabin as someone knocked at the front door.

Slowly, in a kind of horrified trance, Harry, Ron, and Hermione set off silently around Hagrid's house. As they reached the other side, the front door closed with a sharp snap.

``Please, let's hurry,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whispered.
``I can't stand it, I can't bear it...'' (unknown)

They started up the sloping lawn toward the castle. The sun was sinking fast now; the sky had turned to a clear, purple-tinged grey, but to the west there was a ruby-red glow.

Ron stopped dead.

``Oh, please, Ron,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione began.

``It's Scabbers -- he (Ron) won't -- stay put --'' (Ron)

Ron was bent over, trying to keep Scabbers in his (Ron) pocket, but the rat was going berserk; squeaking madly, twisting and flailing, trying to sink his (Ron) teeth into Ron's hand.

``Scabbers, it's me, you idiot, it's Ron,'' (Ron)
Ron hissed.

They heard a door open behind them and men's voices.

``Oh, Ron, please let's move, they're going to do it!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione breathed.

``Okay -- Scabbers, stay put --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

They walked forward; Harry, like Hermione, was trying not to listen to the rumble of voices behind them. Ron stopped again.

``I can't hold him (Ron) -- Scabbers, shut up, everyone'll hear us --'' (Hagrid)

The rat was squealing wildly, but not loudly enough to cover up the sounds drifting from Hagrid's garden. There was a jumble of indistinct male voices, a silence, and then, without warning, the unmistakable swish and thud of an axe.

Hermione swayed on the spot.

``They did it!'' (she)
she (Hermione) whispered to Harry.
``I d -- don't believe it -- they did it!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

CHAPTER SEVENTEEN

CAT, RAT, AND DOG

Harry's mind had gone blank with shock. The three of them stood transfixed with horror under the Invisibility Cloak. The very last rays of the setting sun were casting a bloody light over the long- shadowed grounds. Then, behind them, they heard a wild howling.

``Hagrid,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry muttered. Without thinking about what he (Harry) was doing, he (Harry) made to turn back, but both Ron and Hermione seized his (Ron) arms.

``We can't,'' (Ron)
said Ron, who was paper-white.
``He (Ron)'ll be in worse trouble if they know we've been to see him (Ron)...'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Hermione's breathing was shallow and uneven.

``How -- could -- they?'' (she)
she (Hermione) choked.
``How could they?'' (unknown)

``Come on,'' (Ron)
said Ron, whose teeth seemed to be chattering.

They set off back toward the castle, walking slowly to keep themselves hidden under the cloak. The light was fading fast now.

By the time they reached open ground, darkness was settling like a spell around them.

``Scabbers, keep still,'' (Ron)
Ron hissed, clamping his (Ron) hand over his (Ron) chest. The rat was wriggling madly. Ron came to a sudden halt, trying to force Scabbers deeper into his (Ron) pocket.
``What's the matter with you, You stupid rat? Stay still -- OUCH! He (Ron) bit me!'' (unknown)

``Ron, be quiet!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whispered urgently.
``Fudge'll be out here in a minute --'' (He)

``He (Ron) won't -- stay -- put --'' (He)

Scabbers was plainly terrified. He (Ron) was writhing with all his (Ron) might, trying to break free of Ron's grip.

``What's the matter with him (Ron)?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

But Harry had just seen -- stinking toward them, his (Harry) body low to the ground, wide yellow eyes glinting eerily in the darkness -- Crookshanks. Whether he (Harry) could see them or was following the sound of Scabbers's squeaks, Harry couldn't tell.

``Crookshanks!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione moaned.
``No, go away, Crookshanks! Go away!'' (the cat)

But the cat was getting nearer --

``Scabbers -- NO!'' (the cat)

Too late -- the rat had slipped between Ron's clutching fingers, hit the ground, and scampered away. In one bound, Crookshanks sprang after him (Ron), and before Harry or Hermione could stop him (Harry), Ron had thrown the Invisibility Cloak off himself and pelted away into the darkness.

``Ron!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione moaned.

She (Hermione) and Harry looked at each other, then followed at a sprint; it ''``as impossible to run full out under the cloak; they pulled it off and it streamed behind them like a banner as they hurtled after Ron; they could hear his (Ron) feet thundering along ahead and his (Ron) shouts at Crookshanks.

``Get away from him (Ron) -- get away -- Scabbers, come here --'' (unknown)

There was a loud thud.

``Gotcha! Get off, you stinking cat --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry and Hermione almost fell over Ron; they skidded to a stop right in front of him (Ron). He (Ron) was sprawled on the ground, but Scabbers was back in his (Ron) pocket; he (Ron) had both hands held tight over the quivering lump.

``Ron -- come on back under the cloak --'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione panted.
``Dumbledore the Minister -- they'll be coming back out in a minute --'' (an dog)

But before they could cover themselves again, before they could even catch their breath, they heard the soft pounding of gigantic paws... Something was bounding toward them, quiet as a shadow -- an enormous, pale-eyed, jet-black dog.

Harry reached for his (Harry) wand, but too late -- the dog had made an enormous leap and the front paws hit him (Harry) on the chest; he (Harry) keeled over backward in a whirl of hair; he (Harry) felt its hot breath, saw inch- long teeth -

But the force of its leap had carried it too far; it rolled off him (Harry). Dazed, feeling as though his (Harry) ribs were broken, Harry tried to stand up; he (Harry) could hear it growling as it skidded around for a new attack.

Ron was on his (Ron) feet. As the dog sprang back toward them he (Ron) pushed Harry aside; the dog's jaws fastened instead around Ron's outstretched arm. Harry lunged forward, he (Harry) seized a handful of the brute's hair, but it was dragging Ron away as easily as though he (Ron) were a rag doll --

Then, out of nowhere, something hit Harry so hard across the face he (Harry) was knocked off his (Harry) feet again. He (Harry) heard Hermione shriek with pain and fall too.

Harry groped for his (Harry) wand, blinking blood out of his (Harry) eyes

``Lumos!``he (Ron) whispered.

The wandlight showed him (Ron) the trunk of a thick tree; they had chased Scabbers into the shadow of the Whomping Willow and its branches were creaking as though in a high wind, whipping backward and forward to stop them going nearer.

And there, at the base of the trunk, was the dog, dragging Ron backward into a large gap in the roots -- Ron was fighting furiously, but his (Ron) head and torso were slipping out of sight --

``Ron!'' (Ron)
Harry shouted, trying to follow, but a heavy branch whipped lethally through the air and he (Harry) was forced backward again.

All they could see now was one of Ron's legs, which he (Ron) had hooked around a root in an effort to stop the dog from pulling him (Ron) farther underground -- but a horrible crack cut the air like a gunshot; Ron's leg had broken, and a moment later, his (Ron) foot vanished from sight.

``Harry -- we've got to go for help --'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione gasped; she (Hermione) was bleeding too; the Willow had cut her (Hermione) across the shoulder.

``No! That thing's big enough to eat him (Harry); we haven't got time --'' (unknown)

``Harry -- we're never going to get through without help --'' (unknown)

Another branch whipped down at them, twigs clenched like knuckles.

``If that dog can get in, we can,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry panted, darting here and there, trying to find a way through the vicious, swishing branches, but he (Harry) couldn't get an inch nearer to the tree roots without being in range of the tree's blows.

``Oh, help, help,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whispered frantically, dancing U._ certainly on the spot,
``Please...'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Crookshanks darted forward. He (Harry) slithered between the battering branches like a snake and placed his (Harry) front paws upon a knot on the trunk.

Abruptly, as though the tree had been turned to marble, it stopped moving. Not a leaf twitched or shook.

``Crookshanks!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whispered uncertainly. She (Hermione) now grasped Harry's arm painfully hard.
``How did he (Harry) know --?'' (unknown)

``He (Harry)'s friends with that dog,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry grimly.
``I've seen them together. Come on -- and keep your wand out --'' (Crookshanks)

They covered the distance to the trunk in seconds, but before they had reached the gap in the roots, Crookshanks had slid into it with a flick of his (Harry) bottlebrush tail. Harry went next; he (Harry) crawled forward, headfirst, and slid down an earthy slope to the bottom of a very low tunnel. Crookshanks was a little way along, his (Harry) eyes flashing in the light from Harry's wand. Seconds later, Hermione slithered down beside him (Harry).

``Where's Ron?'' (she)
she (Hermione) whispered in a terrified voice.

``This way,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, setting off, bent-backed, after Crookshanks.

``Where does this tunnel come out?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione asked breathlessly from behind him (Harry).

``I don't know... It's marked on the Marauder's Map but Fred and George said no one's ever gotten into it... It goes off the edge of the map, but it looked like it was heading for Hogsmeade...'' (unknown)

They moved as fast as they could, bent almost double; ahead of them, Crookshanks's tail bobbed in and out of view. On and on went the passage; it felt at least as long as the one to Honeydukes... All Harry could think of was Ron and what the enormous dog might be doing to him (Harry)... He (Harry) was drawing breath in sharp, painful gasps, running at a crouch...

And then the tunnel began to rise; moments later it twisted, and Crookshanks had gone. instead, Harry could see a patch of dim light through a small opening.

He (Harry) and Hermione paused, gasping for breath, edging forward. Both raised their wands to see what lay beyond.

It was a room, a very disordered, dusty room. Paper was peeling from the walls; there were stains all over the floor; every piece of furniture was broken as though somebody had smashed it. The windows were all boarded up.

Harry glanced at Hermione, who looked very frightened but nodded.

Harry pulled himself out of the hole, staring around. The room was deserted, but a door to their right stood open, leading to a shadowy hallway. Hermione suddenly grabbed Harry's arm again. Her (Hermione) wide eyes were traveling around the boarded windows.

``Harry,'' (she)
she (Hermione) whispered,
``I think we're in the Shrieking Shack.'' (she)

Harry looked around. His (Harry) eyes fell on a wooden chair near them. Large chunks had been torn out of it; one of the legs had been ripped off entirely.

``Ghosts didn't do that,'' (he)
he (Harry) said slowly.

At that moment, there was a creak overhead. Something had Moved upstairs. Both of them looked up at the ceiling. Hermione's grip on Harry's arm was so tight he (Harry) was losing feeling in-his fingers. He (Harry) raised his (Harry) eyebrows at her (Hermione); she (Hermione) nodded again and let go.

Quietly as they could, they crept out into the hall and UP the crumbling staircase. Everything was covered in a thick layer of dust except the floor, where a wide shiny stripe had been made by something being dragged upstairs.

They reached the dark landing.

``Nox,'' (unknown)
they whispered together, and the lights at the end of their wands went out. Only one door was open. As they crept toward it, they heard movement from behind it; a low moan, and then a deep, loud purring. They exchanged a last look, a last nod.

Wand held tightly before him (their), Harry kicked the door wide open.

On a magnificent four-poster bed with dusty hangings lay Crookshanks, purring loudly at the sight of them. On the floor beside him (Harry), clutching his (Harry) leg, which stuck out at a strange angle, was Ron.

Harry and Hermione dashed across to him (Harry).

``Ron -- are you okay?'' (unknown)

``Where's the dog?'' (unknown)

``Not a dog,'' (Ron)
Ron moaned. His (Harry) teeth were gritted with pain.
``Harry, it's a trap --'' (Ron)

``What --'' (Ron)

``He (Harry)'s the dog... he (Harry)'s an Animagus.'' (Ron)

Ron was staring over Harry's shoulder. Harry wheeled around. With a snap, the man in the shadows closed the door behind them.

A mass of filthy, matted hair hung to his (Harry) elbows. If eyes hadn't been shining out of the deep, dark sockets, he (Harry) might have been a corpse. The waxy skin was stretched so tightly over the bones of his (Harry) face, it looked like a skull. His (Harry) yellow teeth were bared in a grin. It was Sirius Black.

``Expelliarmus!``he (Harry) croaked, pointing Ron's wand at them.

Harry's and Hermione's wands shot out of their hands, high in the air, and Black caught them. Then he (Black) took a step closer. His (Black) eyes were fixed on Harry.

``I thought you'd come and help your friend,'' (he)
he (Black) said hoarsely.

His (Black) voice sounded as though he (Black) had long since lost the habit of using it.

``Your father would have done the same for me. Brave of you-RRB- not to run for a teacher. I'm grateful... it will make everything much easier...'' (father)

The taunt about his (Black) father rang in Harry's ears as though Black had bellowed it. A boiling hate erupted in Harry's chest, leaving no place for fear. For the first time in his (Harry) life, he (Harry) wanted his (Harry) wand back in his (Harry) hand, not to defend himself, but to attack... to kill. Without knowing what he (Harry) was doing, he (Harry) started forward, but there was a sudden movement on either side of him (Harry) and two pairs of hands grabbed him (Harry) and held him (Harry) back...

``No, Harry!'' (him)
Hermione gasped in a petrified whisper; Ron, however, spoke to Black.

``If you want to kill Harry, you'll have to kill us too!'' (he)
he (Ron) said fiercely, though the effort of standing upright was draining him (Ron) of still more color, and he (Ron) swayed slightly as he (Ron) spoke.

Something flickered in Black's shadowed eyes.

``Lie down,'' (he)
he (Black) said quietly to Ron.
``You will damage that leg even more.'' (unknown)

``Did you hear me?'' (Ron)
Ron said weakly, though he (Ron) was clinging painfully to Harry to stay upright.
``You'll have to kill all three of us!'' (unknown)

``There'll be only one murder here tonight,'' (Brack grin)
said Brack, and his (Harry) grin widened.

``Why's that?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry spat, trying to wrench himself free of Ron, and Hermione.
``Didn't care last time, did you? Didn't mind slaughtering all those Muggles to get at Pettigrew... What's the matter, gone soft in Azkaban?'' (unknown)

``Harry!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whimpered.
``Be quiet!'' (unknown)

``HE (Harry) KILLED MY MUM AND DAD!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry roared, and with a huge effort he (Harry) broke free of Hermione's and Ron's restraint and lunged forward -

He (Ron) had forgotten about magic -- he (Ron) had forgotten that he (Ron) was short and skinny and thirteen, whereas Black was a tall, full-grown man -- all Harry knew was that he (Harry) wanted to hurt Black as badly as he (Harry) could and that he (Harry) didn't care how much he (Harry) got hurt in return --

Perhaps it was the shock of Harry doing something so stupid, but Black didn't raise the wands in time -- one of Harry's hands fastened over his (Harry) wasted wrist, forcing the wand tips away; the knuckles of Harry's other hand collided with the side of Black's head and they fell, backward, into the wall -

Hermione was screaming; Ron was yelling; there was a blinding flash as the wands in Black's hand sent a jet of sparks into the air that missed Harry's face by inches; Harry felt the shrunken arm under his (Harry) fingers twisting madly, but he (Harry) clung on, his (Harry) other hand punching every part of Black it could find.

But Black's free hand had found Harry's throat

``No,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
he (Harry) hissed,
``I've waited too long --'' (he)

The fingers tightened, Harry choked, his (Harry) glasses askew.

Then he (Harry) saw Hermione's foot swing out of nowhere. Black let go of Harry with a grunt of pain; Ron had thrown himself on Black's wand hand and Harry heard a faint clatter --

He (Harry) fought free of the tangle of bodies and saw his (Harry) own wand rolling across the floor; he (Harry) threw himself toward it but

``Argh!'' (he)

Crookshanks had joined the fray; both sets of front claws had sunk themselves deep into Harry's arm; Harry threw him (Harry) off, but Crookshanks now darted toward Harry's wand --

``NO YOU DON'T!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
roared Harry, and he (Harry) aimed a kick at Crookshanks that made the cat leap aside, spitting; Harry snatched up his (Harry) wand and turned -

``Get out of the way!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
he (Harry) shouted at Ron and Hermione.

They didn't need telling twice. Hermione, gasping for breath, her (Hermione) lip bleeding, scrambled aside, snatching up her (Hermione) and Ron's wands. Ron crawled to the four-poster and collapsed onto it, panting, his (Ron) white face now tinged with green, both hands clutching his (Ron) broken leg.

Black was sprawled at the bottom of the wall. His (Black) thin chest rose and fell rapidly as he (Black) watched Harry walking slowly nearer, his (Harry) wand pointing straight at Black's heart.

``Going to kill me, Harry?'' (he)
he (Harry) whispered.

Harry stopped right above him (Harry), his (Harry) wand still pointing at Black's chest, looking down at him (Harry). A livid bruise was rising around Black's left eye and his (Black) nose was bleeding.

``You killed my parents,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, his (Harry) voice shaking slightly, but his (Harry) wand hand quite steady.

Black stared up at him (Black) out of those sunken eyes.

``I don't deny it,'' (he)
he (Black) said very quietly.
``But if you knew the whole story.'' (unknown)

``The whole story?'' (Harry)
Harry repeated, a furious pounding in his (Harry) ears.
``You sold them to Voldemort. That's all I need to know.'' (unknown)

``You've got to listen to me,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
Black said, and there was a note of urgency in his (Black) voice now.
``You'll regret it if you don't... You don't understand...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``I understand a lot better than you think,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, and his (Harry) voice shook more than ever.
``You never heard her (I), did you? My mum... trying to stop Voldemort killing me... and you did that... you did it...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Before either of them could say another word, something ginger streaked past Harry; Crookshanks leapt onto Black's chest and settled himself there, right over Black's heart. Black blinked and looked down at the cat.

``Get off,'' (he)
he (Black) murmured, trying to push Crookshanks off him (Black).

But Crookshanks sank his (Black) claws into Black's robes and wouldn't shift. He (Black) turned his (Black) ugly, squashed face to Harry and looked up at him (Harry) with those great yellow eyes. To his (Harry) right, Hermione gave a dry sob.

Harry stared down at Black and Crookshanks, his (Harry) grip tightening on the wand. So what if he (Harry) had to kill the cat too? It was in league with Black... If it was prepared to die, trying to protect Black, that wasn't Harry's business... If Black wanted to save it, that only proved he (Black) cared more for Crookshanks than for Harry's parents...

Harry raised the wand. Now was the moment to do it. Now was the moment to avenge his (Harry) mother and father. He (Harry) was going to kill Black. He (Black) had to kill Black. This was his (Black) chance...

The seconds lengthened. And still Harry stood frozen there, wand poised, Black staring up at him (Black), Crookshanks on his (Black) chest. Ron's ragged breathing came from near the bed; Hermione was quite silent.

And then came a new sound -

Muffled footsteps were echoing up through the floor -- someone was moving downstairs.

``WE'RE UP HERE!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione screamed suddenly.
``WE'RE UP HERE -- SIRIUS BLACK - QUICK!'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)

Black made a startled movement that almost dislodged Crookshanks; Harry gripped his (Harry) wand convulsively -- Do it now! said a voice in his (Harry) head -- but the footsteps were thundering up the stairs and Harry still hadn't done it.

The door of the room burst open in a shower of red sparks and Harry wheeled around as Professor Lupin came hurtling into the room, his (Harry) face bloodless, his (Harry) wand raised and ready. His (Harry) eyes flickered over Ron, lying on the floor, over Hermione, cowering next to the door, to Harry, standing there with his (Harry) wand covering Black, and then to Black himself, crumpled and bleeding at Harry's feet.

``Expelliarmus!'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
Lupin shouted.

Harry's wand flew once more out of his (Harry) hand; so did the two Hermione was holding. Lupin caught them all deftly, then moved into the room, staring at Black, who still had Crookshanks lying Protectively across his (Black) chest.

Harry stood there, feeling suddenly empty. He (Harry) hadn't done it. His (Harry) nerve had failed him (Harry). Black was going to be handed back to the dementors.

Then Lupin spoke, in a very tense voice.

``Where is he (SIRIUS), Sirius?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry looked quickly at Lupin. He (Harry) didn't understannd what Lupin meant. Who was Lupin talking about? He (Harry) turned to look at Black again.

Black's face was quite expressionless. For a few seconds, he (Black) didn't move at all. Then, very slowly, he (Black) raised his (Black) empty hand and pointed straight at Ron. Mystified, Harry glanced around at Ron, who looked bewildered.

``But then...'' (Lupin)
Lupin muttered, staring at Black so intently it seemed he (Black) was trying to read his (Black) mind,
''... why hasn't he (Black) shown himself before now? Unless'' (he)
-- Lupin's eyes suddenly widened, as though he (Black) was seeing something beyond Black, something none of the rest could see,
''-- unless he (Black) was the one... unless you switched... without telling me?'' (Black something)

Very slowly, his (Black) sunken gaze never leaving Lupin's face, Black nodded.

``Professor,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry interrupted loudly,
``what's going on --?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

But he (Black) never finished the question, because what he (Black) saw made his (Black) voice die in his (Black) throat. Lupin was lowering his (Black) wand, gazing fixed at Black. The Professor walked to Black's side, seized his (Black) hand, pulled him (Black) to his (Black) feet so that Crookshanks fell to the floor, and embraced Black like a brother.

Harry felt as though the bottom had dropped out of his (Harry) stomach.

``DON'T BELIEVE IT!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione screamed.

Lupin let go of Black and turned to her (Hermione). She (Hermione) had raised herself off the floor and was pointing at Lupin, wild-eyed.

``You -- you --'' (unknown)

``Hermione --'' (unknown)

''-- you and him (Black)!'' (unknown)

``Hermione, calm down --'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

``I didn't tell anyone!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione shrieked.
``I've been covering up for you --'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

``Hermione, listen to me, please''' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
Lupin shouted.
``I can explain --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry could feel himself shaking, not with fear, but with a fresh wave of fury.

``I trusted you,'' (he)
he (Harry) shouted at Lupin, his (Harry) voice wavering, out of control,
``and all the time you've been his (Professor) friend!'' (Lupin)

``You're wrong,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``I haven't been Sirius's friend, but I am now -- Let me explain...'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

``NO!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione screamed.
``Harry, don't trust him (Harry), he (Harry)'s been helping Black get into the castle, he (Harry) wants you dead too -- he (Harry)'s a werewolf!'' (unknown)

There was a ringing silence. Everyone's eyes were now on Lupin, who looked remarkably calm, though rather pale.

``Not at all up to your usual standard, Hermione,'' (he)
he (Harry) said. ``Only one out of three, I'm afraid. I have not been helping Sirius get into the castle and I certainly don't want Harry dead. An odd shiver passed over his (Harry) face.
``But I won't deny that I am a werewolf.'' (Ron)

Ron made a valiant effort to get up again but fell back with a whimper of pain. Lupin made toward him (Ron), looking concerned, but Ron gasped,

``Get away ftom me, werewolf!'' (Ron)

Lupin stopped dead. Then, with an obvious effort, he (Ron) turned to Hermione and said,

``How long have you known?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

``Ages,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whispered.
``Since I did Professor Snape's essay...'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

``He (Professor)'ll be delighted,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin coolly.
``He (Professor) assigned that essay hoping someone would realize what my symptoms meant... Did you check the lunar chart and realize that I was always ill at the full moon? Or did you realize that the boggart changed into the moon when it saw me?'' (unknown)

``Both,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione said quietly.

Lupin forced a laugh.

``You're the cleverest witch of your age I've ever met, Hermione.'' (unknown)

``I'm not,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whispered.
``If I'd been a bit cleverer, I'd have told everyone what you are!'' (unknown)

``But they already know,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``At least, the staff do.'' (unknown)

``Dumbledore hired you when he (Dumbledore) knew you were a werewolf. Ron gasped.

``Is he (Ron) mad?'' (unknown)

``Some of the staff thought so,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``He (Ron) had to work very hard to convince certain teachers that I'm trustworthy --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``AND HE (Ron) WAS WRONG!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry yelled.
``YOUVE BEEN HELPING HIM ALL THE TIME!'' (He)
He (Harry) was pointing at Black, who suddenly crossed to the four-poster bed and sank onto it, his (Harry) face hidden in one shaking hand. Crookshanks leapt up beside him (Harry) and stepped onto his (Harry) lap, purring. Ron edged away from both of them, dragging his (Ron) leg.

I have not been helping Sirius,'' said Lupin.

``If you'll give me a chance, I'll explain. Look --'' (He)

He (Sirius) separated Harry's, Ron's and Hermione's wands and threw each back to its owner; Harry caught his (Harry), stunned.

There, said Lupin, sticking his (Harry) own wand back into his (Harry) belt

``You're armed, we're not. Now will you listen?'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

Harry didn't know what to think. Was it a trick?

``If you haven't been helping him (Ron),'' (he)
he (Harry) said, with a furious glance at Black,
``how did you know he (Ron) was here?'' (Black)

``The map,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``The Marauder's Map. I was in my office examining it --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``You know how to work it?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry said suspiciously.

``Of course I know how to work it,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, waving his (Harry) hand impatiently.
``I helped write it. I'm Moony -- that was my friends' nickname for me at school.'' (unknown)

``You wrote --?'' (unknown)

``The important thing is, I was watching it carefully this evening, because I had an idea that you, Ron, and Hermione might try and sneak out of the castle to visit Hagrid before his (Ron) hippogriff was executed. And I was right, wasn't I'' (He)

He (Harry) had started to pace up and down, looking at them. Little patches of dust rose at his (Harry) feet.

``You might have been wearing your father's old cloak, Harry--'' (unknown)

``How d'you know about the cloak?'' (unknown)

``The number of times I saw James disappearing under it...,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, waving an impatient hand again.
``The point is, even if you're wearing an Invisibility Cloak, you still show up on the Marauder's Map. I watched you cross the grounds and enter Hagrid's hut. Twenty minutes later, you left Hagrid, and set off back toward the castle. But you were now accompanied by somebody else.'' (unknown)

``What?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.
``No, we weren't!'' (I)

I couldn't believe my eyes,'' said Lupin, still pacing, and ignoring Harry's interruption. ``I thought the map must be malfunctioning. How could he (James) be with you?''

``No one was with us!'' (unknown)
said Harry.

``And then I saw another dot, moving fast toward you, labeled Sirius Black... I saw him (Black) collide with you; I watched as he (Black) pulled two of you into the Whomping Willow --'' (Ron)

``One of us!'' (Ron)
Ron said angrily.

``No, Ron,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``Two of you.'' (He)

He (Harry) had stopped his (Harry) pacing, his (Harry) eyes moving over Ron.

``Do you think I could have a look at the rat?'' (he)
he (Ron) said evenly.

``What?'' (Ron)
said Ron.
``What's Scabbers got to do with it?'' (unknown)

``Everything,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``Could I see him (Ron), please?'' (Ron)

Ron hesitated, then put a hand inside his (Ron) robes. Scabbers emerged, thrashing desperately; Ron had to seize his (Ron) long bald tail to stop him (Ron) escaping. Crookshanks stood up on Black's leg and made a soft hissing noise.

Lupin moved closer to Ron. He (Ron) seemed to be holding his (Ron) breath as he (Ron) gazed intently at Scabbers.

``What?'' (Ron)
Ron said again, holding Scabbers close to him (Ron), looking scared.
``What's my rat got to do with anything?'' (unknown)

``That's not a rat,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
croaked Sirius Black suddenly.

``What d'you mean -- of course he (Ron)'s a rat --'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

``No, he (Ron)'s not,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin quietly.
``He (Ron)'s a wizard.'' (unknown)

``An Animagus,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black,
``by the name of Peter Pettigrew.'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)

CHAPTER EIGHTEEN

MOONY, WORMTAIL, PADDFOOT, AND PRONGS

It took a few seconds for the absurdity of this statement to sink in. Then Ron voiced what Harry was thinking.

``You're both mental.'' (unknown)

``Ridiculous!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione faintly.

``Peter Pettigrew's dead!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.
``He (Pettigrew) killed him (Pettigrew) twelve years ago!'' (He)
He (Harry) pointed at Black, whose face twitched convulsively.

``I meant to,'' (he)
he (Harry) growled, his (Harry) yellow teeth bared,
``but little Peter got the better of me... not this time, though!'' (he)

And Crookshanks was thrown to the floor as Black lunged at Scabbers; Ron yelled with pain as Black's weight fell on his (Ron) broken leg.

.

``Sirius, NO!'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
Lupin yelled, launching himself forwards and dragging Black away from Ron again,
``WAIT! You can't do it just like that -- they need to understand -- we've got to explain --'' (Ron)

``We can explain afterwards!'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
snarled Black, trying to throw Lupin off. One hand was still clawing the air as it tried to reach Scabbers, who was squealing like a piglet, scratching Ron's face and neck as he (Ron) tried to escape.

``They've -- got -- a -- right -- to -- know -- -everything!'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
Lupin panted, still trying to restrain Black.
``Ron's kept him (Ron) as a pet! There are parts of it even I don't understand, and Harry -- you owe Harry the truth, Sirius!'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)

Black stopped struggling, though his (Black) hollowed eyes were still fixed on Scabbers, who was clamped tightly under Ron's bitten, scratched, ad bleeding hands.

``All right, then,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
Black said, without taking his (Black) eyes off the rat.

``Tell them whatever you like. But make it quick, Remus. I want to commit the murder I was imprisoned for...'' (Ron)

``You're nutters, both of you,'' (Ron)
said Ron shakily, looking round at Harry and Hermione for support.
``I've had enough of this. I'm off.'' (He)

He (Ron) tried to heave himself up on his (Ron) good leg, but Lupin raised his (Ron) wand again, pointing it at Scabbers.

``You're going to hear me out, Ron,'' (he)
he (Ron) said quietly.
``Just keep a tight hold on Peter while you listen.'' (unknown)

``HE (Ron)'S NOT PETER, HE (Ron)

``S SCABBERS!'' (unknown)
Ron yelled, trying to fore the rat back into his (Ron) front pocket, but Scabbers was fighting to hard; Ron swayed and overbalanced, and Harry caught him (Harry) am pushed him (Harry) back down to the bed. Then, ignoring Black, Harry turned to Lupin.

There were witnesses who saw Pettigrew die,'' he (Pettigrew) said.

``A whole street full of them...'' (unknown)

``They didn't see what they thought they saw!'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black savagely, still watching Scabbers struggling in Ron's hands.

``Everyone thought Sirius killed Peter,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, nodding.
``I believed it myself -- until I saw the map tonight. Because the Marauder's map never lies... Peter's alive. Ron's holding him (Ron), Harry.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry looked down at Ron, and as their eyes met, they agreed, silently: Black and Lupin were both out of their minds. Their story made no sense whatsoever. How could Scabbers be Peter Pettigrew? Azkaban must have unhinged Black after all -- but why was Lupin playing along with him (Pettigrew)?

Then Hermione spoke, in a trembling, would-be calm sort of voice, as though trying to will Professor Lupin to talk sensibly.

``But Professor Lupin... Scabbers can't be Pettigrew... it just can't be true, you know it can't...'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

``Why can't it be true?'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
Lupin said calmly, as though they were in class, and Hermione had simply spotted a problem in an experiment with grindylows.

``Because... because people would know if Peter Pettigrew had been an Animagus. We did Animagi in class with Professor McGonagall. And I looked them up when I did my homework -- the Ministry of Magic keeps tabs on witches and wizards who can become animals; there's a register showing what animal they become, and their markings and things... and I went and looked Professor McGonagall up on the register, and there have been only seven Animagi this century, and Pettigrew's name wasn't on the list.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry had barely had time to marvel inwardly at the effort Hermione put into her (Hermione) homework, when Lupin started to laugh.

``Light again, Hermione!'' (he)
he (Harry) said.
``But the Ministry never knew that here used to be three unregistered Animagi running around Hogwarts.'' (unknown)

``I you're going to tell them the story, get a move on, Remus,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black, who was still watching Scabbers's every desperate move.
``I've waited twelve years, I'm not going to wait much longer.'' (unknown)

``All right... but you'll need to help me, Sirius,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, I only know how it began...''

Lupin broke off. There had been a loud creak behind him (Black). The bedroom door had opened of its own accord. All five of them stared at it. Then Lupin strode toward it and looked out into the landing.

``No one there...'' (unknown)

``This place is haunted!'' (Ron)
said Ron.

``It's not,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, still looking at the door in a puzzled way.
``The Shrieking Shack was never haunted... The screams and howls the villagers used to hear were made by me.'' (He)

He (Ron) pushed his (Ron) graying hair out of his (Ron) eyes, thought for a moment then said,

``That's where all of this starts -- with my becoming a werewolf, None of this could have happened if I hadn't been bitter... and if I hadn't been so foolhardy...'' (He)

He (Ron) looked sober and tired. Ron started to interrupt, but Hermione, said,

``Shh!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
She (Hermione) was watching Lupin very intently.

``I as a very small boy when I received the bite. My parents tried everything, but in those days there was no cure. The potion that Professor Snape has been making for me is a very recent discovery. It makes me safe, you see. As long as I take it in the week, preceding the full moon, I keep my mind when I transform... I'm able to curl up in my office, a harmless wolf, and wait for the moon to wane again.

``Before the Wolfsbane Potion was discovered, however, I became a fully fledged monster once a month. It seemed impossible that I would be able to come to Hogwarts. Other parents weren't likely to want their children exposed to me.

``But then Dumbledore became Headmaster, and he (Dumbledore) was sympathetic. He (Dumbledore) said that as long as we took certain precautions, there was no reason I shouldn't come to school...'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
Lupin sighed, and looked directly at Harry.
``I told you, months ago, that the Whomping Willow was planted the year I came to Hogwarts. The truth is that it was planted because I came to Hogwarts. This house'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
-- Lupin looked miserably around the room, --
``the tunnel that leads to it -- they were built for my use. Once a month, I was smuggled out of the castle, into this place, to transform. The tree was placed at the tunnel mouth to stop anyone coming across me while I was dangerous.'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

Harry couldn't see where this story was going, but he (Harry) was listening raptly all the same. The only sound apart from Lupin's voice was Scabbers's frightened squeaking.

``My transformations in those days were -- were terrible. It is very painful to turn into a werewolf. I was separated from humans to bite, so I bit and scratched myself instead. The villagers heard the noise and the screaming and thought they were hearing particularly violent spirits. Dumbledore encouraged the rumor... Even now, when the house has been silent for years, the villagers don't dare approach it...'' (unknown)

``But apart from my transformations, I was happier than I had ever been in my life. For the first time ever, I had friends, three great friends. Sirius Black... Peter Pettigrew... and, of course, your father, Harry -- James Potter.'' (unknown)

``Now, my three friends could hardly fail to notice that I disappeared once a month. I made up all sorts of stories. I told them my mother was ill, and that I had to go home to see her (mother)... I was terrified they would desert me the moment they found out what I was. But of course, they, like you, Hermione, worked out the truth...'' (unknown)

``And they didn't desert me at all. Instead, they did something for me that would make my transformations not only bearable, but the best times of my life. They became Animagi.'' (unknown)

``My dad too?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, astounded.

``Yes, indeed,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``It took them the best part of three years to work out how to do it. Your father and Sirius here were the cleverest students in the school, and lucky they were, because the Animagus transformation can go horribly wrong -- one reason the Ministry keeps a close watch on those attempting to do it. Peter needed all the help he (Peter) could get from James and Sirius. Finally, in our fifth year, they managed it. They could each turn into a different animal at will.'' (unknown)

``But how did that help you?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione, sounding puzzled.

``They couldn't keep me company as humans, so they kept me company as animals,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``A werewolf is only a danger to people. They sneaked out of the castle every month under James's Invisibility Cloak. They transformed... Peter, as the smallest, could slip beneath the Willow's attacking branches and touch the knot that freezes it. They would then slip down the tunnel and join me. Under their influence, I became less dangerous. My body was still wolfish, but my mind seemed to become less so while I was with them.'' (unknown)

``Hurry up, Remus,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
snarled Black, who was still watching Scabbers with a horrible sort of hunger on his (Black) face.

``I'm getting there, Sirius, I'm getting there... well, highly exciting possibilities were open to us now that we could all transform. Soon we were leaving the Shrieking Shack and roaming the school grounds and the village by night. Sirius and James transformed into such large animals, they were able to keep a werewolf in check. I doubt whether any Hogwarts students ever found out more about the Hogwarts grounds and Hogsmeade than we did... And that's how we came to write the Marauder's Map, and sign it with our nicknames. Sirius is Padfoot. Peter is Wormtail. James was Prongs.'' (unknown)

``What sort of animal --?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry began, but Hermione cut him (Harry) off.

``That was still really dangerous! Running around in the dark with a werewolf! What if you'd given the others the slip, and bitten somebody?'' (unknown)

``A thought that still haunts me,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin heavily.
``And there were near misses, many of them. We laughed about them afterwards. We were young, thoughtless -- carried away with our own cleverness.'' (I)

I sometimes felt guilty about betraying Dumbledore's trust, of course... he (Dumbledore) had admitted me to Hogwarts when no other headmaster would have done so, and he (headmaster) had no idea I was breaking the rules he (headmaster) had set down for my own and others' safety. He (headmaster) never knew I had led three fellow students into becoming Animagi illegally. But I always managed to forget my guilty feelings every time we sat down to plan our next month's adventure. And I haven't changed...''

Lupin's face had hardened, and there was self-disgust in his (headmaster) voice.

``All this year, I have been battling with myself, wondering whether I should tell Dumbledore that Sirius was an Animagus. But I didn't do it. Why? Because I was too cowardly. It would have meant admitting that I'd betrayed his (Sirius) trust while I was at school, admitting that I'd led others along with me... and Dumbledore's trust has meant everything to me.
