He (Dumbledore) let me into Hogwarts as a boy, and he (Hogwarts) gave me a job when I have been shunned all my adult life, unable to find paid work because of what I am. And so I convinced myself that Sirius was getting into the school using dark arts he (Sirius) learned from Voldemort, that being an Animagus had nothing to do with it... so, in a way, Snape's been right about me all along.'' (unknown)

``Snape?'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black harshly, taking his (headmaster) eyes off Scabbers; for the first time in minutes and looking up at Lupin.
``What's Snape got to do with it?'' (unknown)

``He (Snape)'s here, Sirius,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin heavily.
``He (Sirius)'s teaching here as well.'' (He)
He (headmaster) looked up at Harry, Ron, and Hermione.

``Professor Snape was at school with us. He (Snape) fought very hard against my appointment to the Defense Against the Dark Arts job. He (Snape) has been telling Dumbledore A year that I am not to be trusted. He (Dumbledore) has his (Dumbledore) reasons... you see, Sirius here played a trick on him (Sirius) which nearly killed him (Sirius), a trick which involved me --'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)

Black made a derisive noise.

``It served him (Sirius) right,'' (he)
he (Black) sneered.
``Sneaking around, trying to find out what we were up to... hoping he (Sirius) could get us expelled...'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

``Severus was very interested in where I went every month.'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
Lupin told Harry, Ron, and Hermione.
``We were in the same year, you know, and we -- er -- didn't like each other very much. He (Severus) especially disliked James. Jealous, I think, of James's talent on the Quidditch field... anyway Snape had seen me crossing the grounds with Madam Pomfrey one evening as she (Pomfrey) led me toward the Whomping Willow to transform. Sirius thought it would be -- er -- amusing, to tell Snape all he (Snape) had to do was prod the knot on the tree trunk with a long stick, and he (Snape)'d be able to get in after me. Well, of course, Snape tried it -- if he (Snape)'d got as far as this house, he (Snape)'d have met a fully grown werewolf -- but your father, who'd heard what Sirius had done, went after Snape and pulled him (Snape) back, at great risk to his (Snape) life... Snape glimpsed me, though, at the end of the tunnel. He (Snape) was forbidden by Dumbledore to tell anybody, but from that time on he (Snape) knew what I was...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``So that's why Snape doesn't like you,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry slowly,
``because he (Snape) thought you were in on the joke?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``That's right,'' (Lupin)
sneered a cold voice from the wall behind Lupin.

Severus Snape was pulling off the Invisibility Cloak, his (Snape) wand pointing, directly at Lupin.

CHAPTER NINETEEN

THE SERVANT OF LORD VOLDEMORT

Hermione screamed. Black leapt to his (Snape) feet. Harry felt as though he (Harry)'d received a huge electric shock.

``I found this at the base of the Whomping Willow,'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)
said Snape, throwing the cloak aside, careful to keep this wand pointing directly at Lupin's chest.
``Very useful, Potter, I thank you...'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)

Snape was slightly breathless, but his (Snape) face was full of suppressed triumph.

``You're wondering, perhaps, how I knew you were here?'' (he)
he (Snape) said, his (Snape) eyes glittering.
``I've just been to your office, Lupin. You forgot to take your potion tonight, so I took a gobletful along. And very lucky I did... lucky for me, I mean. Lying on your desk was a certain map. One glance at it told me all I needed to know. I saw you running along this passageway and out of sight.'' (unknown)

``Severus --'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
Lupin began, but Snape overrode him (Snape).

``I've told the headmaster again and again that you're helping your old friend Black into the castle, Lupin, and here's the proof. Not even I dreamed you would have the nerve to use this old place as your hideout --'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

``Severus, you're making a mistake,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin urgently.
``You haven't heard everything -- I can explain -- Sirius is not here to kill Harry --'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)

``Two more for Azkaban tonight,'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)
said Snape, his (Snape) eyes now gleaming fanatically.
``I shall be interested to see how Dumbledore takes this... He (Dumbledore) was quite convinced you were harmless, you know, Lupin... a tame werewolf --'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

``You fool,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin softly.
``Is a schoolboy grudge worth putting an innocent man back inside Azkaban?'' (unknown)

BANG! Thin, snakelike cords burst from the end of Snape's wand and twisted themselves around Lupin's mouth, wrists, and ankles; he (Snape) overbalanced and fell to the floor, unable to move. With a roar of rage, Black started toward Snape, but Snape pointed his (Snape) wand straight between Black's eyes.

``Give me a reason,'' (he)
he (Snape) whispered.
``Give me a reason to do it, and I swear I will.'' (unknown)

Black stopped dead. It would have been impossible to say which face showed more hatred.

Harry stood there, paralyzed, not knowing what to do or whom to believe. He (Harry) glanced around at Ron and Hermione. Ron looked just as confused as he (Ron) did, still fighting to keep hold on the struggling Scabbers. Hermione, however, took an uncertain step toward Snape and said, in a very breathless voice,

``Professor Snape -- it it wouldn't hurt to hear what they've got to say, w -- would it?'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)

``Miss Granger, you are already facing suspension from this school,'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)
Snape spat.
``You, Potter, and Weasley are out-of-bounds, in the company of a convicted murderer and a werewolf. For once in your life, hold your tongue.'' (unknown)

``But if -- if there was a mistake --'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)

``KEEP QUIET, YOU STUPID GIRL!'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)
Snape shouted, looking suddenly quite deranged. ``DON'T TALK ABOUT WHAT YOU DON
``T UNDERSTAND!'' (unknown)
A few sparks shot out of the end of his (Snape) wand, which was still pointed at Black's face. Hermione fell silent.

``Vengeance is very sweet,'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)
Snape breathed at Black.
``How I hoped I would be the one to catch you...'' (Black)

``The joke's on you again, Severus,'' (Black)
Black snarled.
``As long as this boy brings his (boy) rat up to the castle'' (he)
-- he (Black) jerked his (Black) head at Ron --
``I'll come quietly...'' (Ron)

``Up to the castle?'' (Ron)
said Snape silkily.
``I don't think we need to go that far. All I have to do is call the dementors once we get out of the Willow. They'll be very pleased to see you, Black... pleased enough to give you a little kiss, I daresay... I --'' (Blacks)

What little color there was in Blacks face left it.

``You -you've got to hear me out,'' (he)
he (Snape) croaked.
``The rat -- look at the rat --'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)

But there was a mad glint in Snape's eyes that Harry had never seen before. He (Snape) seemed beyond reason.

``Come on, all of you,'' (he)
he (Snape) said. He (Snape) clicked his (Snape) fingers, and the ends of the cords that bound Lupin flew to his (Snape) hands.
``I'll drag the werewolf. Perhaps the dementors will have a kiss for him (Black) too --'' (he)

Before he (Snape) knew what he (Snape) was doing, Harry had crossed the room in three strides and blocked the door.

``Get out of the way, Potter, you're in enough trouble already,'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)
snarled Snape.
``If I hadn't been here to save your skin --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Professor Lupin could have killed me about a hundred times this year,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry said.
``I've been alone with him (Professor) loads of times, having defense lessons against the dementors. If he (Professor) was helping Black, why didn't he (Black) just finish me off then?'' (unknown)

``Don't ask me to fathom the way a werewolf's mind works,'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)
hissed Snape.
``Get out of the way, Potter.'' (unknown)

``YOURE PATHETIC!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry yelled. ``JUST BECAUSE THEY MADE A FOOL OF YOU AT SCHOOL YOU WON
``T EVEN LISTEN --'' (unknown)

``SILENCE! I WILL NOT BE SPOKEN TO LIKE THAT!'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)
Snape shrieked, looking madder than ever.
``Like father, like son, Potter! I have just saved your neck; you should be thanking me on bended knee! You would have been well served if he (Potter)'d killed you! You'd have died like your father, too arrogant to believe you might be mistaken in Black -- now get out of the way, or I will make you. GET OUT OF THE WAY, POTTER!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry made up his (Harry) mind in a split second. Before Snape could take even one step toward him (Snape), he (Snape) had raised his (Snape) wand.

``Expelliarmus!'' (he)
he (Snape) yelled -- except that his (Snape) wasn't the only voice that shouted. There was a blast that made the door rattle on its hinges; Snape was lifted off his (Snape) feet and slammed into the wall, then slid down it to the floor, a trickle of blood oozing from under his (Snape) hair. He (Snape) had been knocked out.

Harry looked around. Both Ron and Hermione had tried to disarm Snape at exactly the same moment. Snape's wand soared in a high arc and landed on the bed next to Crookshanks.

``You shouldn't have done that,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black, looking at Harry.

``You should have left him (POTTER) to me...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry avoided Black's eyes. He (Harry) wasn't sure, even now, that he (Harry)'d done the right thing.

``We attacked a teacher... We attacked a teacher...'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whimpered, staring at the lifeless Snape with frightened eyes.
``Oh, we're going to be in so much trouble --'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

Lupin was struggling against his (Snape) bonds. Black bent down quickly and untied him (Snape). Lupin straightened up, rubbing his (Snape) arms where the ropes had cut into them.

``Thank you, Harry,'' (he)
he (Snape) said.

``I'm still not saying I believe you,'' (he)
he (Snape) told Lupin.

``Then it's time we offered you some proof,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``You, boy -- give me Peter, please. Now.'' (Ron)

Ron clutched Scabbers closer to his (Ron) chest.

``Come off it,'' (he)
he (Ron) said weakly.
``Are you trying to say he (Peter) broke out of Azkaban just to get his (Peter) hands on Scabbers? I mean...'' (He)
He (Ron) looked up at Harry and Hermione for support,
``Okay, say Pettigrew could turn into a rat -- there are millions of rats -- how's he (Pettigrew) supposed to know which one he (Pettigrew)'s after if he (Pettigrew) was locked up in Azkaban?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

``You know, Sirius, that's a fair question,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, turning to Black and frowning slightly.
``How did you find out where he (Sirius) was?'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)

Black put one of his (Black) clawlike hands inside his (Black) robes and took out a crumpled piece of paper, which he (Black) smoothed flat and held out to show the others.

It was the photograph of Ron and his (Ron) family that had appeared in the Daily Prophet the previous summer, and there, on Ron's shoulder, was Scabbers.

``How did you get this?'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
Lupin asked Black, thunderstruck.

``Fudge,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black. ``When he (Sirius) came to inspect Azkaban last year, he (Sirius) gave me his (Sirius) paper. And there was Peter, on the front page on this boy's shoulder... I knew him (Peter) at once... how many times had I seen him (Peter) transform? And the caption said the boy would be going back to Hogwarts... to where Harry was...

``My God,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin softly, staring from Scabbers to the picture in the paper and back again.
``His (Harry) front paw...'' (unknown)

``What about it?'' (Ron)
said Ron defiantly.

``He (Harry)'s got a toe missing,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black.

``Of course,'' (Lupin)
Lupin breathed.
``So simple... so brilliant... he (Harry) cut it off himself?'' (unknown)

``Just before he (Harry) transformed,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black.
``When I cornered him (Harry), he (Harry) yelled for the whole street to hear that I'd betrayed Lily and James. Then, before I could curse him (James), he (James) blew apart the street with the wand behind his (James) back, killed everyone within twenty feet of himself -- and sped down into the sewer with the other rats...'' (unknown)

``Didn't you ever hear, Ron?'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``The biggest bit of Peter they found was his (Peter) finger.'' (unknown)

``Look, Scabbers probably had a fight with another rat or something! He (Peter)'s been in my family for ages, right --'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

``Twelve years, in fact,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``Didn't you ever wonder why he (Peter) was living so long?'' (unknown)

``We -- we've been taking good care of him (Peter)!'' (Ron)
said Ron.

``Not looking too good at the moment, though, is he (Peter)?'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``I'd guess he (Peter)'s been losing weight ever since he (Peter) heard Sirius was on the loose again...'' (unknown)

``He (Sirius)'s been scared of that mad cat!'' (Ron)
said Ron, nodding toward Crookshanks, who was still purring on the bed.

But that wasn't right, Harry thought suddenly... Scabbers had been looking ill before he (Harry) met Crookshanks... ever since Ron's return from Egypt... since the time when Black had escaped...

``This cat isn't mad,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black hoarsely. He (Black) reached out a bony hand and stroked Crookshanks's fluffy head. ``He (Sirius)'s the most intelligent of his (Sirius) kind I've ever met. He (Sirius) recognized Peter for what he (Sirius) was right away. And when he (Sirius) met me, he (Sirius) knew I was no dog. It was a while before he (Sirius) trusted me... Finally, I managed to communicate to him (Sirius) what I was after, and he (Sirius)'s been helping me. ..
``What do you mean?'' (unknown)
breathed Hermione.

``He (Sirius) tried to bring Peter to me, but couldn't... so he (Peter) stole the passwords into Gryffindor Tower for me... As I understand it, he (Peter) took them from a boy's bedside table...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry's brain seemed to be sagging under the weight of what he (Harry) was hearing. It was absurd... and yet...

``But Peter got wind of what was going on and ran for it.'' (Black)
croaked Black.
``This cat -- Crookshanks, did you call him (Peter)? -- told me Peter had left blood on the sheets... I supposed he (Peter) bit himself... Well, faking his (Peter) own death had worked once.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

These words jolted Harry to his (Harry) senses.

``And why did he (Peter) fake his (Peter) death?'' (he)
he (Harry) said furiously.
``Because he (Peter) knew you were about to kill him (Peter) like you killed my parents!'' (unknown)

``No,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin,
``Harry-'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

``And now you've come to finish him (Harry) off!'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

``Yes, I have,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black, with an evil look at Scabbers.

``Then I should've let Snape take you!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry shouted.

``Harry,'' (Lupin)
said Lupin hurriedly,
``don't you see? All this time we've thought Sirius betrayed your parents, and Peter tracked him (Peter) down -- but it was the other way around, don't you see? Peter betrayed your mother and father -- Sirius tracked Peter down --'' (Lupin)

``THAT'S NOT TRUE!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry yelled.
``HE (Peter) WAS THEIR SECRET-KEEPER! HE (Peter) SAID SO BEFORE YOU TURNED UP. HE (Peter) SAID HE (Peter) KILLED THEM!'' (He)

He (Harry) was pointing at Black, who shook his (Harry) head slowly; the sunken eyes were suddenly over bright.

``Harry... I as good as killed them,'' (he)
he (Harry) croaked.
``I persuaded Lily and James to change to Peter at the last moment, persuaded them to use him (Peter) as Secret-Keeper instead of me... I'm to blame, I know it... The night they died, I'd arranged to check on Peter, make sure he (Peter) was still safe, but when I arrived at his (Peter) hiding place, he (Peter)'d gone. Yet there was no sign of a struggle. It didn't feel right. I was scared. I set out for your parents' house straight away. And when I saw their house, destroyed, and their bodies... I realized what Peter must've done... what I'd done...'' (He)

His (Harry) voice broke. He (Harry) turned away.

``Enough of this,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, and there was a steely note in his (Harry) voice Harry had never heard before.
``There's one certain way to prove what really happened. Ron, give me that rat.'' (unknown)

``What are you going to do with him (Ron) if I give him (Ron) to you?'' (Ron)
Ron asked Lupin tensely.

``Force him (Ron) to show himself,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``If he (Ron) really is a rat, it won't hurt him (Ron).'' (Ron)

Ron hesitated. Then at long last, he (Ron) held out Scabbers and Lupin took him (Ron). Scabbers began to squeak without stopping, twisting and turning, his (Ron) tiny black eyes bulging in his (Ron) head.

``Ready, Sirius?'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.

Black had already retrieved Snape's wand from the bed. He (Black) approached Lupin and the struggling rat, and his (Black) wet eyes suddenly seemed to be burning in his (Black) face.

``Together?'' (he)
he (Black) said quietly.

``I think so,,, said Lupin, holding Scabbers tightly in one hand and his (Ron) wand in the other.

``On the count of three. One -- two -- THREE!'' (unknown)

A flash of blue-white light erupted from both wands; for a moment, Scabbers was frozen in midair, his (Black) small gray form twisting madly -- Ron yelled -- the rat fell and hit the floor. There was another blinding flash of light and then --

It was like watching a speeded-up film of a growing tree. A head was shooting upward from the ground; limbs were sprouting; a moment later, a man was standing where Scabbers had been, cringing and wringing his (man) hands. Crookshanks was spitting and snarling on the bed; the hair on his (man) back was standing up.

He (man) was a very short man, hardly taller than Harry and Hermione. His (Harry) thin, colorless hair was unkempt and there was a large bald patch on top. He (Harry) had the shrunken appearance of a plump man who has lost a lot of weight in a short time. His (Harry) skin looked grubby, almost like Scabbers's fur, and something of the rat lingered around his (Harry) pointed nose and his (Harry) very small, watery eyes. He (Harry) looked around at them all, his (Harry) breathing fast and shallow. Harry saw his (Harry) eyes dart to the door and back again.

``Well, hello, Peter,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin pleasantly, as though rats frequently erupted into old school friends around him (Harry). ``Long time, no see.

``S -- Sirius... R -- Remus...'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
Even Pettigrew's voice was squeaky. Again, his (Pettigrew) eyes darted toward the door.
``My friends... my old friends...'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)

Black's wand arm rose, but Lupin seized him (Black) around the wrist, gave him (Black) a warning took, then turned again to Pettigrew, his (Pettigrew) voice light and casual.

``We've been having a little chat, Peter, about what happened the night Lily and James died. You might have missed the finer points while you were squeaking around down there on the bed --'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)

``Remus,'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
gasped Pettigrew, and Harry could see beads of sweat breaking out over his (Pettigrew) pasty face,
``you don't believe him (Remus), do you...? He (Remus) tried to kill me, Remus...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``So we've heard,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, more coldly.
``I'd like to clear up one or two little matters with you, Peter, if you'll be so --'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)

``He (Peter)'s come to try and kill me again!'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
Pettigrew squeaked suddenly, pointing at Black, and Harry saw that he (Harry) used his (Harry) middle finger, because his (Harry) index was missing.
``He (Peter) killed Lily and James and now he (Peter)'s going to kill me too... You've got to help me, Remus...'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)

Black's face looked more skull-like than ever as he (Harry) stared at Pettigrew with his (Pettigrew) fathomless eyes.

``No one's going to try and kill you until we've sorted a few things out,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.

``Sorted things out?'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
squealed Pettigrew, looking wildly about him (Pettigrew) once more, eyes taking in the boarded windows and, again' the only door.
``I knew he (Remus)'d come after me! I knew he (Remus)'d be back for me! I've been waiting for this for twelve years!'' (unknown)

``You knew Sirius was going to break out of Azkaban?'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, his (Pettigrew) brow furrowed.
``When nobody has ever done it before?'' (unknown)

``He (Sirius)'s got dark powers the rest of us can only dream of!'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
Pettigrew shouted shrilly.
``How else did he (Sirius) get out of there? I suppose He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named taught him (Sirius) a few tricks!'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)

Black started to laugh, a horrible, mirthless laugh that filled the whole room.

``Voldemort, teach me tricks?'' (he)
he (Pettigrew) said.

Pettigrew flinched as though Black had brandished a whip at him (Pettigrew).

``What, scared to hear your old master's name?'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black. I don't blame you, Peter. His (Black) lot aren't very happy with you, are they?''

``Don't know what you mean, Sirius --'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
muttered Pettigrew, his (Pettigrew) breathing faster than ever. His (Pettigrew) whole face was shining with sweat now.

``You haven't been hiding from me for twelve years,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black.
``You've been hiding from Voldemort's old supporters. I heard things in Azkaban, Peter... They all think you're dead, or you'd have to answer to them... I've heard them screaming all sorts of things in their sleep. Sounds like they think the double-crosser double-crossed them. Voldemort went to the Potters' on your information... and Voldemort met his (Voldemort) downfall there. And not all Voldemort's supporters ended up in Azkaban, did they? There are still plenty out here, biding their time, pretending they've seen the error of their ways.

If they ever got wind that you were still alive, Peter --'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)

``Don't know... what you're talking about...,'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
said Pettigrew again, more shrilly than ever. He (Pettigrew) wiped his (Pettigrew) face on his (Pettigrew) sleeve and looked up at Lupin.
``You don't believe this -- this madness, Remus --'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

``I must admit, Peter, I have difficulty in understanding why an innocent man would want to spend twelve years as a rat,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin evenly.

``Innocent, but scared!'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
squealed Pettigrew.
``If Voldemort's supporters were after me, it was because I put one of their best men in Azkaban -- the spy, Sirius Black!'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)

Black's face contorted.

``How dare you,'' (he)
he (Black) growled, sounding suddenly like the bearsized dog he (Black) had been. I, a spy for Voldemort? When did I ever sneak around people who were stronger and more powerful than myself? But you, Peter -- I'll never understand why I didn't see you were the spy from the start. You always liked big friends who'd look after you, didn't you? It used to be us... me and Remus... and James...

Pettigrew wiped his (Pettigrew) face again; he (Pettigrew) was almost panting for breath.

``Me, a spy... must be out of your mind... never... don't know how you can say such a --'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)

``Lily and James only made you Secret-Keeper because I suggested it,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
Black hissed, so venomously that Pettigrew took a step backward.
``I thought it was the perfect plan... a bluff... Voldemort would be sure to come after me, would never dream they'd use a weak, talentless thing like you... It must have been the finest moment of your miserable life, telling Voldemort you could hand him (Voldemort) the Potters.'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)

Pettigrew was muttering distractedly; Harry caught words like

``far-fetched'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
and
``lunacy,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
but he (Pettigrew) couldn't help paying more attention to the ashen color of Pettigrew's face and the way his (Pettigrew) eyes continued to dart toward the windows and door.

``Professor Lupin?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione timidly.
``Can -- can I say something?'' (unknown)

``Certainly, Hermione,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin courteously.

``Well -- Scabbers -- I mean, this -- this man -- he (man)'s been sleeping in Harry's dormitory for three years. If he (man)'s working for You-Know-Who, how come he (man) never tried to hurt Harry before now?'' (unknown)

``There!'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
said Pettigrew shrilly, pointing at Ron with his (Pettigrew) maimed hand.
``Thank you! You see, Remus? I have never hurt a hair of Harry's head! Why should I?'' (unknown)

``I'll tell you why,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black.
``Because you never did anything for anyone unless you could see what was in it for you. Voldemort's been in hiding for fifteen years, they say he (Voldemort)'s half dead. You weren't about to commit murder right under Albus Dumbledore's nose, for a wreck of a wizard who'd lost all of his (wizard) power, were you? You'd want to be quite sure he (wizard) was the biggest bully in the playground before you went back to him (wizard), wouldn't you? Why else did you find a wizard family to take you in? Keeping an ear out for news, weren't YOU, Peter? Just in case your old protector regained strength, and it was safe to rejoin him (Peter)...'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)

Pettigrew opened his (Pettigrew) mouth and closed it several times. He (Pettigrew) seemed to have lost the ability to talk.

``Er -- Mr. Black -- Sirius?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione.

Black jumped at being addressed like this and stared at Hermione as though he (Pettigrew) had never seen anything quite like her (Hermione).

``If you don't mind me asking, how -- how did you get out of Azkaban, if you didn't use Dark Magic?'' (unknown)

``Thank you!'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
gasped Pettigrew, nodding frantically at her (Hermione).
``Exactly! Precisely what I --'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

But Lupin silenced him (Pettigrew) with a look. Black was frowning slightly at Hermione, but not as though he (Black) were annoyed with her (Hermione). He (Black) seemed to be pondering his (Black) answer.

``I don't know how I did it,'' (he)
he (Black) said slowly.
``I think the only reason I never lost my mind is that I knew I was innocent. That wasn't a happy thought, so the dementors couldn't suck it out of me... but it kept me sane and knowing who I am... helped me keep my powers... so when it all became ... too much... I could transform in my cell... become a dog. Dementors can't see, you know...'' (He)
He (Black) swallowed.
``They feel their way toward people by feeding off their emotions... They could tell that my feelings were less -- less human, less complex when I was a dog... but they thought, of course, that I was losing my mind like everyone else in there, so it didn't trouble them. But I was weak, very weak, and I had no hope of driving them away from me without a wand...'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)

``But then I saw Peter in that picture... I realized he (Peter) was at Hogwarts with Harry... perfectly positioned to act, if one hint reached his (Harry) ears that the Dark Side was gathering strength again...'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)

Pettigrew was shaking his (Pettigrew) head, mouthing noiselessly, but staring all the while at Black as though hypnotized.

''... ready to strike at the moment he (Pettigrew) could be sure of allies... and to deliver the last Potter to them. if he (Potter) gave them Harry, who'd dare say he (Potter)'d betrayed Lord Voldemort? He (Potter)'d be welcomed back with honors...

``So you see, I had to do something. I was the only one who knew Peter was still alive...'' (Harry)

Harry remembered what Mr. Weasley had told Mrs. Wealsey. ``The guards say he (Peter)'s been talking in his (Peter) sleep... always the same words...

``He (Peter)'s at Hogwarts.''' (unknown)

``It was as if someone had lit a fire In my head, and the dementors couldn't destroy it... It wasn't a happy feeling... it was an obsession... but it gave me strength, it cleared my mind. So, one night when they opened my door to bring food, I slipped past them as a dog... It's so much harder for them to sense animal emotions that they were confused... I was thin, very thin... thin enough to slip through the bars... I swam as a dog back to the mainland... I journeyed north and slipped into the Hogwarts grounds as a dog. I've been living in the forest ever since, except when I came to watch the Quidditch, of course. You fly as well as your father did, Harry...'' (He)

He (Weasley) looked at Harry, who did not look away.

``Believe me,'' (Black)
croaked Black.
``Believe me, Harry. I never betrayed James and Lily. I would have died before I betrayed them.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

And at long last, Harry believed him (Harry). Throat too tight to speak, he (Harry) nodded.

``No!'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)

Pettigrew had fallen to his (Pettigrew) knees as though Harry's nod had been his (Pettigrew) own death sentence. He (Pettigrew) shuffled forward on his (Pettigrew) knees, groveling, his (Pettigrew) hands clasped in front of him (Pettigrew) as though praying.

``Sirius -- it's me... it's Peter... your friend... you wouldn't --'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)

Black kicked out and Pettigrew recoiled.

``There's enough filth on my robes without you touching them,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black.

``Remus!'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
Pettigrew squeaked, turning to Lupin instead, writhing imploringly in front of him (Pettigrew).
``You don't believe this wouldn't Sirius have told you they'd changed the plan?'' (unknown)

``Not if he (Remus) thought I was the spy, Peter,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``I assume that's why you didn't tell me, Sirius?'' (he)
he (Pettigrew) said casually over Pettigrews head.

``Forgive me, Remus,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black.

``Not at all, Padfoot, old friend,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, who was now rolling up his (Black) sleeves.
``And will you, in turn, forgive me for believing you were the spy?'' (unknown)

``Of course,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black, and the ghost of a grin flitted across his (Black) gaunt face. He (Black), too, began rolling up his (Black) sleeves.
``Shall we kill him (spy) together?'' (unknown)

``Yes, I think so,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin grimly.

``You wouldn't... you won't...,'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
gasped Pettigrew. And he (Pettigrew) scrambled around to Ron.

``Ron... haven't I been a good friend... a good pet? You won't let them kill me, Ron, will you... you're on my side, aren't you.

But Ron was staring at Pettigrew with the utmost revulsion.

``I let you sleep in my bed!'' (he)
he (Pettigrew) said.

``Kind boy... kind master...'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
Pettigrew crawled toward Ron
``You won't let them do it... I was your rat... I was a good pet...'' (Ron)

``If you made a better rat than a human, it's not much to boast about, Peter,'' (Ron)
said Black harshly. Ron, going still paler with pain, wrenched his (Ron) broken leg out of Pettigrew's reach. Pettigrew turned on his (Pettigrew) knees, staggered forward, and seized the hem of Hermione's robes.

``Sweet girl... clever girl... you -- you won't let them... Help me...'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Hermione pulled her (Hermione) robes out of Pettigrew's clutching hands and backed away against the wall, looking horrified.

Pettigrew knelt, trembling uncontrollably, and-turned his (Pettigrew) head slowly toward Harry.

``Harry... Harry... you look just like your father... just like him (Harry)...'' (unknown)

``HOW DARE YOU SPEAK TO HARRY?'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
roared Black.
``HOW DARE YOU FACE HIM? HOW DARE YOU TALK ABOUT JAMES IN FRONT OF HIM?'' (unknown)

``Harry,'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
whispered Pettigrew, shuffling toward him (Pettigrew), hands outstretched.
``Harry, James wouldn't have wanted me killed... James would have understood, Harry... he (Harry) would have shown me mercy...'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

Both Black and Lupin strode forward, seized Pettigrew's shoulders, and threw him (Pettigrew) backward onto the floor. He (Pettigrew) sat there, twitching with terror, staring up at them.

``You sold Lily and James to Voldemort,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black, who was shaking too.
``Do you deny it?'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)

Pettigrew burst into tears. It was horrible to watch, like an oversized, balding baby, cowering on the floor.

``Sirius, Sirius, what could I have done? The Dark Lord... you have no idea... he (Lord) has weapons you can't imagine... I was scared, Sirius, I was never brave like you and Remus and James. I never meant it to happen... He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named forced me --'' (unknown)

``DON'T LIE!'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
bellowed Black.
``YOU'D BEEN PASSING INFORMATION TO HIM FOR A YEAR BEFORE LILY AND JAMES DIED! YOU WERE HIS (James) SPY!'' (unknown)

``He (James) -- he (James) was taking over everywhere!'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
gasped Pettigrew.
``Wh -- what was there to be gained by refusing him (James)?'' (unknown)

``What was there to be gained by fighting the most evil wizard who has ever existed?'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black, with a terrible fury in his (Black) face.
``Only innocent lives, Peter!'' (unknown)

``You don't understand!'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
whined Pettigrew.
``He (Peter) would have killed me, Sirius!'' (unknown)

``THEN YOU SHOULD HAVE DIED!'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
roared Black.
``DIED RATHER THAN BETRAY YOUR FRIENDS, AS WE WOULD HAVE DONE FOR YOU!'' (Black Lupin)

Black and Lupin stood shoulder to shoulder, wands raised.

``You should have realized,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin quietly,
``if Voldemort didn't kill you, we would. Good-bye, Peter.'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

Hermione covered her (Hermione) face with her (Hermione) hands and turned to the wall.

``NO!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry yelled. He (Harry) ran forward, placing himself in front Pettigrew, facing the wands.
``You can't kill him (Peter),'' (he)
he (Pettigrew) said breathlessly.
``You can't.'' (Lupin)

Black and Lupin both looked staggered.

``Harry, this piece of vermin is the reason you have no parents,'' (Black)
Black snarled.
``This cringing bit of filth would have seen you die too, without turning a hair. You heard him (Harry). His (Harry) own stinking skin meant more to him (Harry) than your whole family.'' (unknown)

``I know,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry panted.
``We'll take him (Harry) up to the castle. We'll hand him (Harry) over to the dementors... He (Harry) can go to Azkaban... but don't kill him (Harry).'' (unknown)

``Harry!'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)
gasped Pettigrew, and he (Black) flung his (Black) arms around Harry's knees.
``You -- thank you -- it's more than I deserve -- thank you --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Get off me,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry spat, throwing Pettigrew's hands off him (Pettigrew) in disgust.
``I'm not doing this for you. I'm doing it because -- I don't reckon my dad would've wanted them to become killers -- just for you.'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)

No one moved or made a sound except Pettigrew, whose breath was coming in wheezes as he (Pettigrew) clutched his (Pettigrew) chest. Black and Lupin were looking at each other. Then, with one movement, they lowered their wands.

``You're the only person who has the right to decide, Harry,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black.
``But think... think what he (Harry) did...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``He (Harry) can go to Azkaban,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry repeated.
``If anyone deserves that place, he (Harry) does...'' (Pettigrew/Peter/Peter Pettigrew)

Pettigrew was still wheezing behind him (Pettigrew).

``Very well,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``Stand aside, Harry.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry hesitated.

``I'm going to tie him (Harry) up,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.
``That's all, I swear.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry stepped out of the way. Thin cords shot from Lupin's wand this time, and next moment, Pettigrew was wriggling on the floor, bound and gagged.

``But if you transform, Peter,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
growled Black, his (Black) own wand pointing at Pettigrew too,
``we will kill you. You agree, Harry?'' (Pettigrew)

Harry looked down at the pitiful figure on the floor and nodded so that Pettigrew could see him (Pettigrew).

``Right,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, suddenly businesslike.
``Ron, I can't mend bones nearly as well as Madam Pomfrey, so I think it's best if we just strap your leg up until we can get you to the hospital wing.'' (He)

He (Pettigrew) hurried over to Ron, bent down, tapped Ron's leg with his (Ron) wand, and muttered,

``Ferula.'' (Ron)
Bandages spun up Ron's leg, strapping it tightly to a splint. Lupin helped him (Ron) to his (Ron) feet; Ron put his (Ron) weight gingerly on the leg and didn't wince.

``That's better,'' (he)
he (Ron) said.
``Thanks.'' (unknown)

``What about Professor Snape?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione in a small voice, looking down at Snape's prone figure.

``There's nothing seriously wrong with him (Snape),'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, bending over Snape and checking his (Snape) pulse.
``You were just a little -- overenthusiastic. Still out cold. Er -- perhaps it will be best if we don't revive him (Snape) until we're safety back in the castle. We can take him (Snape) like this...'' (He)

He (Snape) muttered,

``Mobilicorpus.'' (He)
As though invisible strings were tied to Snape's wrists, neck, and knees, he (Snape) was pulled into a standing position, head still lolling unpleasantly, like a grotesque puppet. He (Snape) hung a few inches above the ground, his (Snape) limp feet dangling. Lupin picked up the Invisibility Cloak and tucked it safely into his (Snape) pocket.

``And two of us should be chained to this,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black, nudging Pettigrew with his (Black) toe.
``Just to make sure.'' (unknown)

``I'll do it,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin.

``And me,'' (Ron)
said Ron savagely, limping forward.

Black conjured heavy manacles from thin air; soon Pettigrew was upright again, left arm chained to Lupin's right, right arm to Ron's left. Ron's face was set. He (Ron) seemed to have taken Scabbers's true identity as a personal insult. Crookshanks leapt lightly off the bed and led the way out of the room, his (Ron) bottlebrush tail held jauntily high.

CHAPTER TWENTY

THE DEMENTOR``S KISS

Harry had never been part of a stranger group. Crookshanks led the way down the stairs; Lupin, Pettigrew, and Ron went next, looking like entrants in a six-legged race. Next came Professor Snape, drifting creepily along, his (Snape) toes hitting each stair as they descended, held up by his (Snape) own wand, which was being pointed at him (Snape) by Sirius. Harry and Hermione brought up the rear.

Getting back into the tunnel was difficult. Lupin, Pettigrew, and Ron had to turn sideways to manage it; Lupin still had Pettigrew covered with his (Pettigrew) wand. Harry could see them edging awkwardly along the tunnel in single file. Crookshanks was still in the lead. Harry went right after Black, who was still making Snape drift along ahead of them; he (Harry) kept bumping his (Harry) lolling head on the low ceiling. Harry had the impression Black was making no effort to prevent this.

``You know what this means?'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
Black said abruptly to Harry as they made their slow progress along the tunnel.
``Turning Pettigrew in?'' (unknown)

``You' re free,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.

``Yes...,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black.
``But I'm also -- I don't know if anyone ever told you -- I'm your godfather.'' (unknown)

``Yeah, I knew that,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.

``Well... your parents appointed me your guardian,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black stiffly.
``If anything happened to them...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry waited. Did Black mean what he (Black) thought he (Black) meant?

``I'll understand, of course, if you want to stay with your aunt and uncle,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black.
``But... well... think about it. Once my name's cleared... if you wanted a... a different home...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Some sort of explosion took place in the pit of Harry's stomach.

``What -- live with you?'' (he)
he (Harry) said, accidentally cracking his (Harry) head on a bit of rock protruding from the ceiling.
``Leave the Dursleys?'' (unknown)

``Of course, I thought you wouldn't want to,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black quickly.
``I understand, I just thought I'd --'' (unknown)

``Are you insane?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, his (Harry) voice easily as croaky as Black's.

``Of course I want to leave the Dursleys! Have you got a house? When can I move in?'' (him)

Black turned right around to look at him (Black); Snape's head was scraping the ceiling but Black didn't seem to care.

``You want to?'' (he)
he (Black) said.
``You mean it?'' (unknown)

``Yeah, I mean it!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.

Black's gaunt face broke into the first true smile Harry had seen upon it. The difference it made was startling, as though a person ten years younger were shining through the starved mask; for a moment, he (Harry) was recognizable as the man who had laughed at Harry's parents' wedding.

They did not speak again until they had reached the end of the tunnel. Crookshanks darted up first; he (Harry) had evidently pressed his (Harry) paw to the knot on the trunk, because Lupin, Pettigrew, and Ron clambered upward without any sound of savaging branches.

Black saw Snape up through the hole, then stood back for Harry and Hermione to pass. At last, all of them were out.

The grounds were very dark now; the only light came from the distant windows of the castle. Without a word, they set off. Pettigrew was still wheezing and occasionally whimpering. Harry's mind was buzzing. He (Harry) was going to leave the Dursleys. He (Harry) was going to live with Sirius Black, his (Black) parents' best friend... He (Black) felt dazed... What would happen when he (Black) told the Dursleys he (Black) was going to live with the convict they'd seen on television... !

``One wrong move, Peter,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin threateningly ahead. His (Black) wand was still pointed sideways at Pettigrew's chest.

Silently they tramped through the grounds, the castle lights growing slowly larger. Snape was still drifting weirdly ahead of Black, his (Black) chin bumping on his (Black) chest. And then -

A cloud shifted. There were suddenly dim shadows on the ground. Their party was bathed in moonlight.

Snape collided with Lupin, Pettigrew, and Ron, who had stopped abruptly. Black froze. He (Snape) flung out one arm to make Harry and Hermione stop.

Harry could see Lupin's silhouette. He (Harry) had gone rigid. Then his (Harry) limbs began to shake.

``Oh, my --'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione gasped.
``He (Peter) didn't take his (Peter) potion tonight! He (Peter)'s not safe!'' (unknown)

``Run,'' (Black)
Black whispered.
``Run. Now.'' (Harry)

But Harry couldn't run. Ron was chained to Pettigrew and Lupin. He (Harry) leapt forward but Black caught him (Black) around the chest and threw him (Black) back.

``Leave it to me -- RUN!'' (unknown)

There was a terrible snarling noise. Lupin's head was lengthening. So was his (Black) body. His (Black) shoulders were hunching. Hair was sprouting visibly on his (Black) face and hands, which were curling into clawed paws. Crookshanks's hair was on end again; he (Black) was backing away --

As the werewolf reared, snapping its long jaws, Sirius disappeared from Harry's side. He (Harry) had transformed. The enormous, bearlike dog bounded forward. As the werewolf wrenched itself free of the manacle binding it, the dog seized it about the neck and pulled it backward, away from Ron and Pettigrew. They were locked, jaw to jaw, claws ripping at each other.

Harry stood, transfixed by the sight, too intent upon the battle to notice anything else. It was Hermione's scream that alerted him (Harry) --

Pettigrew had dived for Lupin's dropped wand. Ron, unsteady on his (Ron) bandaged leg, fell. There was a bang, a burst of light -- and Ron lay motionless on the ground. Another bang -- Crookshanks flew into the air and back to the earth in a heap.

``Expelliarmus.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry yelled, pointing his (Harry) own wand at Pettigrew; Lupin's wand flew high into the air and out of sight.
``Stay where you are!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry shouted, running forward.

Too late. Pettigrew had transformed. Harry saw his (Harry) bald tail whip through the manacle on Ron's outstretched arm and heard a scurrying through the grass.

There was a howl and a rumbling growl; Harry turned to see the werewolf taking flight; it was galloping into the forest --

``Sirius, he (Peter)'s gone, Pettigrew transformed!'' (the werewolf)
Harry yelled.

Black was bleeding; there were gashes across his (Harry) muzzle and back, but at Harry's words he (Harry) scrambled up again, and in an instant, the sound of his (Harry) paws faded to silence as he (Harry) pounded away across the grounds.

Harry and Hermione dashed over to Ron.

``What did he (Pettigrew) do to him (Pettigrew)?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whispered. Ron's eyes were only half-closed, his (Harry) mouth hung open; he (Harry) was definitely alive, they could hear him (Harry) breathing, but he (Harry) didn't seem to recognize them.

``I don't know...'' (Harry)

Harry looked desperately around. Black and Lupin both gone... they had no one but Snape for company, still hanging, unconscious, in midair.

``We'd better get them up to the castle and tell someone,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, pushing his (Harry) hair out of his (Harry) eyes, trying to think straight.
``Come --'' (a dog)

But then, from beyond the range of their vision, they heard a yelping, a whining: a dog in pain...

``Sirius,'' (a dog)
Harry muttered, staring into the darkness.

He (Harry) had a moment's indecision, but there was nothing they could do for Ron at the moment, and by the sound of it, Black was in trouble --

Harry set off at a run, Hermione right behind him (Harry). The yelping seemed to be coming from the ground near the edge of the lake. They pelted toward it, and Harry, running flat out, felt the cold without realizing what it must mean -

The yelping stopped abruptly. As they reached the lakeshore, they saw why -- Sirius had turned back into a man. He (Sirius) was crouched on all fours, his (Sirius) hands over his (Sirius) head.

`Nooo,'' he (Sirius) moaned.

``Nooo... please...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

And then Harry saw them. Dementors, at least a hundred of them, gliding in a black mass around the lake toward them. He (Harry) spun around, the familiar, icy cold penetrating his (Harry) insides, fog starting to obscure his (Harry) vision; more were appearing out of the darkness on every side; they were encircling them...

``Herrnione, think of something happy!'' (He)
Harry yelled, raising his (Harry) wand, blinking furiously to try and clear his (Harry) vision, shaking his (Harry) head to rid it of the faint screaming that had started inside it --

I'm going to live with my godfather. I'm leaving the Dursleys.

He (godfather) forced himself to think of Black, and only Black, and began to chant:

``Expecto patronum! Expecto patronum!'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)

Black gave a shudder, rolled over, and lay motionless on the ground, pale as death.

He (Black)'ll be all right. I'm going to go and live with him (Black).

``Expecto patronum! Hermione, help me! Expecto patronum!'' (unknown)

``Expecto --'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whispered,
``expecto -- expecto --'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

But she (Hermione) couldn't do it. The dementors were closing in, barely ten feet from them. They formed a solid wall around Harry and Hermione, and were getting closer...

``EXPECTO PATRONUM!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Harry yelled, trying to blot the screaming from his (Harry) ears.
``EXPECTO PATRONUM!'' (him)

A thin wisp of silver escaped his (Harry) wand and hovered like mist before him (Harry). At the same moment, Harry felt Hermione collapse next to him (Harry). He (Harry) was alone... completely alone...

``Expecto -- expecto patronum --'' (He)

Harry felt his (Harry) knees hit the cold grass. Fog was clouding his (Harry) eyes. With a huge effort, he (Harry) fought to remember -- Sirius was innocent -- innocent -- We'll be okay -- I' mgoing to live with him (Sirius) --

``Ex ecto patronum!'' (him)
he (Sirius) gasped.

By the feeble light of his (Sirius) formless Patronus, He (Sirius) saw a dementor halt, very close to him (Sirius). It couldn't walk through the cloud of silver mist Harry had conjured. A dead, slimy hand slid out from under the cloak. It made a gesture as though to sweep the Patronus aside.

``No -- no --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry gasped.
``He (Hermione)'s innocent... expecto expecto patronum --'' (He)

He (Harry) could feet them watching him (Harry), hear their rattling breath like an evil wind around him (Harry). The nearest dementor seemed to be considering him (Harry). Then it raised both its rotting hands -- and lowered its hood.

Where there should have been eyes, there was only thin, gray scabbed skin, stretched blankly over empty sockets. But there was a mouth... a gaping, shapeless hole, sucking the air with the sound of a death rattle.

A paralyzing terror filled Harry so that he (Harry) couldn't move or speak. His (Harry) Patronus flickered and died.

White fog was blinding him (Harry). He (Harry) had to fight... expecto patronum ... he (Harry) couldn't see... and in the distance, he (Harry) heard the familiar screaming... expecto patronum... he (Harry) groped in the mist for Sirius, and found his (Sirius) arm... they weren't going to take him (Sirius)...

But a pair of strong, clammy hands suddenly attached themselves around Harry's neck. They were forcing his (Harry) face upward... He (Harry) could feel its breath... It was going to get rid of him (Harry) first... He (Harry) could feel its putrid breath... His (Harry) mother was screaming in his (Harry) ears... She (mother) was going to be the last thing he (Harry) ever heard --

And then, through the fog that was drowning him (Harry), he (Harry) thought he (Harry) saw a silvery light growing brighter and brighter... He (Harry) felt himself fall forward onto the grass... Facedown, too weak to move, sick and shaking, Harry opened his (Harry) eyes. The dementor must have released him (Harry). The blinding light was illuminating the grass around him (Harry)... The screaming had stopped, the cold was ebbing away...

Something was driving the dementors back... It was circling around him (Harry) and Black and Hermione... They were leaving...

The air was warm again...

With every ounce of strength he (Harry) could muster, Harry raised his (Harry) head a few inches and saw an animal amid the light, galloping away across the lake... Eyes blurred with sweat, Harry tried to make out what it was... It was as bright as a unicorn... Fighting to stay conscious, Harry watched it canter to a halt as it reached the opposite shore. For a moment, Harry saw, by its brightness, somebody welcoming it back... raising his (Harry) hand to pat it... someone who looked strangely familiar ... but it couldn't be...

Harry didn't understand. He (Harry) couldn't think anymore. He (Harry) felt the last of his (Harry) strength leave him (Harry), and his (Harry) head hit the ground as he (Harry) fainted.

CHAPTER TWENTY-ONE

HERMIONE

``S SECRET

Shocking business... shocking... miracle none of them died... never heard the like... by thunder, it was lucky you were there, Snape...'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

``Thank you, Minister.'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)

``Order of Merlin, Second Class, I'd say. First Class, if I can wangle it!'' (unknown)

``Thank you very much indeed, Minister.'' (unknown)

``Nasty cut you've got there... Black's work, I suppose?'' (unknown)

``As a matter of fact, it was Potter, Weasley, and Granger, Minister...'' (unknown)

``No!'' (unknown)

``Black had bewitched them, I saw it immediately. A Confundus Charm, to judge by their behavior. They seemed to think there was a possibility he (Black) was innocent. They weren't responsible for their actions. On the other hand, their interference might have permitted Black to escape... They obviously thought they were going to catch Black single-handed. They've got away with a great deal before now... I'm afraid it's given them a rather high opinion of themselves... and of course Potter has always been allowed an extraordinary amount of license by the headmaster --'' (unknown)

``Ah, well, Snape... Harry Potter, you know... we've all got a bit of a blind spot where he (Potter)'s concerned.'' (unknown)

``And yet -- is it good for him (Potter) to be given so much special treatment? Personally, I try and treat him (Potter) like any other student. And any other student would be suspended -- at the very least -- for leading his (student) friends into such danger. Consider, Minister -- against all school rules -- after all the precautions put in place for his (Minister) protection -- out-of-bounds, at night, consorting with a werewolf and a murderer -- and I have reason to believe he (murderer) has been visiting Hogsmeade illegally too --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Well, well... we shall see, Snape, we shall see... The boy has undoubtedly been foolish...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry lay listening with his (Harry) eyes tight shut. He (Harry) felt very groggy. The words he (Harry) was hearing seemed to be traveling very slowly from his (Harry) ears to his (Harry) brain, so that it was difficult to understand... His (Harry) limbs felt like lead; his (Harry) eyelids too heavy to lift... He (Harry) wanted to lie here, on this comfortable bed, forever...

``What amazes me most is the behavior of the dementors... you've really no idea what made them retreat, Snape?'' (He)

``No, Minister... by the time I had come `round they were heading back to their positions at the entrances...'' (unknown)

``Extraordinary. And yet Black, and Harry, and the girl --'' (unknown)

``All unconscious by the time I reached them. I bound and gagged Black, naturally, conjured stretchers, and brought them all straight back to the castle.'' (unknown)

There was a pause. Harry's brain seemed to be moving a little faster, and as it did, a gnawing sensation grew in the pit of his (Harry) stomach...

He (Harry) opened his (Harry) eyes.

Everything was slightly blurred. Somebody had removed his (Harry) glasses. He (Harry) was lying in the dark hospital wing. At the very end of the ward, he (Harry) could make out Madam Pomfrey with her (Pomfrey) back to him (Harry), bending over a bed. Harry squinted. Ron's red hair was visible beneath Madam Pomfrey's arm.

Harry moved his (Harry) head over on the pillow. In the bed to his (Harry) right lay Hermione. Moonlight was falling across her (Hermione) bed. Her (Hermione) eyes were open too. She (Hermione) looked petrified, and when she (Hermione) saw that Harry was awake, pressed a finger to her (Hermione) lips, then pointed to the hospital wing door. It was ajar, and the voices of Cornelius Fudge and Snape were coming through it from the corridor outside.

Madam Pomfrey now came walking briskly up the dark ward to Harry's bed. He (Harry) turned to took at her (Pomfrey). She (Pomfrey) was carrying the largest block of chocolate he (Harry) had ever seen in his (Harry) life. It looked like a small boulder.

``Ah, you're awake!'' (she)
she (Pomfrey) said briskly. She (Pomfrey) placed the chocolate on Harry's bedside table and began breaking it apart with a small hammer.

``How's Ron?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry and Hermione together.

``He (Ron)'ll live, said Madam Pomfrey grimly.

``As for you two you'll be staying here until I'm satisfied you're -- Potter, what do you think you're doing?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry was sitting up, putting his (Harry) glasses back on, and picking up his (Harry) wand.

``I need to see the headmaster,'' (he)
he (Harry) said.

``Potter,'' (Madam Pomfrey)
said Madam Pomfrey soothingly,
``it's all right. They've got Black. He (Black)'s locked away upstairs. The dementors will be performing the kiss any moment now --'' (Madam Pomfrey)

``WHAT?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry jumped up out of bed; Hermione had done the same. But his (Harry) shout had been heard in the corridor outside; next second, Cornelius Fudge and Snape had entered the ward.

``Harry, Harry, what's this?'' (Fudge)
said Fudge, looking agitated.
``You should be in bed -- has he (Harry) had any chocolate?'' (he)
he (Fudge) asked Madam Pomfrey anxiously.

``Minister, listen!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry said.
``Sirius Black's innocent! Peter Pettigrew faked his (Pettigrew) own death! We saw him (Pettigrew) tonight! You can't let the dementors do that thing to Sirius, he (Sirius)'s --'' (Fudge)

But Fudge was shaking his (Harry) head with a small smile on his (Harry) face.

``Harry, Harry, you're very confused, you've been through a dreadful ordeal, lie back down, now, we've got everything under control...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``YOU HAVEN'T!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry yelled.
``YOUVE GOT THE WRONG MAN!'' (unknown)

``Minister, listen, please,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione said; she (Hermione) had hurried to Harry's side and was gazing imploringly into Fudge's face.
``I saw him (Minister) too. It was Ron's rat, he (Ron)'s an Animagus, Pettigrew, I mean, and --'' (unknown)

``You see, Minister?'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)
said Snape.
``Confunded, both of them... Black's done a very good job on them...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
``WE'RE NOT CONFUNDED!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry roared.

``Minister! Professor!'' (Madam Pomfrey)
said Madam Pomfrey angrily.
``I must insist that you leave. Potter is my patient, and he (Potter) should not be distressed!'' (unknown)

``I'm not distressed, I'm trying to tell them what happened!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry said furiously.
``If they'd just listen --'' (Madam Pomfrey)

But Madam Pomfrey suddenly stuffed a large chunk of chocolate into Harry's mouth; he (Harry) choked, and she (Pomfrey) seized the opportunity to force him (Harry) back onto the bed.

``Now, please, Minister, these children need care. Please leave

The door opened again. It was Dumbledore. Harry swallowed his (Harry) mouthful of chocolate with great difficulty and got up again.

``Professor Dumbledore, Sirius Black --'' (unknown)

``For heaven's sake!'' (Madam Pomfrey)
said Madam Pomfrey hysterically.
``Is this a hospital wing or not? Headmaster, I must insist --'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)

``My apologies, Poppy, but I need a word with Mr. Potter and Miss Granger,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore calmly.
``I have just been talking to Sirius Black --'' (unknown)

``I suppose he (Black)'s told you the same fairy tale he (Black)'s planted in Potter's mind?'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)
spat Snape.
``Something about a rat, and Pettigrew being alive --'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)

``That, indeed, is Black's story,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore, surveying Snape closely through his (Dumbledore) half-moon spectacles.

``And does my evidence count for nothing?'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)
snarled Snape.
``Peter Pettigrew was not in the Shrieking Shack, nor did I see any sign of him (Pettigrew) on the grounds.'' (unknown)

``That was because you were knocked out, Professor!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione earnestly. ``You didn't arrive in time to hear

``Miss Granger, HOLD YOUR TONGUE!'' (unknown)

``Now, Snape,'' (Fudge)
said Fudge, startled,
``the young lady is disturbed in her (lady) mind, we must make allowances --'' (Fudge)

``I would like to speak to Harry and Hermione alone,'' (Fudge)
said Dumbledore abruptly.
``Cornelius, Severus, Poppy -- please leave us.'' (unknown)

``Headmaster!'' (unknown)
sputtered Madam Pomfrey.
``They need treatment, they need rest --'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)

``This cannot wait,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore.
``I must insist.'' (Madam Pomfrey)

Madam Pomfrey pursed her (Pomfrey) lips and strode away into her (Pomfrey) office at the end of the ward, slamming the door behind her (Pomfrey). Fudge consulted the large gold pocket watch dangling from his (Dumbledore) waistcoat.

``The dementors should have arrived by now,'' (he)
he (Dumbledore) said.
``I'll go and meet them. Dumbledore, I'll see you upstairs.'' (He)

He (Dumbledore) crossed to the door and held it open for Snape, but Snape hadn't moved.

``You surely don't believe a word of Black's story?'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)
Snape whispered, his (Snape) eyes fixed on Dumbledore's face.

``I wish to speak to Harry and Hermione alone,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
Dumbledore repeated.

Snape took a step toward Dumbledore.

``Sirius Black showed he (Black) was capable of murder at the age of sixteen,'' (he)
he (Dumbledore) breathed.
``You haven't forgotten that, Headmaster? You haven't forgotten that he (Headmaster) once tried to kill me?'' (unknown)

``My memory is as good as it ever was, Severus,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore quietly.

Snape turned on his (Dumbledore) heel and marched through the door Fudge was still holding. It closed behind them, and Dumbledore turned to Harry and Hermione. They both burst into speech at the same time.

``Professor, Black's telling the truth -- we saw Pettigrew '' (he)
-- he (Dumbledore) escaped when Professor Lupin turned into a werewolf --''

''-- he (Dumbledore)'s a rat --'' (a werewolf)

''-- Pettigrew's front paw, I mean, finger, he (Pettigrew) cut it off --'' (a werewolf)

''-- Pettigrew attacked Ron, it wasn't Sirius --'' (a werewolf)

But Dumbledore held up his (Dumbledore) hand to stem the flood of explanations.

``It is your turn to listen, and I beg you will not interrupt me, because there is very little time,'' (he)
he (Dumbledore) said quietly.
``There is not a shred of proof to support Black's story, except your word -- and the word of two thirteen-year-old wizards will not convince anybody. A street full of eyewitnesses swore they saw Sirius murder Pettigrew. I myself gave evidence to the Ministry that Sirius had been the Potters' Secret-Keeper.'' (unknown)

``Professor Lupin can tell you --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry said, unable to stop himself

``Professor Lupin is currently deep in the forest, unable to tell anyone anything. By the time he (Professor) is human again, it will be too late, Sirius will be worse than dead. I might add that werewolves are so mistrusted by most of our kind that his (Sirius) support will count for very little -- and the fact that he (Sirius) and Sirius are old friends --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``But --'' (unknown)

``Listen to me, Harry. It is too late, you understand me? You must see that Professor Snape's version of events is far more convincing than yours.'' (unknown)

``He (Snape) hates Sirius,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione said desperately.
``All because of some stupid trick Sirius played on him (Sirius) --'' (unknown)

``Sirius has not acted like an innocent man. The attack on the Fat Lady -- entering Gryffindor Tower with a knife -- without Pettigrew, alive or dead, we have no chance of overturning Sirius's sentence.'' (unknown)

``But you believe us.'' (unknown)

``Yes, I do,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore quietly.
``But I have no power to make other men see the truth, or to overrule the Minister of Magic...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry stared up into the grave face and felt as though the ground beneath him (Dumbledore) were falling sharply away. He (Dumbledore) had grown used to the idea that Dumbledore could solve anything. He (Dumbledore) had expected Dumbledore to pull some amazing solution out of the air. But no ... their last hope was gone.

``What we need,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore slowly, and his (Dumbledore) light blue eyes moved from Harry to Hermione,
``is more time.'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

``But --'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione began. And then her (Hermione) eyes became very round.
``OH!'' (unknown)

``Now, pay attention,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore, speaking very low, and very clearly.
``Sirius is locked in Professor Flitwick's office on the seventh floor. Thirteenth window from the right of the West Tower. If all goes well, you will be able to save more than one innocent life tonight. But remember this, both of you: you must not be seen. Miss Granger, you know the law -- you know what is at stake... You -- must -- not -- be -- seen.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry didn't have a clue what was going on. Dumbledore had turned on his (Dumbledore) heel and looked back as he (Dumbledore) reached the door.

``I am going to lock you in. It is --'' (he)
he (Dumbledore) consulted his (Dumbledore) watch,
``five minutes to midnight. Miss Granger, three turns should do it. Good luck.'' (he)

``Good luck?'' (Harry)
Harry repeated as the door closed behind Dumbledore.
``Three turns? What's he (it) talking about? What are we supposed to do?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

But Hermione was fumbling with the neck of her (Hermione) robes, pulling from beneath them a very long, very fine gold chain.

``Harry, come here,'' (she)
she (Hermione) said urgently.
``Quick!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry moved toward her (Hermione), completely bewildered. She (Hermione) was holding the chain out. He (Harry) saw a tiny, sparkling hourglass hanging from it.

``Here --'' (She)

She (Hermione) had thrown the chain around his (Harry) neck too.

``Ready?'' (she)
she (Hermione) said breathlessly.

``What are we doing?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry said, completely lost.

Hermione turned the hourglass over three times.

The dark ward dissolved. Harry had the sensation that he (Harry) was flying very fast, backward. A blur of colors and shapes rushed past him (Harry), his (Harry) ears were pounding, he (Harry) tried to yell but couldn't hear his (Harry) own voice --

And then he (Harry) felt solid ground beneath his (Harry) feet, and everything came into focus again --

He (Harry) was standing next to Hermione in the deserted entrance hall and a stream of golden sunlight was falling across the paved floor from the open front doors. He (Harry) looked wildly around at Hermione, the chain of the hourglass cutting into his (Harry) neck.

``Hermione, what --?'' (unknown)

``In here!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione seized Harry's arm and dragged him (Harry) across the hall to the door of a broom closet; she (Hermione) opened it, pushed him (Harry) inside among the buckets and mops, then slammed the door behind them.

``What -- how -- Hermione, what happened?'' (unknown)

``We've gone back in time,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whispered, lifting the chain off Harry's neck in the darkness.
``Three hours back...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry found his (Harry) own leg and gave it a very hard pinch. It hurt a lot, which seemed to rule out the possibility that he (Harry) was having a very bizarre dream.

``But --'' (unknown)

``Shh! Listen! Someone's coming! I think -- I think it might be us!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione had her (Hermione) ear pressed against the cupboard door.

``Footsteps across the hall... yes, I think it's us going down to Hagrid's!'' (unknown)

``Are you telling me,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry whispered,
``that we're here in this cupboard and we're out there too?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Yes,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione, her (Hermione) ear still glued to the cupboard door.
``I'm sure it's us. It doesn't sound like more than three people... and we're walking slowly because we're under the Invisibility Cloak -- '' (She)

She (Hermione) broke off, still listening intently.

``We've gone down the front steps...'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Hermione sat down on an upturned bucket, looking desperately anxious, but Harry wanted a few questions answered.

``Where did you get that hourglass thing?'' (unknown)

``It's called a Time-Turner,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whispered, ``and I got it from Professor McGonagall on our first day back. I've been using it all year to get to all my lessons. Professor McGonagall made me swear I wouldn't tell anyone. She (us) had to write all sorts of letters to the Ministry of Magic so I could have one. She (us) had to tell them that I was a model student, and that I'd never, ever use it for anything except my studies... I've been turning it back so I could do hours over again, that's how I've been doing several lessons at once, see? But...

``Harry, I don't understand what Dumbledore wants us to do. Why did he (Harry) tell us to go back three hours? How's that going to help Sirius?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry stared at her (Hermione) shadowy face.

``There must be something that happened around now he (Harry) wants us to change,'' (he)
he (Harry) said slowly.
``What happened? We were walking down to Hagrid's three hours ago...'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

``This is three hours ago, and we are walking down to Hagrid's,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione.
``We just heard ourselves leaving...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry frowned; he (Harry) felt as though he (Harry) were screwing up his (Harry) whole brain in concentration.

``Dumbledore just said -- just said we could save more than one innocent life...'' (him)
And then it hit him (Harry).
``Hermione, we're going to save Buckbeak!'' (unknown)

``But -- how will that help Sirius?'' (unknown)

``Dumbledore said -- he (Dumbledore) just told us where the window is -- the window of Flitwick's office! Where they've got Sirius locked up! We've got to fly Buckbeak up to the window and rescue Sirius! Sirius can escape on Buckbeak -- they can escape together!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

From what Harry could see of Hermione's face, she (Hermione) looked terrified.

``If we manage that without being seen, it'll be a miracle!'' (unknown)

``Well, we've got to try, haven't we?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry. He (Harry) stood up and pressed his (Harry) ear against the door.
``Doesn't sound like anyone's there... Come on, let's go.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry pushed open the closet door. The entrance hall was deserted. As quietly and quickly as they could, they darted out of the closet and down the stone steps. The shadows were already lengthening, the tops of the trees in the Forbidden Forest gilded once more with gold.

``If anyone's looking out of the window --'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione squeaked, looking up at the castle behind them.

``We'll run for it,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry determinedly.
``Straight into the forest, all right? We'll have to hide behind a tree or something and keep a lookout --'' (unknown)

``Okay, but we'll go around by the greenhouses!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione breathlessly.
``We need to keep out of sight of Hagrid's front door, or we'll see us! We must be nearly at Hagrid's by now!'' (she)

Still working out what she (Hermione) meant, Harry set off at a sprint, Hermione behind him (Harry). They tore across the vegetable gardens to the greenhouses, paused for a moment behind them, then set off again, fast as they could, skirting around the Whomping Willow, tearing toward the shelter of the forest...

Safe in the shadows of the trees, Harry turned around; seconds later, Hermione arrived beside him (Harry), panting.

``Right,'' (she)
she (Hermione) gasped.
``We need to sneak over to Hagrid's... Keep out of sight, Harry...'' (unknown)

They made their way silently through the trees, keeping to the very edge of the forest. Then, as they glimpsed the front of Hagrid's house, they heard a knock upon his (Harry) door. They moved quickly behind a wide oak trunk and peered out from either side. Hagrid had appeared in his (Harry) doorway, shaking and white, looking around to see who had knocked. And Harry heard his (Harry) own voice.

``It's us. We're wearing the Invisibility Cloak. Let us in and we can take it off.'' (unknown)

``Yeh shouldn've come!'' (Hagrid)
Hagrid whispered. He (Harry) stood back, then shut the door quickly.

``This is the weirdest thing we've ever done,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry said fervently.

``Let's move along a bit,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whispered.
``We need to get nearer to Buckbeak!'' (Hagrid)

They crept through the trees until they saw the nervous hippogriff, tethered to the fence around Hagrid's pumpkin patch.

``Now?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry whispered.

``No!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione.
``If we steal him (Harry) now, those Committee people will think Hagrid set him (Harry) free! We've got to wait until they've seen he (Harry)'s tied outside!'' (unknown)

``That's going to give us about sixty seconds,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry. This was starting to seem impossible.

At that moment, there was a crash of breaking china from inside Hagrid's cabin.

``That's Hagrid breaking the milk jug,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whispered.
``I'm going to find Scabbers in a moment --'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Sure enough, a few minutes later, they heard Hermione's shriek of surprise.

``Hermione,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry suddenly,
``what if we -- we just run in there and grab Pettigrew --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``No!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Hermione in a terrified whisper.
``Don't you understand? We're breaking one of the most important wizarding laws! Nobody's supposed to change time, nobody! You heard Dumbledore, if we're seen --'' (unknown)

``We'd only be seen by ourselves and Hagrid!'' (unknown)

``Harry, what do you think you'd do if you saw yourself bursting into Hagrid's house?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione.

``I'd -- I'd think I'd gone mad,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry,
``or I'd think there was some Dark Magic going on --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Exactly! You wouldn't understand, you might even attack yourself! Don't you see? Professor McGonagall told me what awful things have happened when wizards have meddled with time... Loads of them ended up killing their past or future selves by mistake!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Okay!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry. ``It was just an idea, I just thought

But Hermione nudged him (Professor) and pointed toward the castle. Harry moved his (Harry) head a few inches to get a clear view of the distant front doors. Dumbledore, Fudge, the old Committee member, and Macnair the executioner were coming down the steps.

``We're about to come out!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione breathed.

And sure enough, moments later, Hagrid's back door opened, and Harry saw himself, Ron, and Hermione walking out of it with Hagrid. It was, without a doubt, the strangest sensation of his (Harry) life, standing behind the tree, and watching himself in the pumpkin patch.

``It's Okay, Beaky, it's okay...'' (Hagrid)
Hagrid said to Buckbeak. Then he (Harry) turned to Harry, Ron, and Hermione.
``Go on. Get goin'.'' (unknown)

``Hagrid, we can't --'' (unknown)

``We'll tell them what really happened

``They can't kill him (executioner) --'' (unknown)

``Go! It's bad enough without you lot in trouble an' all!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry watched the Hermione in the pumpkin patch throw the Invisibility Cloak over him (Harry) and Ron.

``Go quick. Don' listen...'' (Hagrid)

There was a knock on Hagrid's front door. The execution party had arrived. Hagrid turned, around and headed back into his (Harry) cabin, leaving the back door ajar. Harry watched the grass flatten in patches all around the cabin and heard three pairs of feet retreating. He (Harry), Ron, and Hermione had gone... but the Harry and Hermione hidden in the trees could now hear what was happening inside the cabin through the back door.

``Where is the beast?'' (Macnair)
came the cold voice of Macnair.

``Out -- outside,'' (Hagrid)
Hagrid croaked.

Harry pulled his (Harry) head out of sight as Macnair's face appeared at Hagrid's window, staring out at Buckbeak. Then they heard Fudge.

``We -- er -- have to read you the official notice of execution, Hagrid. I'll make it quick. And then you and Macnair need to sign it. Macnair, You're supposed to listen too, that's procedure --'' (Macnair)

Macnair's face vanished from the window. It was now or never.

``Wait here,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry whispered to Hermione.
``I'll do it.'' (Fudge)

As Fudge's voice started again, Harry darted out from behind his (Harry) tree, vaulted the fence into the pumpkin patch, and approached Buckbeak.

``It is the decision of the Committee for the Disposal of Dangerous Creatures that the hippogriff Buckbeak, hereafter called the condemned, shall he (Don) executed on the sixth of June at sundown --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Careful not to blink, Harry stared up into Buckbeak's fierce orange eyes once more and bowed. Buckbeak sank to his (Harry) scaly knees and then stood up again. Harry began to fumble with the knot of rope tying Buckbeak to the fence.

''... sentenced to execution by beheading, to be carried out by the Committee's appointed executioner, Walden Macnai...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Come on, Buckbeak,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry murmured,
``come on, we're going to help you. Quietly... quietly...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

''... as witnessed below. Hagrid, you sign here...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry threw all his (Harry) weight onto the rope, but Buckbeak had dug in his (Harry) front feet.

``Well, let's get this over with,'' (the Committee member)
said the reedy voice of the Committee member from inside Hagrid's cabin.
``Hagrid, perhaps it will be better if you stay inside --'' (unknown)

``No, I -- I wan' ter be with him (Don)... I don' wan' him (Don) ter be alone --'' (unknown)

Footsteps echoed from within the cabin.

``Buckbeak, move!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry hissed.

Harry tugged harder on the rope around Buckbeak's neck. The hippogriff began to walk, rustling its wings irritably. They were still ten feet away from the forest, in plain view of Hagrid's back door.

``One moment, please, Macnair,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
came Dumbledore's voice.
