``You need to sign too.'' (unknown)
The footsteps stopped. Harry heaved on the rope. Buckbeak snapped his (Harry) beak and walked a little faster.

Hermione's white face was sticking out from behind a tree.

``Harry, hurry!'' (she)
she (Hermione) mouthed.

Harry could still hear Dumbledore's voice talking from within the cabin. He (Harry) gave the rope another wrench. Buckbeak broke into a grudging trot. They had reached the trees...

``Quick! Quick!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione moaned, darting out from behind her (Hermione) tree, seizing the rope too and adding her (Hermione) weight to make Buckbeak move faster. Harry looked over his (Harry) shoulder; they were now blocked from sight; they couldn't see Hagrid's garden at all.

``Stop!'' (he)
he (Harry) whispered to Hermione. ``They might hear us

Hagrid's back door had opened with a bang. Harry, Hermione, and Buckbeak stood quite still; even the hippogriff seemed to be listening intently.

Silence... then --

``Where is it?'' (the Committee member)
said the reedy voice of the Committee member.
``Where is the beast?'' (unknown)

``It was tied here!'' (the executioner)
said the executioner furiously. I saw it! just here!''

``How extraordinary,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore. There was a note of amusement in his (Dumbledore) voice.

``Beaky!'' (Hagrid)
said Hagrid huskily.

There was a swishing noise, and the thud of an axe. The executioner seemed to have swung it into the fence in anger. And then came the howling, and this time they could hear Hagrid's words through his (executioner) sobs.

``Gone! Gone! Bless his (Harry) little beak, he (Harry)'s gone! Musta pulled himself free! Beaky, yeh clever boy!'' (Buckbeak)

Buckbeak started to strain against the rope, trying to get back to Hagrid. Harry and Hermione tightened their grip and dug their heels into the forest floor to stop him (Harry).

``Someone untied him (Harry)!'' (the executioner)
the executioner was snarling.
``We should search the grounds, the forest.'' (unknown)

``Macnair, if Buckbeak has indeed been stolen, do you really think the thief will have led him (thief) away on foot?'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore, still sounding amused.
``Search the skies, if you will... Hagrid, I could do with a cup of tea. Or a large brandy.'' (unknown)

``O' -- o' course, Professor,'' (Hagrid)
said Hagrid, who sounded weak with happiness.
``Come in, come in...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry and Hermione listened closely. They heard footsteps, the soft cursing of the executioner, the snap of the door, and then silence once more.

``Now what?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
whispered Harry, looking around.

``We'll have to hide in here,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione, who looked very shaken.
``We need to wait until they've gone back to the castle. Then we wait until it's safe to fly Buckbeak up to Sirius's window. He (Sirius) won't be there for another couple of hours... Oh, this is going to be difficult...'' (She)

She (Hermione) looked nervously over her (Hermione) shoulder into the depths of the forest. The sun was setting now.

``We're going to have to move,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, thinking hard.
``We've got to be able to see the Whomping Willow, or we won't know what's going on.'' (unknown)

``Okay,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione, getting a firmer grip on Buckbeak's rope.
``But we've got to keep out of sight, Harry, remember...'' (the Willow)

They moved around the edge of the forest, darkness falling thickly around them, until they were hidden behind a clump of trees through which they could make out the Willow.

``There's Ron!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry suddenly.

A dark figure was sprinting across the lawn and its shout echoed through the still night air.

``Get away from him (Ron) -- get away -- Scabbers, come here --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

And then they saw two more figures materialize out of nowhere. Harry watched himself and Hermione chasing after Ron. Then he (Harry) saw Ron dive.

``Gotcha! Get off, you stinking cat --'' (unknown)

``There's Sirius!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry. The great shape of the dog had bounded out from the roots of the Willow. They saw him (Harry) bowl Harry over, then seize Ron...

``Looks even worse from here, doesn't it?'' (Ron)
said Harry, watching the dog pulling Ron into the roots.
``Ouch -- look, I just got walloped by the tree -- and so did you -- this is weird--'' (The Whomping Willow)

The Whomping Willow was creaking and lashing out with its lower branches; they could see themselves darting here and there, trying to reach the trunk. And then the tree froze.

``That was Crookshanks pressing the knot,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione.

``And there we go...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry muttered.
``We're in.'' (unknown)

The moment they disappeared, the tree began to move again. Seconds later, they heard footsteps quite close by. Dumbledore, Macnair, Fudge, and the old Committee member were making their way up to the castle.

``Right after we'd gone down into the passage!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione.
``If only Dumbledore had come with us...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Macnair and Fudge would've come too,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry bitterly.
``I bet you anything Fudge would've told Macnair to murder Sirius on the spot...'' (the men)

They watched the four men climb the castle steps and disappear from view. For a few minutes the scene was deserted. Then --

``Here comes Lupin!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry as they saw another figure sprinting down the stone steps and hating toward the Willow. Harry looked up at the sky. Clouds were obscuring the moon completely.

They watched Lupin seize a broken branch from the ground and prod the knot on the trunk. The tree stopped fighting, and Lupin, too, disappeared into the gap in its roots.

``If he (Sirius)'d only grabbed the cloak,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.
``It's just lying there...'' (He)

He (Harry) turned to Hermione.

``If I just dashed out now and grabbed it, Snape'd never be able to get it and --'' (unknown)

``Harry, we mustn't be seen!'' (unknown)

``How can you stand this?'' (he)
he (Harry) asked Hermione fiercely.
``Just standing here and watching it happen?'' (He)
He (Harry) hesitated.
``I'm going to grab the cloak!'' (unknown)

``Harry, no!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Hermione seized the back of Harry's robes not a moment too soon. just then, they heard a burst of song. It was Hagrid, making his (Harry) way up to the castle, singing at the top of his (Harry) voice, and weaving slightly as he (Harry) walked. A large bottle was swinging from his (Harry) hands.

``See?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whispered.
``See what would have happened? We've got to keep out of sight! No, Buckbeak!'' (Hagrid)

The hippogriff was making frantic attempts to get to Hagrid again; Harry seized his (Harry) rope too, straining to hold Buckbeak back. They watched Hagrid meander tipsily up to the castle. He (Harry) was gone. Buckbeak stopped fighting to get away. His (Harry) head drooped sadly.

Barely two minutes later, the castle doors flew open yet again, and Snape came charging out of them, running toward the Willow.

Harry's fists clenched as they watched Snape skid to a halt next to the tree, looking around. He (Snape) grabbed the cloak and held it up.

``Get your filthy hands off it,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry snarled under his (Harry) breath.
``Shh!'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)

Snape seized the branch Lupin had used to freeze the tree, prodded the knot, and vanished from view as he (Harry) put on the cloak.

``So that's it,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione quietly.
``We're all down there... and now we've just got to wait until we come back up again...'' (She)

She (Hermione) took the end of Buckbeak's rope and tied it securely around the nearest tree, then sat down on the dry ground, arms around her (Hermione) knees.

``Harry, there's something I don't understand... Why didn't the dementors get Sirius? I remember them coming, and then I think I passed out... there were so many of them...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry sat down too. He (Harry) explained what he (Harry)'d seen; how, as the nearest dementor had lowered its mouth to Harry's, a large silver something had come galloping across the lake and forced the dementors to retreat.

Hermione's mouth was slightly open by the time Harry had finished.

``But what was it?'' (unknown)

``There's only one thing it could have been, to make the dementors go,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.
``A real Patronus. A powerful one.'' (unknown)

``But who conjured it?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry didn't say anything. He (Harry) was thinking back to the person he (Harry)'d seen on the other bank of the lake. He (Harry) knew who he (Harry) thought it had been... but how could it have been?

``Didn't you see what they looked like?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione eagerly.
``Was it one of the teachers?'' (unknown)

``No,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.
``He (I) wasn't a teacher.'' (unknown)

``But it must have been a really powerful wizard, to drive all those dementors away... If the Patronus was shining so brightly, didn't it light him (wizard) up? Couldn't you see --?'' (unknown)

``Yeah, I saw him (wizard),'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry slowly.
``But... maybe I imagined it... I wasn't thinking straight... I passed out right afterward...'' (I)

``Who did you think it was?'' (I)

I think --

'' Harry swallowed, knowing how strange this was going to sound. I think it was my dad.'' (I)

Harry glanced up at Hermione and saw that her (Hermione) mouth was fully open now. She (Hermione) was gazing at him (Harry) with a mixture of alarm and pity.

``Harry, your dad's -- well -- dead,'' (she)
she (Hermione) said quietly.

``I know that,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry quickly.

``You think you saw his (Harry) ghost?'' (unknown)

``I don't know... no... he (Harry) looked solid...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``But then --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Maybe I was seeing things,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.
``But... from what I could see... it looked like him (Harry)... I've got photos of him (Harry)...'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Hermione was still looking at him (Harry) as though worried about his (Harry) sanity.

I know it sounds crazy,'' said Harry flatly. He (Harry) turned to took at Buckbeak, who was digging his (Harry) beak into the ground, apparently searching for worms. But he (Harry) wasn't really watching Buckbeak.

He (Harry) was thinking about his (Harry) father and about his (Harry) father's three oldest friends... Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot, and Prongs... Had all four of them been out on the grounds tonight? Wormtail had reappeared this evening when everyone had thought he (Wormtail) was dead... Was it so impossible his (Wormtail) father had done the same? Had he (Wormtail) been seeing things across the take? The figure had been too far away to see distinctly... yet he (Wormtail) had felt sure, for a moment, before he (Wormtail)'d lost consciousness...

The leaves overhead rustled faintly in the breeze. The moon drifted in and out of sight behind the shifting clouds. Hermione sat with her (Hermione) face turned toward the Willow, waiting.

And then, at last, after over an hour...

``Here we come!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whispered.

She (Hermione) and Harry got to their feet. Buckbeak raised his (Harry) head. They saw Lupin, Ron, and Pettigrew clambering awkwardly out of the hole in the roots. Then came Hermione... then the unconscious Snape, drifting weirdly upward. Next came Harry and Black. They all began to walk toward the castle.

Harry's heart was starting to beat very fast. He (Harry) glanced up at the sky. Any moment now, that cloud was going to move aside and show the moon...

``Harry,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione muttered as though she (Hermione) knew exactly what he (Harry) was thinking,
``we've got to stay put. We mustn't be seen. There's nothing we can do...'' (he)

``So we're just going to let Pettigrew escape all over again.. said Harry quietly.

``How do you expect to find a rat in the dark?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
snapped Hermione.
``There's nothing we can do! We came back to help Sirius; we're not supposed to be doing anything else!'' (unknown)

``All right!'' (unknown)

The moon slid out from behind its cloud. They saw the tiny figures across the grounds stop. Then they saw movement --

``There goes Lupin,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whispered. ``He (Sirius)'s transforming

``Hermione!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry suddenly.
``We've got to move!'' (unknown)

``We mustn't, I keep telling you --'' (unknown)

``Not to interfere! Lupin's going to run into the forest, right at us!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Hermione gasped.

``Quick!'' (she)
she (Hermione) moaned, dashing to untie Buckbeak.
``Quick! Where are we going to go? Where are we going to hide? The dementors wilt be coming any moment --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Back to Hagrid's!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry said.
``It's empty now -- come on!'' (Buckbeak)

They ran as fast as they could, Buckbeak cantering along behind them. They could hear the werewolf howling behind them...

The cabin was in sight; Harry skidded to the door, wrenched it open, and Hermione and Buckbeak flashed past him (Harry); Harry threw himself in after them and bolted the door. Fang the boarhound barked loudly.

``Shh, Fang, it's us!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione, hurrying over and scratching his (Harry) ears to quieten him (Harry).
``That was really close!'' (she)
she (Hermione) said to Harry.

``Yeah...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry was looking out of the window. It was much harder to see what was going on from here. Buckbeak seemed very happy to find himself back inside Hagrid's house. He (Harry) lay down in front of the fire, folded his (Harry) wings contentedly, and seemed ready for a good nap.

``I think I'd better go outside again, you know,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry slowly.
``I can't see what's going on -- we won't know when it's time --'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Hermione looked up. Her (Hermione) expression was suspicious.

``I'm not going to try and interfere,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry quickly.
``But if we don't see what's going on, how're we going to know when it's time to rescue Sirius?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Well... okay, then... I'll wait here with Buckbeak... but Harry, be careful -- there's a werewolf out there -- and the dementors

Harry stepped outside again and edged around the cabin. He (Harry) could hear yelping in the distance. That meant the dementors were closing in on Sirius... He (Harry) and Hermione would be running to him (Harry) any moment...

Harry stared out toward the lake, his (Harry) heart doing a kind of drumroll in his (Harry) chest... Whoever had sent that Patronus would be appearing at any moment...

For a fraction of a second he (Harry) stood, irresolute, in front of Hagrid's door. You must not be seen. But he (Harry) didn't want to be seen. He (Harry) wanted to do the seeing... He (Harry) had to know...

And there were the dementors. They were emerging out of the darkness from every direction, gliding around the edges of the lake... They were moving away from where Harry stood, to the opposite bank... He (Harry) wouldn't have to get near them...

Harry began to run. He (Harry) had no thought in his (Harry) head except his (Harry) father... If it was him (Harry)... if it really was him (Harry)... he (Harry) had to know, had to find out...

The lake was coming nearer and nearer, but there was no sign of anybody. On the opposite bank, he (Harry) could see tiny glimmers of silver -- his (Harry) own attempts at a Patronus --

There was a bush at the very edge of the water. Harry threw himself behind it, peering desperately through the leaves. On the opposite bank, the glimmers of silver were suddenly extinguished. A terrified excitement shot through him (Harry) -- any moment now --

``Come on!'' (him)
he (Harry) muttered, staring about.
``Where are you? Dad, come on --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

But no one came. Harry raised his (Harry) head to look at the circle of dementors across the lake. One of them was lowering its hood. It was time for the rescuer to appear -- but no one was coming to help this time --

And then it hit him (rescuer) -- he (rescuer) understood. He (rescuer) hadn't seen his (rescuer) father -- he (rescuer) had seen himself --

Harry flung himself out from behind the bush and pulled out his (Harry) wand.

``EXPECTO PATRONUM! ``he (Dad) yelled.

And out of the end of his (Dad) wand burst, not a shapeless cloud of mist, but a blinding, dazzling, silver animal. He (Dad) screwed up his (Dad) eyes, trying to see what it was. It looked like a horse. It was galloping silently away from him (Dad), across the black surface of the lake. He (Dad) saw it lower its head and charge at the swarming dementors... Now it was galloping around and around the black shapes on the ground, and the dementors were falling back, scattering, retreating into the darkness... They were gone.

The Patronus turned. It was cantering back toward Harry across the still surface of the water. It wasn't a horse. It wasn't a unicorn, either. It was a stag. It was shining brightly as the moon above ... it was coming back to him (Harry)...

It stopped on the bank. Its hooves made no mark on the soft ground as it stared at Harry with its large, silver eyes. Slowly, it bowed its antlered head. And Harry realized... ``Prongs, ``he (Harry) whispered.

But as his (Harry) trembling fingertips stretched toward the creature, it vanished.

Harry stood there, hand still outstretched. Then, with a great leap of his (Harry) heart, he (Harry) heard hooves behind him (Harry) -he (Harry) whirled around and saw Hermione dashing toward him (Harry), dragging Buckbeak behind her (Hermione).

``What did you do?'' (she)
she (Hermione) said fiercely.
``You said you were only going to keep a lookout!'' (unknown)

``I just saved all our lives...,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.
``Get behind here -- behind this bush -- I'll explain.'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Hermione listened to what had just happened with her (Hermione) mouth open yet again.

``Did anyone see you?'' (unknown)

``Yes, haven't you been listening? I saw me but I thought I was my dad! It's okay!'' (unknown)

``Harry, I can't believe it... You conjured up a Patronus that drove away all those dementors! That's very, very advanced magic. I knew I could do it this time,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry,
``because I'd already done it... Does that make sense?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``I don't know -- Harry, look at Snape!'' (bush)

Together they peered around the bush at the other bank. Snape had regained consciousness. He (Snape) was conjuring stretchers and lifting the limp forms of Harry, Hermione, and Black onto them. A fourth stretcher, no doubt bearing Ron, was already floating at his (Ron) side. Then, wand held out in front of him (Ron), he (Ron) moved them away toward the castle.

``Right, it's nearly time,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione tensely, looking at her (Hermione) watch. ``We've got about forty-five minutes until Dumbledore locks the door to the hospital wing. We've got to rescue Sirius and get back into the ward before anybody realizes we're missing... 11

They waited, watching the moving clouds reflected in the lake, while the bush next to them whispered in the breeze. Buckbeak, bored, was ferreting for worms again.

``D' you reckon he (Sirius)'s up there yet?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, checking his (Harry) watch. He (Harry) looked up at the castle and began counting the windows to the right of the West Tower.

``Look!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione whispered.
''\Who's that? Someone's coming back out of the castle!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Harry stared through the darkness. The man was hurrying across the grounds, toward one of the entrances. Something shiny glinted in his (Harry) belt.

``Macnair!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.
``The executioner! He (executioner)'s gone to get the dementors! This is it, Hermione --'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

Hermione put her (Hermione) hands on Buckbeak's back and Harry gave her (Hermione) a leg up. Then he (Harry) placed his (Harry) foot on one of the lower branches of the bush and climbed up in front of her (Hermione). He (Harry) pulled Buckbeak's rope back over his (Harry) neck and tied it to the other side of his (Harry) collar like reins.

``Ready?'' (he)
he (Harry) whispered to Hermione. ``YotM better hold on to me --

He (executioner) nudged Buckbeak's sides with his (executioner) heels.

Buckbeak soared straight into the dark air. Harry gripped his (Harry) flanks with his (Harry) knees, feeling the great wings rising powerfully beneath them. Hermione was holding Harry very tight around the waist; he (Harry) could hear her (Hermione) muttering,

``Oh, no -- I don't like this oh, I really don't like this --'' (he)

Harry urged Buckbeak forward. They were gliding quietly toward the upper floors of the castle... Harry pulled hard on the left-hand side of the rope, and Buckbeak turned. Harry was trying to count the windows flashing past --

``Whoa!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
he (Harry) said, pulling backward as hard as he (Harry) could.

Buckbeak slowed down and they found themselves at a stop, unless you counted the fact that they kept rising up and down several feet as the hippogriff beat his (Harry) wings to remain airborne.

``He (Harry)'s there!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry said, spotting Sirius as they rose up beside the window. He (Harry) reached out, and as Buckbeak's wings fell, was able to tap sharply on the glass.

Black looked up. Harry saw his (Harry) jaw drop. He (Harry) leapt from his (Harry) chair, hurried to the window and tried to open it, but it was locked.

``Stand back!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
Hermione called to him (Harry), and she (Hermione) took out her (Hermione) wand, still gripping the back of Harry's robes with her (Hermione) left hand.

``Alohomora!'' (unknown)

The window sprang open.

``How -- how --?'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Black weakly, staring at the hippogriff

``Get on -- there's not much time,'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)
said Harry, gripping Buckbeak firmly on either side of his (Harry) sleek neck to hold him (Harry) steady.
``You've got to get out of here -the dementors are coming -- Macnair's gone to get them.'' (unknown)

Black placed a hand on either side of the window frame and heaved his (Harry) head and shoulders out of it. It was very lucky he (Harry) was so thin. In seconds, he (Harry) had managed to fling one leg over Buckbeak's back and pull himself onto the hippogriff behind Hermione.

``Okay, Buckbeak, up!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, shaking the rope. ``Up to the tower -- come on.

The hippogriff gave one sweep of its mighty wings and they were soaring upward again, high as the top of the West Tower. Buckbeak landed with a clatter on the battlements, and Harry and Hermione slid off him (Harry) at once.

``Sirius, you'd better go, quick,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry panted.
``They'll reach Flitwick's office any moment, they'll find out you're gone.'' (Buckbeak)

Buckbeak pawed the ground, tossing his (Harry) sharp head.

``What happened to the other boy? Ron?'' (unknown)
croaked Sirius.

``He (Ron)'s going to be okay. He (Ron)'s still out of it, but Madam Pomfrey says she (Pomfrey)'ll be able to make him (Ron) better. Quick -- go --'' (Black/Sirius/Sirius Black)

But Black was still staring down at Harry.

``How can I ever thank --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``GO!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry and Hermione shouted together.

Black wheeled Buckbeak around, facing the open sky.

``We'll see each other again,'' (he)
he (Harry) said.
``You are -- truly your father's son, Harry...'' (He)

He (Harry) squeezed Buckbeak's sides with his (Harry) heels. Harry and Hermione jumped back as the enormous wings rose once more... The hippogriff took off into the air... He (Harry) and his (Harry) rider became smaller and smaller as Harry gazed after them... then a cloud drifted across the moon... They were gone.

CHAPTER TWENTY-TWO

OWL POST AGAIN

Harry!''

Hermione was tugging at his (Harry) sleeve, staring at her (Hermione) watch.

``We've got exactly ten minutes to get back down to the hospital wing without anybody seeing us -- before Dumbledore locks the door --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``Okay,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, wrenching his (Harry) gaze from the sky,
``let's go...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

They slipped through the doorway behind them and down a tightly spiraling stone staircase. As they reached the bottom of it, they heard voices. They flattened themselves against the wall and listened. It sounded like Fudge and Snape. They were walking quickly along the corridor at the foot of the staircase.

''... only hope Dumbledore's not going to make difficulties,'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)
Snape was saying.
``The Kiss will be performed immediately?'' (unknown)

``As soon as Macnair returns with the dementors. This whole Black affair has been highly embarrassing. I can't tell you how much I'm looking forward to informing the Daily Prophet that we've got him (Prophet) at last... I daresay they'll want to interview you, Snape... and once young Harry's back in his (Harry) right mind, I expect he (Harry)'ll want to tell the Prophet exactly how you saved him (Harry)...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry clenched his (Harry) teeth. He (Harry) caught a glimpse of Snape's smirk as he (Harry) and Fudge passed Harry and Hermione's hiding place. Their footsteps died away. Harry and Hermione waited a few moments to make sure they'd really gone, then started to run in the opposite direction. Down one staircase, then another, along a new ,corridor -- then they heard a cackling ahead.

``Peeves!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry muttered, grabbing Hermione's wrist.
``In here!'' (unknown)

They tore into a deserted classroom to their left just in time. Peeves seemed to be bouncing along the corridor in boisterous good spirits, laughing his (Harry) head off.

``Oh, he (Harry)'s horrible,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
whispered Hermione, her (Hermione) ear to the door.
``I bet he (Harry)'s all excited because the dementors are going to finish off Sirius...'' (She)
She (Hermione) checked her (Hermione) watch.
``Three minutes, Harry!'' (unknown)

They waited until Peeves's gloating voice had faded into the distance, then slid back out of the room and broke into a run again.

``Hermione -- what'll happen -- if we don't get back inside before Dumbledore locks the door?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry panted.

I don't want to think about it!'' Hermione moaned, checking her (Hermione) watch again.

``One minute!'' (unknown)

They had reached the end of the corridor with the hospital wing entrance.

``Okay -- I can hear Dumbledore,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione tensely.
``Come on, Harry!'' (unknown)

They crept along the corridor. The door opened. Dumbledore's back appeared.

``I am going to lock you in,'' (him)
they heard him (Dumbledore) saying.
``it is five minutes to midnight. Miss Granger, three turns should do It. Good luck.'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)

Dumbledore backed out of the room, closed the door, and took out his (Dumbledore) wand to magically lock it. Panicking, Harry and Hermione ran forward. Dumbledore looked up, and a wide smile appeared under the long silver mustache.

``Well?'' (he)
he (Harry) said quietly.

``We did it!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry breathlessly.
``Sirius has gone, on Buckbeak...'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)

Dumbledore beamed at them.

``Well done. I think --'' (He)
He (Dumbledore) listened intently for any sound within the hospital wing.
``Yes, I think you've gone too -- get inside -- I'll lock you in --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry and Hermione slipped back inside the dormitory. It was empty except for Ron, who was still lying motionless in the end bed. As the lock clicked behind them, Harry and Hermione crept back to their own beds, Hermione tucking the Time-Turner back under her (Hermione) robes. A moment later, Madam Pomfrey came striding back out of her (Pomfrey) office.

``Did I hear the headmaster leaving? Am I allowed to look after my patients now?'' (She)

She (Pomfrey) was in a very bad mood. Harry and Hermione thought it best to accept their chocolate quietly. Madam Pomfrey stood over them, making sure they ate it. But Harry could hardly swallow. He (Harry) and Hermione were waiting, listening, their nerves jangling... And then, as they both took a fourth piece of chocolate from Madam Pomfrey, they heard a distant roar of fury echoing from somewhere above them...

``What was that?'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Madam Pomfrey in alarm.

Now they could hear angry voices, growing louder and louder. Madam Pomfrey was staring at the door.

``Really -- they'll wake everybody up! What do they think they're doing?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry was trying to hear what the voices were saying. They were drawing nearer --

``He (headmaster) must have Disapparated, Severus. We should have left somebody in the room with him (headmaster). When this gets out --'' (unknown)

``HE (headmaster) DIDN``T DISAPPARATE!'' Snape roared, now very close at hand. ``YOU CAN

``T APPARATE OR DISAPPARATE INSIDE THIS CASTLE! THIS -- HAS -- SOMETHING -- TO -- DO -- WITH -- POTTER!'' (unknown)

``Severus -- be reasonable -- Harry has been locked up --'' (unknown)

BAM.

The door of the hospital wing burst open.

Fudge, Snape, and Dumbledore came striding into the ward. Dumbledore alone looked calm. Indeed, he (Dumbledore) looked as though he (Dumbledore) was quite enjoying himself. Fudge appeared angry. But Snape was beside himself.

``OUT WITH IT, POTTER!'' (he)
he (Snape) bellowed.
``WHAT DID YOU DO?'' (unknown)

``Professor Snape!'' (unknown)
shrieked Madam Pomfrey.
``Control yourself!'' (unknown)

``See here, Snape, be reasonable,'' (Fudge)
said Fudge.
``This door's been locked, we just saw --'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)

``THEY HELPED HIM ESCAPE, I KNOW IT!'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)
Snape howled, pointing at Harry and Hermione. His (Harry) face was twisted; spit was flying from his (Harry) mouth.

``Calm down, man!'' (Fudge)
Fudge barked.
``You're talking nonsense!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``YOU DON``T KNOW POTTER!'' shrieked Snape.

``HE (POTTER) DID IT, I KNOW HE (POTTER) DID IT --'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)

``That will do, Severus,'' (HE)
said Dumbledore quietly.
``Think about what you are saying. This door has been locked since I left the ward ten minutes ago. Madam Pomfrey, have these students left their beds?'' (unknown)

``Of course not!'' (Madam Pomfrey)
said Madam Pomfrey, bristling.
``I would have heard them!'' (unknown)

``Well, there you have it, Severus,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore calmly.
``Unless you are suggesting that Harry and Hermione are able to be in two places at once, I'm afraid I don't see any point in troubling them further.'' (Snape/Severus/Severus Snape)

Snape stood there, seething, staring from Fudge, who looked thoroughly shocked at his (Snape) behavior, to Dumbledore, whose eyes were twinkling behind his (Dumbledore) glasses. Snape whirled about, robes swishing behind him (Snape), and stormed out of the ward.

``Fellow seems quite unbalanced,'' (Fudge)
said Fudge, staring after him (Snape).
``I'd watch out for him (Fellow) if I were you, Dumbledore.'' (unknown)

``Oh, he (Dumbledore)'s not unbalanced,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore quietly.
``He (Dumbledore)'s just suffered a severe disappointment.'' (unknown)

``He (Dumbledore)'s not the only one!'' (Fudge)
puffed Fudge. ``The Daily Prophet's going to have a field day! We had Black cornered and he (Black) slipped through our fingers yet again! All it needs now is for the story of that hippogriff's escape to get out, and I'll be a laughingstock! Well... I'd better go and notify the Ministry...

``And the dementors?'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore.
``They'll be removed from the school, I trust?'' (unknown)

``Oh yes, they'll have to go,'' (Fudge)
said Fudge, running his (Dumbledore) fingers

distractedly through his (Dumbledore) hair.

``Never dreamed they'd attempt to administer the Kiss on an innocent boy... Completely out of control... no, I'll have them packed off back to Azkaban tonight... Perhaps we should think about dragons at the school entrance...'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)

``Hagrid would like that,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore, smiling at Harry and Hermione. As he (Dumbledore) and Fudge left the dormitory, Madam Pomfrey hurried to the door and locked it again. Muttering angrily to herself, she (Pomfrey) headed back to her (Pomfrey) office.

There was a low moan from the other end of the ward. Ron had woken up. They could see him (Ron) sitting up, rubbing his (Ron) head, looking around.

``What -- what happened?'' (he)
he (Ron) groaned.
``Harry? Why are we in here? Where's Sirius? Where's Lupin? What's going on?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry and Hermione looked at each other.

``You explain,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, helping himself to some more chocolate.

When Harry, Ron, and Hermione left the hospital wing at noon the next day, it was to find an almost deserted castle. The sweltering, heat and the end of the exams meant that everyone was taking full advantage of another Hogsmeade visit. Neither Ron nor Hermione felt like going, however, so they and Harry wandered onto the grounds, still talking about the extraordinary events of the previous night and wondering where Sirius and Buckbeak were now. Sitting near the lake, watching the giant squid waving its tentacles lazily above the water, Harry lost the thread of the conversation as he (Harry) looked across to the opposite bank. The stag had galloped toward him (Harry) from there just last night...

A shadow fell across them and they looked `tip to see a very bleary-eyed Hagrid, mopping his (Harry) sweaty face with one of his (Harry) tablecloth-sized handkerchiefs and beaming down at them.

``Know I shouldn' feel happy, after wha' happened las' night,'' (he)
he (Harry) said.
``I mean, Black escapin' again, an, everythin' -- but guess what?'' (unknown)

``What?'' (unknown)
they said, pretending to look curious.

``Beaky! He (Harry) escaped! He (Harry)'s free! Bin celebratin' all night!'' (unknown)

``That's wonderful!'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione, giving Ron a reproving look because he (Ron) looked as though he (Ron) was close to laughing.

``Yeah... can't've tied him (Harry) up properly,'' (Hagrid)
said Hagrid, gazing happily out over the grounds.
``I was worried this mornin', mind... thought he (Harry) mighta met Professor Lupin on the grounds, but Lupin says he (Harry) never ate anythin' las' night...'' (unknown)

``What?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry quickly.

``Blimey, haven' yeh heard?'' (Hagrid)
said Hagrid, his (Harry) smile fading a little. He (Harry) lowered his (Harry) voice, even though there was nobody in sight. ``Er -- Snape told all the Slytherins this mornin'... Thought everyone'd know by now... Professor Lupin's a werewolf, see. An' he (Professor) was loose on the grounds las' night... He (Professor)'s packin' now, o' course.

``He (Professor)'s packing?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, alarmed.
``Why?'' (unknown)

``Leavin', isn' he (Professor)?'' (Hagrid)
said Hagrid, looking surprised that Harry had to ask. ``Resigned firs' thing this mornin'. Says he (Professor) can't risk it happenin again.

Harry scrambled to his (Harry) feet.

``I'm going to see him (Harry),'' (he)
he (Harry) said to Ron and Hermione.

``But if he (Harry)'s resigned --'' (unknown)

''-- doesn't sound like there's anything we can do --'' (unknown)

``I don't care. I still want to see him (Harry). I'll meet you back here.'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

Lupin's office door was open. He (Harry) had already packed most of his (Harry) things. The grindylow's empty tank stood next to his (Harry) battered old suitcase, which was open and nearly full. Lupin was bending over something on his (Harry) desk and looked up only when Harry knocked on the door.

``I saw you coming,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, smiling. He (Harry) pointed to the parchment he (Harry) had been poring over. It was the Marauder's Map.

``I just saw Hagrid,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.
``And he (Harry) said you'd resigned. It's not true, is it?'' (unknown)

``I'm afraid it is,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin. He (Harry) started opening his (Harry) desk drawers and taking out the contents.

``Why?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.
``The Ministry of Magic don't think you were helping Sirius, do they?'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

Lupin crossed to the door and closed it behind Harry.

``No. Professor Dumbledore managed to convince Fudge that I was trying to save your lives.'' (He)
He (Harry) sighed.
``That was the final straw for Severus. I think the loss of the Order of Merlin hit him (Merlin) hard. So he (Merlin) -- er -- accidentally let slip that I am a werewolf this morning at breakfast.'' (unknown)

``You're not leaving just because of that!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.

Lupin smiled wryly.

``This time tomorrow, the owls will start arriving from parents... They will not want a werewolf teaching their children, Harry. And after last night, I see their point. I could have bitten any of you... That must never happen again.'' (unknown)

``You're the best Defense Against the Dark Arts- teacher we've ever had!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.
``Don't go!'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

Lupin shook his (Harry) head and didn't speak. He (Harry) carried on emptying his (Harry) drawers. Then, while Harry was trying to think of a good argument to make him (Harry) stay, Lupin said,

``From what the headmaster told me this morning, you saved a lot of lives last night, Harry. if I'm proud of anything I've done this year, it's how much you've learned... Tell me about your Patronus.'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

``How d'you know about that?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry, distracted.

``What else could have driven the dementors back?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry told Lupin what had happened. When he (Harry)'d finished, Lupin was smiling again.

``Yes, your father was always a stag when he (father) transformed,'' (he)
he (Harry) said.
``You guessed right... that's why we called him (father) Prongs.'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

Lupin threw his (Harry) last few books into his (Harry) case, closed the desk drawers, and turned to look at Harry.

``Here -- I brought this from the Shrieking Shack last night,'' (he)
he (Harry) said, handing Harry back the Invisibility Cloak.
``And...'' (He)
He (Harry) hesitated, then held out the Marauder's Map too.
``I am no longer your teacher, so I don't feel guilty about giving you back this as well. It's no use to me, and I daresay you, Ron, and Hermione will find uses for it.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry took the map and grinned.

``You told me Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot, and Prongs would've wanted to lure me out of school... you said they'd have thought it was funny.'' (unknown)

``And so we would have,'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)
said Lupin, now reaching down to close his (Harry) case.
``I have no hesitation in saying that James would have been highly disappointed if his (James) son had never found any of the secret passages out of the castle.'' (unknown)

There was a knock on the door. Harry hastily stuffed the Marauder's Map and the Invisibility Cloak into his (Harry) pocket.

It was Professor Dumbledore. He (Harry) didn't look surprised to see Harry there.

``Your carriage is at the gates, Remus,'' (he)
he (Harry) said.

``Thank You, Headmaster.'' (Lupin/R. J. Lupin)

Lupin picked up his (Harry) old suitcase and the empty grindylow tank.

``Well -- good-bye, Harry,'' (he)
he (Harry) said, smiling.
``It has been a real pleasure teaching you. I feel sure we'll meet again sometime. Headmaster, there is no need to see me to the gates, I can manage...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry had the impression that Lupin wanted to leave as quickly as possible.

``Good-bye, then, Remus,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore soberly. Lupin shifted the grindylow tank slightly so that he (Dumbledore) and Dumbledore could shake hands. Then, with a final nod to Harry and a swift smile, Lupin left the office.

Harry sat down in his (Harry) vacated chair, staring glumly at the floor. He (Harry) heard the door close and looked up. Dumbledore was still there.

``Why so miserable, Harry?'' (he)
he (Dumbledore) said quietly.
``You should be very proud of yourself after last night.'' (unknown)

``It didn't make any difference,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry bitterly.
``Pettigrew got away.'' (unknown)

``Didn't make any difference?'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore quietly,
``It made all the difference in the world, Harry. You helped uncover the truth. You saved an innocent man from a terrible fate.'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)

Terrible. Something stirred in Harry's memory. Greater and more terrible than ever before... Professor Trelawney's prediction!

``Professor Dumbledore -- yesterday, when I was having my Divination exam, Professor Trelawney went very -- very strange.'' (unknown)

``Indeed?'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore.
``Er -- stranger than usual, you mean?'' (unknown)

``Yes... her (yourself) voice went all deep and her (yourself) eyes rolled and she (yourself) said ... she (yourself) said Voldemort's servant was going to set out to return to him (servant) before midnight... She (yourself) said the servant would help him (servant) come back to power.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry stared up at Dumbledore.
``And then she (yourself) sort of became normal again, and she (yourself) couldn't remember anything she (yourself)'d said. Was it -- was she (yourself) making a real prediction?'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)

Dumbledore looked mildly impressed.

``Do you know, Harry, I think she (yourself) might have been.'' (he)
he (Harry) said thoughtfully.
``Who'd have thought it? That brings her (yourself) total of real predictions up to two. I should offer her (yourself) a pay raise...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``But --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
Harry looked at him (Harry), aghast. How could Dumbledore take this so calmly?

``But -- I stopped Sirius and Professor Lupin from killing Pettigrew! That makes it my fault if Voldemort comes back!'' (unknown)

``It does not,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore quietly.
``Hasn't your experience with the Time-Turner taught you anything, Harry? The consequences of our actions are always so complicated, so diverse, that predicting the future is a very difficult business indeed... Professor Trelawney, bless her (yourself), is living proof of that... You did a very noble thing, in saving Pettigrew's life.'' (unknown)

``But if he (Pettigrew) helps Voldemort back to power

``Pettigrew owes his (Pettigrew) life to you. You have sent Voldemort a deputy who is in your debt... When one wizard saves another wizard's life, it creates a certain bond between them... and I'm much mistaken if Voldemort wants his (Voldemort) servant in the debt of Harry Potter.'' (unknown)

``I don't want a connection with Pettigrew!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry.
``He (Pettigrew) betrayed my parents!'' (unknown)

``This is magic at its deepest, its most impenetrable, Harry. But trust me... the time may come when you will be very glad you saved Pettigrew's life.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry couldn't imagine when that would be. Dumbledore looked as though he (Harry) knew what Harry was thinking.

``I knew your father very well, both at Hogwarts and later, Harry,'' (he)
he (Harry) said gently.
``He (Harry) would have saved Pettigrew too, I am sure of it.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry looked up at him (Harry). Dumbledore wouldn't laugh -- he (Dumbledore) could tell Dumbledore...

``I thought it was my dad who'd conjured my Patronus. I mean, when I saw myself across the lake ... I thought I was seeing him (dad).'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
``An easy mistake to make,'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)
said Dumbledore softly. ``I expect you'll tire of hearing it, but you do look extraordinarily like James. Except for the eyes... you have your mother's eyes.

Harry shook his (Harry) head.

``It was stupid, thinking it was him (Harry),'' (he)
he (Dumbledore) muttered.
``I mean, I knew he (Harry) was dead.'' (unknown)

``You think the dead we loved ever truly leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly than ever in times of great trouble? Your father is alive in you, Harry, and shows himself most plainly when you have need of him (Harry). How else could you produce that particular Patronus? Prongs rode again last night.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

It took a moment for Harry to realize what Dumblefore had said.

Last night Sirius told me all about how they became Animagi,'' said Dumbledore, smiling.

``An extraordinary achievement -- not least, keeping it quiet from me. And then I remembered the most unusual form your Patronus took, when it charged Mr. Malfoy down at your Quidditch match against Ravenclaw. You know, Harry, in a way, you did see your father last night... You found him (Harry) inside yourself.'' (Dumbledore/Albus Dumbledore)

And Dumbledore left the office, leaving Harry to his (Harry) very confused thoughts.

Nobody at Hogwarts now knew the truth of what had happened the night that Sirius, Buckbeak, and Pettigrew had vanished except Harry, Ron, Hermione, and Professor Dumbledore. As the end of term approached, Harry heard many different theories about what had really happened, but none of them came close to the truth.

Malfoy was furious about Buckbeak. He (Malfoy) was convinced that Hagrid had found a way of smuggling the hippogriff to safety, and seemed outraged that he (Malfoy) and his (Malfoy) father had been outwitted by a gamekeeper. Percy Weasley, meanwhile, had much to say on the subject of Sirius's escape.

``If I manage to get into the Ministry, I'll have a lot of proposals to make about Magical Law Enforcement!'' (he)
he (Sirius) told the only person who would listen -- his (Sirius) girlfriend, Penelope.

Though the weather was perfect, though the atmosphere was so

cheerful, though he (Sirius) knew they had achieved the near impossible in helping Sirius to freedom, Harry had never approached the end of a school year in worse spirits.

He (Harry) certainly wasn't the only one who was sorry to see Professor Lupin go. The whole of Harry's Defense Against the Dark Arts class was miserable about his (Harry) resignation.

``Wonder what they'll give us next year?'' (Seamus Finnigan/Seamus)
said Seamus Finnigan gloomily.

``Maybe a vampire,'' (Dean Thomas/Dean)
suggested Dean Thomas hopefully.

It wasn't only Professor Lupin's departure that was weighing on Harry's mind. He (Harry) couldn't help thinking a lot about Professor Trelawney's prediction. He (Professor) kept wondering where Pettigrew was now, whether he (Pettigrew) had sought sanctuary with Voldemort yet. But the thing that was lowering Harry's spirits most of all was the prospect of returning to the Dursleys. For maybe half an hour, a glorious half hour, he (Harry) had believed he (Harry) would be living with Sirius from now on... his (Sirius) parents' best friend... It would have been the next best thing to having his (Sirius) own father back. And while no news of Sirius was definitely good news, because it meant he (Sirius) had successfully gone into hiding, Harry couldn't help feeling miserable when he (Harry) thought of the home he (Harry) might have had, and the fact that it was now impossible.

The exam results came out on the last day of term. Harry, Ron, and Hermione had passed every subject. Harry was amazed that he (Harry) had got through Potions. He (Harry) had a shrewd suspicion that Dumbledore might have stepped in to stop Snape failing him (Snape) on purpose. Snape's behavior toward Harry over the past week had been quite alarming. Harry wouldn't have thought it possible that Snape's dislike for him (Harry) could increase, but it certainly had. A muscle twitched unpleasantly at the corner of Snape's thin mouth every time he (Snape) looked at Harry, and he (Harry) was constantly flexing his (Harry) fingers, as though itching to place them around Harry's throat.

Percy had got his (Harry) top-grade N.E.W.T.s; Fred and George had scraped a handful of O.W.L.s each. Gryffindor House, meanwhile, largely thanks to their spectacular performance in the Quidditch Cup, had won the House championship for the third year running. This meant that the end of term feast took place amid decorations of scarlet and gold, and that the Gryffindor table was the noisiest of the lot, as everybody celebrated. Even Harry managed to forget about the journey back to the Dursleys the next day as he (Harry) ate, drank, talked, and laughed with the rest.

As the Hogwarts Express pulled out of the station the next mornIng, Hermione gave Harry and Ron some surprising news.

``I went to see Professor McGonagall this morning, just before breakfast. I've decided to drop Muggle Studies.'' (unknown)

``But you passed your exam with three hundred and twenty percent!'' (Ron)
said Ron.

``I know,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
sighed Hermione,
``but I can't stand another year like this one. That Time-Turner, it was driving me mad. I've handed it in. Without Muggle Studies and Divination, I'll be able to have a normal schedule again.'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

I still can't believe you didn't tell us about it,'' said Ron grumpily.

``We're supposed to be your friends.'' (unknown)

``I promised I wouldn't tell anyone,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione severely. She (Hermione) looked around at Harry, who was watching Hogwarts disappear from view behind a mountain. Two whole months before he (Harry)'d see it again...

``Oh, cheer up, Harry!'' (he)
said Hermione sadly.

``I'm okay,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry quickly.
``Just thinking about the holidays.'' (unknown)

``Yeah, I've been thinking about them too,'' (Ron)
said Ron.
``Harry, you've got to come and stay with us. I'll fix it up with Mum and Dad, then I'll call you. I know how to use a fellytone now --'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)

``A telephone, Ron,'' (Hermione/HERMIONE)
said Hermione.
``Honestly, you should take Muggle Studies next year...'' (Ron)

Ron *ignored her (Hermione).

``It's the Quidditch World Cup this summer! How about it, Harry? Come and stay, and we'll go and see it! Dad can usually get tickets from work.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

This proposal had the effect of cheering Harry up a great deal.

``Yeah... I bet the Dursleys'd be pleased to let me come... especially after what I did to Aunt Marge...'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Feeling considerably more cheerful, Harry joined Ron and Hermione in several games of Exploding Snap, and when the witch with the tea cart arrived, he (Harry) bought himself a very large lunch, though nothing with chocolate in it.

But it was late in the afternoon before the thing that made him (Harry) truly happy turned up...

``Harry,'' (him)
said Hermione suddenly, peering over his (Harry) shoulder.
``What's that thing outside your window?'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry turned to look outside. Something very small and gray was bobbing in and out of sight beyond the glass. He (Harry) stood up for a better look and saw that it was a tiny owl, carrying a letter that was much too big for it. The owl was so small, in fact, that it kept tumbling over in the air, buffeted this way and that in the train's slipstream. Harry quickly pulled down the window, stretched out his (Harry) arm, and caught it. It felt like a very fluffy Snitch. He (Harry) brought it carefully inside. The owl dropped its letter onto Harry's seat and began zooming around their compartment, apparently very pleased with itself for accomplishing its task. Hedwig clicked her (Hedwig) beak with a sort of dignified disapproval. Crookshanks sat up in his (Harry) seat, following the owl with his (Harry) great yellow eyes. Ron, noticing this, snatched the owl safely out of harm's way.

Harry picked up the letter. It was addressed to him (Harry). He (Harry) ripped open the letter, and shouted,

``It's from Sirius!'' (He)

``What?'' (Ron)
said Ron and Hermione excitedly.
``Read it aloud!'' (Dear Harry)

Dear Harry,

I hope this finds you before you reach your aunt and uncle. I don't know whether they're used to owl post.

Buckbeak and I are in hiding. I won't tell you where, in case this owl falls into the wrong hands. I have some doubt about his (Harry) reliability, but he (Harry) is the best I could find, and he (Harry) did seem eager for the job.

I believe the dementors are still searching for me, but they haven't a hope of finding me here. I am planning to allow some Muggles to glimpse me soon, a long way from Hogwarts, so that the security on the castle will be lifted.

There is something I never got around to telling you during our brief meeting. It was I who sent you the Firebolt --

``Ha!'' (I)
said Hermione triumphantly.
``See! I told you it was from him (Harry)!'' (unknown)

``Yes, but he (Harry) hadn't jinxed it, had he (Harry)?'' (Ron)
said Ron.
``Ouch!'' (unknown)
The tiny owl, now hooting happily in his (Ron) hand, had nibbled one of his (Ron) fingers in what it seemed to think was an affectionate way.

Crookshanks took the order to the Owl Office for me. I used your name but told them to take the gold from my own Gringotts vault. Please consider it as thirteen birthdays' worth of presents from your godfather.

I would also like to apologize for the fright I think I gave you that night last year when you left your uncle's house. I had only hoped to get a glimpse of you before starting my journey north, but I think the sight of me alarmed you.

I am enclosing something else for you, which I think will make your next year at Hogwarts more enjoyable.

If ever you need me, send word. Your owl will find me.

I'll write again soon.

Sirius

Harry looked eagerly inside the envelope. There was another piece of parchment in there. He (Harry) read it through quickly and felt suddenly as warm and contented as though he (Harry)'d swallowed a bottle of hot butterbeer in one gulp.

I, Sirius Black, Harry Potter's godfather, hereby give him (Black) permission to visit Hogsmeade on weekends.

``That'll be good enough for Dumbledore!'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry happily. He (Harry) looked back at Sirius's letter.
``Hang on, there's a RS...'' (I)

I thought your ftiend Ron might like to keep this owl, as it's my fault he (Ron) no longer has a rat.

Ron's eyes widened. The minute owl was still hooting excitedly.

``Keep him (Dumbledore)?'' (he)
he (Ron) said uncertainly. He (Ron) looked closely at the owl for a moment; then, to Harry's and Hermione's great surprise, he (Harry) held him (Harry) out for Crookshanks to sniff.

``What do you reckon?'' (Ron)
Ron asked the cat.
``Definitely an owl?'' (Crookshanks)

Crookshanks purred.

``That's good enough for me,'' (Ron)
said Ron happily.
``He (Dumbledore)'s mine.'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

Harry read and reread the letter from Sirius all the way back into King's Cross station. It was still clutched tightly in his (Harry) hand as he (Harry), Ron, and Hermione stepped back through the barrier of platform nine an-LRB-' three-quarters. Harry spotted Uncle Vernon at once. He (Harry) was standing a good distance from Mr. and Mrs. Weasley, eyeing them suspiciously, and when Mrs. Weasley hugged Harry in greeting, his (Harry) worst suspicions about them seemed confirmed.

``I'll call about the World Cup!'' (Ron)
Ron yelled after Harry as Harry bid him (Harry) and Hermione good-bye, then wheeled the trolley bearing his (Harry) trunk and Hedwig's cage toward Uncle Vernon, who greeted him (Vernon) in his (Vernon) usual fashion.

``What's that?'' (he)
he (Vernon) snarled, staring at the envelope Harry was still clutching in his (Harry) hand.
``If it's another form for me to sign, you've got another --'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)

``It's not,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry cheerfully.
``It's a letter from my godfather.'' (unknown)

``Godfather?'' (Uncle)
sputtered Uncle Vernon.
``You haven't got a godfather!'' (unknown)

``Yes, I have,'' (Harry/Potter/Harry Potter)
said Harry brightly.
``He (godfather) was my mum and dad's best friend. He (godfather)'s a convicted murderer, but he (godfather)'s broken out of wizard prison and he (godfather)'s on the run. He (godfather) likes to keep in touch with me, though... keep up with my news... check if I'm happy...'' (Uncle)

And, grinning broadly at the look of horror on Uncle Vernon's face, Harry set off toward the station exit, Hedwig rattling along in front of him (Harry), for what looked like a much better summer than the last.

THE END
